story:
“The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new.”

 

No one wants to be wasteful. We understand you care about healthy food and a cleaner planet.

But how can you achieve this when every grocery store you step foot in, still pushes you toward plastic packaging and over-branded, processed food? Stores, who are themselves contributing to the yearly 43 BILLION POUNDS of food waste thrown out before it even makes it to the shelf for you to purchase? It’s a problem that needs attention.

        

We have a solution - Meet Roots Zero Waste Market! A neighborhood, plastic package-free, bulk grocery store and zero waste café. We’re not only helping you live lighter with convenience, we are changing the future of our food service industry by eliminating waste through our unique in-house zero waste system!

The first in the Northwest, Roots is a neighborhood grocery store and café offering healthy bulk foods, household cleaning products, personal care products, full service deli items and fresh prepared meals, to shoppers looking for plastic-free, sustainably sourced and ethically manufactured products. At Roots, you buy the amount you need when you need it, so you can feel good about saving money while helping to reduce food and food-packaging waste.

Our welcoming atmosphere and friendly, knowledgeable staff are ready to provide you:

  • Idaho grown and organically cultivated produce (upon availability)
  • A variety of non-toxic bulk dry goods including flours, grains, beans and oils
  • Locally sourced dairy items and eggs
  • Environmentally friendly household products and personal care products
  • Freshly prepared sandwiches, salads, and entrees with meat, vegetarian and vegan options
  • Fresh-roasted coffee, pressed juice, botanical soda and local beer, cider and wine to enjoy while you shop
  • Free community space for nonprofits and groups to host meetings and events
  • Free educational/informational sessions on healthy living and zero-waste practices and food preparation tips

We make bulk-shopping for food and household items easy as 1-2-3: Simply weigh, fill & pay!

                     

  1. Weigh

Bring in your clean container, jar or bag from home (or purchase any one of a number of available jars or bags) and weigh it on our self-service scales so we can deduct the weight at check-out!

  1. Label & Fill

Label your container and fill it with your favorite food or good.

  1. Pay

Pay with cash, check or credit card and feel great about saving money, reducing plastic packaging materials and food waste by buying exactly what you need, when you need it!

We are committed to bringing healthy, affordable foods and products to your family because building strong communities begins with healthy bodies and minds. We vow to work carefully with growers and vendors to provide you with toxin-free products, and we will gladly let you know where your food originated.

We have secured our store location, in the heart of Garden City at 34th and Chinden Blvd. Situated just outside the Boise Downtown corridor, steps away from the Boise River & Whitewater Park, Roots is centrally located to serve the Treasure Valley.

We can't wait to open our doors but we can't do it without you! Our building is a blank slate - just waiting for us to finish its transformation. Your contributions will go a long way in opening our store, creating new employment and furthering our mission.

Every Penny (minus perks and fees to Indiegogo) go directly to help us:

  • Complete construction of the café (cooking vents & fire suppression)
  • Add interior walls, exterior doors and outdoor seating.
  • Procure and build stainless steel bulk bins and bulk shelving
  • Install Contronics Dry Mist System for vegetable preservation

We have an estimated budget of $300,000 for construction, initial stocking and operating expenses. We are asking your help to raise a third of these costs or more if we should be so fortunate!

Our goal is set up as “flexible” through Indiegogo, which means if we don’t meet the requested goal, for a fee of 6%, we are still able to receive donated funds to support our project.

Lea and Zach have invested their heart, soul, and savings into this project because they truly want to make a forever change to our plastic and food waste problem and lead the way to fixing our ailing food system.

If you can't make a contribution today, please share our campaign with your friends, family, neighbors, and anyone else who will listen!

Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world by using their voice. Share us on social media and follow us at @rootszerowastemarket for updates on the campaign, opening, and the zero waste movement!

Check out all of the rewards on the right side of this webpage and give a little (or a lot)! Aside from tackling waste, we are highly committed to giving back and creating a hub for our community to enjoy, learn and grow with us on our journey to a more fulfilling, healthy and engaged way of living. This is why we are offering not only Individual rewards but Partnership Perks, where we are benefiting the good works of local non-profits who share these common goals:

  • Food security for all
  • Youth empowerment through education
  • Environmental protection

 

  • Please share this campaign with as many people as you can! Post it on social media and email or chat with your friends and family about it.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the love!
  • Have a question, want to help in other ways?  email us at: info@zerowastemarket.com or contact us through our website: www.rootszerowastemarket.com 
  • Lastly, try one of the free tips below, to start living lighter for the Planet & Yourself
    •  Refuse plastic bags.
      • Bring your own reusable bag, use your pockets or your purse or juggle your way through the parking lot.
      • Australia recently banned plastic grocery bags for 3 Months and reduced plastic consumption by 80%!
      • Refuse single-use plastics and stay resolved to do so - permanently
    • ReUse…everything you can
      • Bring your own container or bag to bulk stores.
      • Find a second or third or tenth “life” for something you may have previously recycled until it’s spent.
      • Repair what can still be used and just needs a fix
    • Reduce what you do need and find ways to make less waste.
      • Americans waste an average of 23% of the food they buy and throw away 185 lbs of plastic per year.
      • Become friends with a re-usable water bottle, buy only the amount of food you need, take your own silverware and ditch the plastic fork when eating take away or convenience foods.
    • Rot and regenerate the soil
      • Make a compost bin in the yard or worm bin in the house
      • When taken to the landfill, food scraps create greenhouse gasses that account for 8% of greenhouse gas released into the current atmosphere. Cutting down on food waste could have nearly the same impact on reducing emissions over the next three decades as onshore wind turbines
    • Recycle when you can’t refuse or re-use.
      • When you make your shopping list, picture what you are set to purchase will come in. Consider if there are alternatives way you might buy it that creates less waste or pollution. Does it come in bulk?
      • If you are taking on recyclables, just make sure you do it properly or it will end up in the landfill.
      • Remember, only 9% - 15% of all recycled plastic can actually be turned into something new. Don’t be fooled into thinking that just because you are putting it in the bin it’s not ending up at a landfill somewhere else in the world
    • Reward yourself
      • Take a walk in nature – even if it’s just a city park. Breath in the air and observe a natural thing; working so hard to keep providing you with what you need to survive. Appreciate the effort you are both putting in for each other.
      • If you’ve done this and find the air full of smog and the land struggling along with you….keep at it…you’ve got more work to do and remember, we’re here to help!

“The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new.” No one wants to be wasteful. We understand you care about healthy food and a cleaner planet.But how can you achieve this when every grocery store you step foot in, still pushes you toward plastic packaging and over-branded, processed food? Stores, who are themselves contributing to the yearly 43 BILLION POUNDS of food waste thrown out before it even makes it to the shelf for you to purchase? It’s a problem that needs attention.        We have a solution - Meet Roots Zero Waste Market! A neighborhood, plastic package-free, bulk grocery store and zero waste café. We’re not only helping you live lighter with convenience, we are changing the future of our food service industry by eliminating waste through our unique in-house zero waste system!The first in the Northwest, Roots is a neighborhood grocery store and café offering healthy bulk foods, household cleaning products, personal care products, full service deli items and fresh prepared meals, to shoppers looking for plastic-free, sustainably sourced and ethically manufactured products. At Roots, you buy the amount you need when you need it, so you can feel good about saving money while helping to reduce food and food-packaging waste.Our welcoming atmosphere and friendly, knowledgeable staff are ready to provide you:
Idaho grown and organically cultivated produce (upon availability)
A variety of non-toxic bulk dry goods including flours, grains, beans and oils
Locally sourced dairy items and eggs
Environmentally friendly household products and personal care products
Freshly prepared sandwiches, salads, and entrees with meat, vegetarian and vegan options
Fresh-roasted coffee, pressed juice, botanical soda and local beer, cider and wine to enjoy while you shop
Free community space for nonprofits and groups to host meetings and events
Free educational/informational sessions on healthy living and zero-waste practices and food preparation tips
We make bulk-shopping for food and household items easy as 1-2-3: Simply weigh, fill & pay!                     Weigh Bring in your clean container, jar or bag from home (or purchase any one of a number of available jars or bags) and weigh it on our self-service scales so we can deduct the weight at check-out!Label & FillLabel your container and fill it with your favorite food or good.PayPay with cash, check or credit card and feel great about saving money, reducing plastic packaging materials and food waste by buying exactly what you need, when you need it!We are committed to bringing healthy, affordable foods and products to your family because building strong communities begins with healthy bodies and minds. We vow to work carefully with growers and vendors to provide you with toxin-free products, and we will gladly let you know where your food originated.We have secured our store location, in the heart of Garden City at 34th and Chinden Blvd. Situated just outside the Boise Downtown corridor, steps away from the Boise River & Whitewater Park, Roots is centrally located to serve the Treasure Valley.We can't wait to open our doors but we can't do it without you! Our building is a blank slate - just waiting for us to finish its transformation. Your contributions will go a long way in opening our store, creating new employment and furthering our mission.Every Penny (minus perks and fees to Indiegogo) go directly to help us:
Complete construction of the café (cooking vents & fire suppression)
Add interior walls, exterior doors and outdoor seating.
Procure and build stainless steel bulk bins and bulk shelving
Install Contronics Dry Mist System for vegetable preservation
We have an estimated budget of $300,000 for construction, initial stocking and operating expenses. We are asking your help to raise a third of these costs or more if we should be so fortunate!Our goal is set up as “flexible” through Indiegogo, which means if we don’t meet the requested goal, for a fee of 6%, we are still able to receive donated funds to support our project.Lea and Zach have invested their heart, soul, and savings into this project because they truly want to make a forever change to our plastic and food waste problem and lead the way to fixing our ailing food system.If you can't make a contribution today, please share our campaign with your friends, family, neighbors, and anyone else who will listen!Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world by using their voice. Share us on social media and follow us at @rootszerowastemarket for updates on the campaign, opening, and the zero waste movement!Check out all of the rewards on the right side of this webpage and give a little (or a lot)! Aside from tackling waste, we are highly committed to giving back and creating a hub for our community to enjoy, learn and grow with us on our journey to a more fulfilling, healthy and engaged way of living. This is why we are offering not only Individual rewards but Partnership Perks, where we are benefiting the good works of local non-profits who share these common goals:
Food security for all
Youth empowerment through education
Environmental protection
 

Please share this campaign with as many people as you can! Post it on social media and email or chat with your friends and family about it.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the love!
Have a question, want to help in other ways?  email us at: info@zerowastemarket.com or contact us through our website: www.rootszerowastemarket.com 
Lastly, try one of the free tips below, to start living lighter for the Planet & Yourself

 Refuse plastic bags.
Bring your own reusable bag, use your pockets or your purse or juggle your way through the parking lot.
Australia recently banned plastic grocery bags for 3 Months and reduced plastic consumption by 80%!
Refuse single-use plastics and stay resolved to do so - permanently



ReUse…everything you can
Bring your own container or bag to bulk stores.
Find a second or third or tenth “life” for something you may have previously recycled until it’s spent.
Repair what can still be used and just needs a fix



Reduce what you do need and find ways to make less waste.
Americans waste an average of 23% of the food they buy and throw away 185 lbs of plastic per year.
Become friends with a re-usable water bottle, buy only the amount of food you need, take your own silverware and ditch the plastic fork when eating take away or convenience foods.



Rot and regenerate the soil
Make a compost bin in the yard or worm bin in the house
When taken to the landfill, food scraps create greenhouse gasses that account for 8% of greenhouse gas released into the current atmosphere. Cutting down on food waste could have nearly the same impact on reducing emissions over the next three decades as onshore wind turbines



Recycle when you can’t refuse or re-use.
When you make your shopping list, picture what you are set to purchase will come in. Consider if there are alternatives way you might buy it that creates less waste or pollution. Does it come in bulk?
If you are taking on recyclables, just make sure you do it properly or it will end up in the landfill.
Remember, only 9% - 15% of all recycled plastic can actually be turned into something new. Don’t be fooled into thinking that just because you are putting it in the bin it’s not ending up at a landfill somewhere else in the world



Reward yourself
Take a walk in nature – even if it’s just a city park. Breath in the air and observe a natural thing; working so hard to keep providing you with what you need to survive. Appreciate the effort you are both putting in for each other.
If you’ve done this and find the air full of smog and the land struggling along with you….keep at it…you’ve got more work to do and remember, we’re here to help!

story:
Short Summary

Myanmar is facing its worst natural disaster since Cyclone Nargis.

Major floods caused my torrential monsoon rains have killed at least 27 people across Myanmar.

Flood and landslides have destroyed roads, bridges railways and villages. Nearly half a million acres of farmland has been affected.  Emergency aid is required for the flood victims.

Below is the latest update from the UN's Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA).

Considerable economic recovery assistance will doubtless be needed after immediate and urgent rescue efforts.
http://reliefweb.int/report/myanmar/ocha-flash-...

What We Need & What You Get

Your fund will be used to

- Provide emergency aid to the people in affected area in Rakhine State in Western Myanmar. Need help in evacuation, rescue of people and animals, drinking water, food, clothes, shelter, blankets, medicine.

-Provide necessary flood recovery items for families. Need items to clean or rebuild homes, household utensils, food, water purification, support for re-cultivation of farms.

Who are we?

We are a group of Burmese friends trying to help victims of recent nationwide flood in Myanmar. The fund raised will be sent to the NGOs in Yangon in order to provide flood recovery aid. Any amount of your contribution will be helpful for victims.

story:
Ecoed App is the brain child of Argentinian sustainability professional and game designer Maria Soledad Riestra (Sole to her mates) as part of her ongoing work in the field of environmental education. 

Once you enter our Ecoed world, Turby, Wavi, Reci and Halt will help you reach the highest level of lighter life on Earth in their respective areas of footprint - Energy, Water, Waste, Health and Well-being - by earning points through one-on-one or group game rounds, with quizzes that test and raise awareness on sustainable behaviours, and actions to take back to your daily life. The more quizzes you play and actions you take, the more points you make! Players will also be able to submit their own questions and actions, thus co-creating the app on an ongoing basis. 

Our campaign and why we think it is important

We passionately believe that we all want to live more sustainably, we just lack the understanding of how. Ecoed will inspire and enable children, adults and families to learn more about their personal environmental footprint, and the kind of daily actions each one of us can take to reduce our impact, which will collectively lead to a more sustainable future for people and planet.

We know how environmental issues can seem heavy hearted and hard to approach at an individual level. What excites us the most about this project is that Ecoed is here to be that bridge that connects individuals from all around the world, in a positive, constructive way, to respond to the ecological challenges of our time, by doing and acting on those things that are within our arms' reach - the daily little things which, collectively, can make a huge difference. 

What can you help us achieve?

    WWF states that "Everyday choices we make, such as how often and how far we drive our cars, buying our food or turning up our thermostat one degree more when it's cold, when combined have a big impact on the environment on a global scale." (WWF, 2013). 

    Our individual actions may seem small to us, but the collective ripple effect of all of us combined can be a game changer and make a systemic shift possible. By contributing to this campaign, you will help us reach out to as many people as possible with an easy to use, accessible, engaging tool to enable and empower individuals to be the change we all want to see in the world. Once developed, Ecoed will be made available and promoted as a fun and educational tool for children and adults across the globe. 

    If you feel strongly that we all have a role to play in the future of our planet, then Ecoed can take us one step closer towards understanding what we can do as individuals in order to have a positive impact and become active change makers on a daily basis. We all have the ability to make this happen and with Ecoed it also makes it fun!

    What We Need & What You Will Get

    We are asking for funding that will enable our small team to get Ecoed up and running for a cost of 60.000 USD.

    If you donate to this campaign we can offer you free licenses and exclusive access to the app, which you can give to your friends or offer as a gift to a school.  You can also receive an 'Ecoed guide' with inspiring information and ideas to engage with other people, friends, and family, and become an 'Ecoed Ambassador' in your local community. Also, If you have a business with products or services that are sustainable / eco-friendly, you can get in-app advertising and sponsorship packages to promote your business within the Ecoed community.  

    We are determined to get Ecoed out into the world. We will develop this app within the next 6 months, with targeted launch campaigns initially in London and Hong Kong (where Zoe and Sole are based!). So, all funds will go towards getting us to our ultimate goal of making the app available globally. The sooner we raise the money, the better! 

    Risks & Challenges

    Ecoed does not present significant risks given its low cost and versatility, provided that it is a technological development. Now, we know that the online market is saturated with apps and tools, and people can also be overwhelmed with information. We strongly believe that Ecoed's advantage lies in its proposition to attract people of all ages, being the only app that combines interactivity, gamification, learning and behavioural change in the field of sustainability. Our previous work and research has shown us that there's a significant need and appetite from people and organisations, and even schools to engage with more sustainability and ecology-driven content, and how traditional means of learning are giving way to more interactive, combined classroom and online led methods, which is what Ecoed would be offering.  

    We are also aware of the fact that we need to make sure Ecoed can remain relevant throughout time. With the overwhelming offer of technological content, we are conscious that we need to continuously improve and monitor how people respond to the app, connect with our users and bring enhancements to the app in order to make it appealing both in the short and the long term. And believe us, we have so many ideas in the pipeline to continue developing Ecoed once it's launched, that you wouldn't imagine! From AR (Augmented Reality) features, to engaging with local communities and businesses to install 'Ecoed money' and 'Ecoed rewards', our ambition is for Ecoed to bring about an ongoing culture of respect and care for our environment, embedded in the way that we think and do things daily. We can't do all at once, but we need to start somewhere! And getting Ecoed app ready and publicly available is the first, big step.

    Who we are 

    We both - Sole, the game creator and Zoe, the project manager - are driven, passionate women with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and a vocation for the environment that brought us to work together. We met through a project we were commissioned to work on for a UK WWF funded initiative to build a social community around alternative financial models in the UK, in 2013. As colleagues we clicked right away and have worked together whenever we have had the opportunity. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    There are many ways in which you can contribute to this project. Starting with funding (yes!) but also simply getting the word out there, sharing our campaign and Ecoed's website on social media, or even sending us some encouraging words about the project! You can also contact us if you wish to become a member of our team and lead the roll out of Ecoed in your city or town; we will guide you through some of the actions and events you can host to hopefully bring even more people onboard into this new era of sustainable living! 

    And if you have other ideas, we also welcome your feedback and engaging in conversations about this project.

story:
What we're up to

Swale is a one-of-a-kind platform that encourages New Yorkers to connect with edible ecology, and asks us to reconsider our collective use of land and waterways. Swale hosts public tours and educational workshops, and welcomes around 500 public visitors daily. In 2016 Swale docked at public piers in the South Bronx, Governors Island and Brooklyn Bridge Park, hosting over 60,000 visitors, 1,000 park tours, 60 school groups, and 30 free public programs. In 2017, Swale has returned to NYC and needs your help in order to continue to serve the public. Swale is the only water-based public food forest in the country (that we know of!). 

 



Impact of your contribution

Our team is working tirelessly to bring school groups, public officials, experts, and local stakeholders together to reimagine the ecological opportunities of our city. If you contribute to this campaign, you will 

  • Help keep Swale free and open to the public
  • Make it easier for all New Yorkers connect with the food we eat
  • Empower urban residents to become stewards of parks and public spaces
  • Enable youth to experience urban agriculture
  • Advance grassroots policy to bring perennial agriculture to New York City's public spaces  

Your contribution is a direct investment in the vibrancy of your city, and is something that you can actively enjoy.


image courtesy of Katharina Kiefert

What we need, specifically

In order for the barge to stay free and accessible to you, your friends and your family, we need:

  • $5,000 so that we can build the curriculum for 300 school workshops across New York City
  • $10,000 to build a proper greenhouse that would extend our season through the winter
  • $6,000 to expand our perennial gardens
  • $6,000 so that we can travel to more public piers and more people can experience Swale


image courtesy of A Blade of Grass

See for yourself

Come visit Swale at Brooklyn Bridge Park's Pier 6, through June 30.

story:
Hello! My name is Caitlyn Kenney, a Fine Arts graduate of Boston University and founder of Cycle – a startup aiming to bring permaculture ideals to the South Shore area of Massachusetts, beginning in the Township of Dartmouth with an idea of compost collection on bicycles!

Planting the permaculture seed in the South Coast is an important first step in bringing about the cultural and societal shift many places on the East Coast are missing. By starting in a small town like Dartmouth, bicycle-­based compost collection routes will be simple, effective, and efficient, allowing for a cleaner and better­-functioning startup that has a greater capacity to reach and affect more citizens. The simpler and more efficient the plan, the easier it will be to get Cycle off of the ground (so to speak!) and the greater the impact on the township as a whole – meaning a more wholesome impact on the entire community therein.

Your contribution is the key component in the launch of this plan. Without your support, Cycle will quite literally remain unborn: it will have no base for operations for composting; it will have no access to bike trailers or compostable bags for the collection of the civilians' food waste; it will have no way to reach out and educate potential participants throughout Dartmouth. Your contribution to our cause today has the potential to change an entire town, and all of its inhabitants, for generations to come.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise 12,000 US dollars. This funding will go towards our compostable bags, in which our clients will put their own compostables and food waste, and it will go towards purchasing supplies to build our composting bins. This funding will go towards our bicycle trailers, upon which we will collect our clients' compost, and it will go towards purchasing a space out of which we can work our operation. This funding will go towards incorporating our business along with making sure that we are a full and legal entity, and will cover any extraneous legal fees involved in the process of creating a business, as well as providing a way for us to market ourselves. Lastly, and most importantly, this funding will ensure our cyclists' safety, pay, and insurance; it will allow us to hold educational workshops for interested minds, and it will allow us to create community gardens throughout Dartmouth.

With all of the awesome humanist perks aside, you'll also be able to get some swell personal perks for your donation as well, as an extra bit of thanks from us here at Cycle!

$5 – You will receive a Cycle-themed bumper sticker for your car, wall, window, laptop – you place it, it will stick!

$15 – An organically-grown cotton tote bag will be sent to you, for all of your carrying needs!

$25 – You will receive a BPA­-free Cycle water bottle, so you can show support for composting and a healthy self!

$50 – Mystery Perk! Ooooooooh, spooky! (But seriously, we assure that it will be worth your while).

$100 – You will receive a hand-­painted bicycle bell, from artist and founder Caitlyn Kenney!

$300 – You will get to (appropriately, please) name one of the bike trailers! If you've ever dreamt of having your name on that which drags food waste around town, look no further, this is the perk for you! You will also receive the $50 mystery perk!

$500 – For a donation this large you will be given a bicycle helmet, hand­painted by Caitlyn Kenney! You will also be given a Cycle bumper sticker and the mystery perk from the $50 donation bracket!

$1000 – If you donate $1000, you will be given a 20”x20” painting, crafted by Ms. Caitlyn Kenney's own hands! Furthermore, you will receive each other perk listed above!

 

The Impact

Permaculture is a methodology that emphasizes “Earth Care, Fair Share, People Care.” Acting on these principles is the key to creating a healthy, robust world that will allow humanity to prosper and thrive for generations to come, in tandem with the environment around us. Permaculture is a set of ideals for a paradigm shift – one that opens a door for us to move away from the outmoded American lifestyle of overconsumption and consumer­-dependence to a lifestyle of interdependence, self­-sustainability, and prosperous production.

When we think of the phrase 'Reduce, Reuse, Recycle', oftentimes we think of papers, plastics, tin and aluminum, cardboard; but very rarely do we consider the “fifth element” of recyclables – that is, food. On average, 60%­-70% of the waste in landfills is compostable – and much of that comes in the form of food.

Now, imagine what the world would look like if we took all of that usable landfill 'waste' and repurposed it, creating healthy, nutrient-­dense, rich soil in which to grow fruits and vegetables? That is the action­-oriented goal of Cycle's compost collection: reduce the citizen's waste footprint and bolster their environmental contribution. Furthermore, Cycle's compost collection will take place on bicycles, meaning that Cycle's carbon­-based environmental impact will be at net­-zero, or even net­-negative! That means that our company will not only be preventing extra carbon from entering the atmosphere, but also not contributing any carbon emissions (besides our breathing) ­ helping stymy the greenhouse effect in the Earth's atmosphere.

The endgame of Cycle is to bring a permaculture ideal to the South Shore, through the spreading of education and awareness and leading through the example of composting, beginning in the town of Dartmouth, Massachusetts. Once the routes for the cyclists have been mapped out, and the compost collection has begun, the final step will be organizing permaculture­-centered educational workshops to teach interested people about the greater benefits of composting, gardening, self-sustainability, and so forth, to spread awareness not only of Cycle, but also how organizations like it can impact the social, economic, political, and personal landscapes surrounding them.

To bring it all home, even though a program like Cycle is centered in a small suburban town on the East Coast, it follows a system of ideals that are cropping up in places and people throughout the country.

These people and these ideas have the potential to reverberate together to create a sweeping change, on both small and large scales. It starts small, yes, but it blossoms into something beautiful – just like every great moment in history, just like every change in ideals; just like every work of art, every invention, every composition, every story. Cycle, in Dartmouth, Massachusetts, may not directly impact you in California, New York, Alabama, Texas ­but it will directly affect thousands of living people at its epicenter, and thousands more with its ripples: as education spreads, as knowledge and understanding are disseminated through the collaborating minds, as the environmental impact of humankind begins to lessen with each bag of compost stashed on the back of a bicycle and turned into soil to replenish the Earth with which we live. To bring it all home – the impact is somewhere, that ripples out everywhere. And it can only happen if someone, anywhere, decides to join hands with us to make a change happen, and support an ideal that benefits everyone and everything on Earth.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any startup, there are hurdles that need to be leapt. One of the biggest hurdles we face right now is finding a space in which to set up our composting bins. Land is expensive – hence why we come to the participants of Indiegogo. Without a base of operations, we will have no place to put the compost we collect.

We will have no place to store our compost, no place to mix it, make it, or distribute it from.

The second hurdle to overcome will be marketing ourselves – letting people know who we are, what we do, and why it is important, all in a clear and concise way. Outreach, essentially. Many people in Dartmouth garden – be it flower gardens, or vegetable gardens. To be able to offer them affordable, substantive compost to mix into their soil to grow vibrant flowers and produce bountiful harvests is a major aspect of our mission, but will be difficult to make happen if no one knows about or supports our existence.

Not only will your support help give us a home, but it will also showcase to the town of Dartmouth a broad level of support from like-­minded people, within the community and without. Support like that is encouraging and uplifting, and seeing that they are not alone in the cause helps inspire people to do good in the little ways that they can.

Our final challenge is the upwards climb of legislation. Seeking to become a full­-fledged legally-
recognized entity is a process – but the good news is that we have already begun the steep climb. We have met with entrepreneurs and businesspeople, and are currently in a working partnership with an attorney­-at-­law to legally become a Limited­ Liability Company, or LLC. It's only a matter of time, and the authenticity of becoming a legally recognized entity will open a lot of doors for Cycle to reach out and positively impact the surrounding community. The completion of this process will allow individuals, businesses, legislature, and interested parties to be able to look at us in a real, responsible light – something very important for a young female entering the business world with an idea that can bring change to the status quo.

Keeping these hurdles in mind, we don't want you to think that we're so totally green (the other way, not the recycling kind) that we're incapable of overcoming the challenges laid before us. As a fine arts major, founder and owner Caitlyn Kenney has years of experience in marketing and customer relations – her down-to-earth experience from waiting tables for several years aside. Additionally, as stated above, we have literally dozens of different perspectives available to us – from psychiatrists to minimum­-wage employees and attorneys-at-­law, to entrepreneurs and businesspeople and energy consultants, to horticulturists and college students and professors, to name several – and these perspectives, opinions, and ideas keep us fresh and capable, providing us with new ideas and multiple facets of information to allow us to ride smoothly over all of the bumps in the road.

The last piece of the puzzle is you and your contribution. With your funding, we'll be able to get Cycle off of the ground and into the homes of the citizens of Dartmouth, bringing to them a functional step to a healthier world and greener society.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary contribution isn't the only support that you can give us. Spread the word! Check out our website; come to our workshops. If you live out of the South Coast area, do your own research on Permaculture. Learn about why it is important. Start a garden. Talk to your friends and family and coworkers about what you learn; share the wealth of your knowledge. Start your own company or business and follow your dreams, so that your passions may better your life and the lives of those surrounding you. In the end, we're all in this together, and if we suffer or don't allow ourselves to be capable, if we aren't enabling ourselves to be the best that we can be, then we can't be the best, or do the best, for the people that surround us. We deserve that, as much as everyone else. Great ripples cause great waves.

So please, feel free to contribute in any way that you can – monetary or otherwise. Every way that you contribute is meaningful, no matter how big or small; no matter how direct or how indirect. If you have questions, contact us – our email and website are listed below, and we would be thrilled to hear from you and answer whatever questions we can. You are just as much a part of this as we are. You are just as important.

Finally, thank you. Thank you for reading all of this, for taking the time to learn about us and follow up with us. Thank you for your interest and concern. Cycle would be nowhere without you, and for that, we are grateful beyond measure. We'll keep in touch. We hope that you do too.

 

 

cyclecomposting.com  --- cyclecomposting@gmail.com ---  774 - 202 - 9312
story_txt: Hello! My name is Caitlyn Kenney, a Fine Arts graduate of Boston University and founder of Cycle – a startup aiming to bring permaculture ideals to the South Shore area of Massachusetts, beginning in the Township of Dartmouth with an idea of compost collection on bicycles!Planting the permaculture seed in the South Coast is an important first step in bringing about the cultural and societal shift many places on the East Coast are missing. By starting in a small town like Dartmouth, bicycle-­based compost collection routes will be simple, effective, and efficient, allowing for a cleaner and better­-functioning startup that has a greater capacity to reach and affect more citizens. The simpler and more efficient the plan, the easier it will be to get Cycle off of the ground (so to speak!) and the greater the impact on the township as a whole – meaning a more wholesome impact on the entire community therein.Your contribution is the key component in the launch of this plan. Without your support, Cycle will quite literally remain unborn: it will have no base for operations for composting; it will have no access to bike trailers or compostable bags for the collection of the civilians' food waste; it will have no way to reach out and educate potential participants throughout Dartmouth. Your contribution to our cause today has the potential to change an entire town, and all of its inhabitants, for generations to come.What We Need & What You GetOur goal is to raise 12,000 US dollars. This funding will go towards our compostable bags, in which our clients will put their own compostables and food waste, and it will go towards purchasing supplies to build our composting bins. This funding will go towards our bicycle trailers, upon which we will collect our clients' compost, and it will go towards purchasing a space out of which we can work our operation. This funding will go towards incorporating our business along with making sure that we are a full and legal entity, and will cover any extraneous legal fees involved in the process of creating a business, as well as providing a way for us to market ourselves. Lastly, and most importantly, this funding will ensure our cyclists' safety, pay, and insurance; it will allow us to hold educational workshops for interested minds, and it will allow us to create community gardens throughout Dartmouth.With all of the awesome humanist perks aside, you'll also be able to get some swell personal perks for your donation as well, as an extra bit of thanks from us here at Cycle!$5 – You will receive a Cycle-themed bumper sticker for your car, wall, window, laptop – you place it, it will stick!$15 – An organically-grown cotton tote bag will be sent to you, for all of your carrying needs!$25 – You will receive a BPA­-free Cycle water bottle, so you can show support for composting and a healthy self!$50 – Mystery Perk! Ooooooooh, spooky! (But seriously, we assure that it will be worth your while).$100 – You will receive a hand-­painted bicycle bell, from artist and founder Caitlyn Kenney!$300 – You will get to (appropriately, please) name one of the bike trailers! If you've ever dreamt of having your name on that which drags food waste around town, look no further, this is the perk for you! You will also receive the $50 mystery perk!$500 – For a donation this large you will be given a bicycle helmet, hand­painted by Caitlyn Kenney! You will also be given a Cycle bumper sticker and the mystery perk from the $50 donation bracket!$1000 – If you donate $1000, you will be given a 20”x20” painting, crafted by Ms. Caitlyn Kenney's own hands! Furthermore, you will receive each other perk listed above! The ImpactPermaculture is a methodology that emphasizes “Earth Care, Fair Share, People Care.” Acting on these principles is the key to creating a healthy, robust world that will allow humanity to prosper and thrive for generations to come, in tandem with the environment around us. Permaculture is a set of ideals for a paradigm shift – one that opens a door for us to move away from the outmoded American lifestyle of overconsumption and consumer­-dependence to a lifestyle of interdependence, self­-sustainability, and prosperous production.When we think of the phrase 'Reduce, Reuse, Recycle', oftentimes we think of papers, plastics, tin and aluminum, cardboard; but very rarely do we consider the “fifth element” of recyclables – that is, food. On average, 60%­-70% of the waste in landfills is compostable – and much of that comes in the form of food.Now, imagine what the world would look like if we took all of that usable landfill 'waste' and repurposed it, creating healthy, nutrient-­dense, rich soil in which to grow fruits and vegetables? That is the action­-oriented goal of Cycle's compost collection: reduce the citizen's waste footprint and bolster their environmental contribution. Furthermore, Cycle's compost collection will take place on bicycles, meaning that Cycle's carbon­-based environmental impact will be at net­-zero, or even net­-negative! That means that our company will not only be preventing extra carbon from entering the atmosphere, but also not contributing any carbon emissions (besides our breathing) ­ helping stymy the greenhouse effect in the Earth's atmosphere.The endgame of Cycle is to bring a permaculture ideal to the South Shore, through the spreading of education and awareness and leading through the example of composting, beginning in the town of Dartmouth, Massachusetts. Once the routes for the cyclists have been mapped out, and the compost collection has begun, the final step will be organizing permaculture­-centered educational workshops to teach interested people about the greater benefits of composting, gardening, self-sustainability, and so forth, to spread awareness not only of Cycle, but also how organizations like it can impact the social, economic, political, and personal landscapes surrounding them.To bring it all home, even though a program like Cycle is centered in a small suburban town on the East Coast, it follows a system of ideals that are cropping up in places and people throughout the country.These people and these ideas have the potential to reverberate together to create a sweeping change, on both small and large scales. It starts small, yes, but it blossoms into something beautiful – just like every great moment in history, just like every change in ideals; just like every work of art, every invention, every composition, every story. Cycle, in Dartmouth, Massachusetts, may not directly impact you in California, New York, Alabama, Texas ­but it will directly affect thousands of living people at its epicenter, and thousands more with its ripples: as education spreads, as knowledge and understanding are disseminated through the collaborating minds, as the environmental impact of humankind begins to lessen with each bag of compost stashed on the back of a bicycle and turned into soil to replenish the Earth with which we live. story:
For German/Deutsch: https://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/nad-brahma-oko-tourismus-in-amed-bali

Nad Brahma is a Sanskrit word meaning that the world and everything else is sound. It is the sound of the universal creation  -  the underlying vibration of creation.

My passion for cooking, and especially for Indian and Vegan food, led me do a lot of self-studies over the last 20 years, and especially while living in India for several years. In Switzerland, I studied economics as well as business management. I came to Amed in Eastern Bali in 2015 with the intention of opening a vegetarian restaurant.

For me the understanding of the importance of a sustainable, environmentally friendly business is quintessential.  My goal is not purely making as much money as possible, but to create a sustainable future for the local people, for the environment, and for the communities. Organic, permaculture farming is an important step in bringing about a cultural shift towards a sustainable future that is currently missing in the majority of farming practices in Bali.

This campaign is about raising the funds needed to make this restaurant into something bigger. Right now, Nad Brahma is planned to be a small restaurant, but I need financial help, materials, and professional knowledge in environmentally friendly farming. I want to be able to use only organic ingredients, and to have a waste management system, to recycle as much as possible. It will empower the people from the local community, not only by creating jobs, but also by creating a long-lasting impact.

Your contribution is the key component in this plan. I sincerely believe in the idea of crowdfunding because it brings like-minded people together wishing for a common goal like improvement in sustainable livelihood, in environmental impact. I hope you will join my vision and together we create an environmental friendly tourist destination which supports the local community in the long term.

Monetary contribution isn't the only support that you can give. If you live in Bali or want to visit this beautiful island, and you do have knowledge in Organic and specially in Demeter farming and/or permaculture; then I would like you to pass on your knowledge to the local community. This is a very serious offer: I will provide simple accommodation, food, and finding more like-minded people and friends.

What We Need & What You Get 

The goal is to raise 15’000 US dollars. This funding will go towards investment into establishment and expansion of the restaurant on an ecological basis.  Further, it will cover permaculture, organic, and bio-dynamic agricultural education to local farmers. It will be used for improvements in waste and recycling management. I have a part of capital required, but it is not enough.

Perks

Please check your benefits under perks. Here, you can find the details of these more generous gifts.

In Addition

All contributors are asked to provide photos for the soon-to-be art wall. I am looking for cool photos of you, your permaculture garden, your tasty Organic/Demeter veggies and fruits, or your lovely dog. Backers supporting this cause with more than US$ 199 will be mentioned on our wall of fame on our Facebook.

The gift cards and vouchers will be issued 51 days after launching of this crowdfunding, valid from the opening day of the restaurant up to max. 3 years. 

The Impact 

The vision of Nad Brahma is to bring permaculture methodologies to Bali, through spreading appropriate education and awareness of the population, leading through the example. The aim is to spread awareness, not only of Nad Brahma, but also about how an organisation can affect the social, economic, political and personal landscapes surrounding them.

Even though a program like Nad Brahma is centred in a small village on the East Coast of Bali, it follows a system of ideals that are cropping up in places  throughout the world. We have the potential to reverberate together to create a sweeping change, on both small and large scale. I hope my goal will affect thousands of people: as education spreads, as knowledge and understanding are disseminated through the collaborating minds, as the environmental impact of humankind begins to equalise. It can only happen if someone, anywhere, decides to join hands to make a change happen, and support an ideal that benefits everyone and everything on Earth.

Risks & Challenges

Start-ups - a great idea; a vision often needs financial and other support on many different levels. This is a flexible crowdfunding call. I will do what I can to actualise the holistic dream for/from Nad Brahma.

Other Ways You Can Help 

Please, contribute in any way you can — monetary or otherwise. Every contribution is meaningful, no matter how big or small; no matter how direct or indirect. If you have questions, contact me — email and website are listed below — and I will be thrilled to hear from you and answer your questions. You are just as much a part of this vision as we all are.

Spread the word! I hope you feel inspired, and I ask you to share this campaign through the your own social media networks — especially those that link back to this page or to the Nad Brahma Facebook! Recommend Bali and especially Amed to your family, friends and acquaintances!

Thank you for taking the time to read about my ideas and plans and following it up. Thank you from my heart for your interest and concern. 

 We'll keep in touch. I hope that you do too. 

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/NadBrahmaAmed
  • E-Mail: nad.brahma.team@gmail.com
Permaculture

Permaculture is a methodology that aims at creation of permanently functioning, sustainable and natural cycles: Mindful dealing with earth (Earth Care), Mindful dealing with people (People Care), self-limiting (growth redemption), and income distribution (Fair Share). The author Bill Mollison defines “Permaculture as a conscious maintenance of agriculturally productive ecosystems which have the diversity, stability and resilience of natural ecosystems. It is a philosophy that works with and not against nature, a philosophy of continuous and deliberate observation and not the continuous and thoughtless action; it considers a system in all its functions, instead of requiring only one type of income from them, and it allows the systems to demonstrate their own evolutions“.

story:
Short Summary

The ALTERNATIVE story started in 2013, when I (Ioana) came across the devastating impacts of plastic pollution on wildlife. It turned out to be a global problem, no matter how far-away or close by the inhabited areas, plastic started suffocating life. Wild life and human life as well.

Not being the kind of person to give up, look away or get overwhelmed by the size of the problem, I decided to do something. TO CHANGE. The world. Turned out that was big to think and say, but quite relative to actually DO. So I started with the beginning: ME. This made sense. I started living without plastic. I refused all plastic bags that everybody so eagerly were handing out, I started buying fruits and veggies bag-free, made a habit of going to the local market and buy food in bulk, local grown & harvested and simply REFUSE buying supermarket goods wrapped in plastic. I gave up bottled water and looked for spring water in the neighboring areas and chose tap water when spring water was out of reach.

Then moved to new grounds: refused plastic straws, take-away containers made out of plastic, take away-cups & single-use cutlery. Then I discovered there are alternatives for personal care products as well, healthier and of course, plastic -free. Every section of my life changed for the better.

But please do not think that I gave up all stuff that make our lives easy, comfy & convenient. Nonono, I started a journey to discover healthy, natural, sustainable ALTERNATIVEs to these most common single-use plastic objects.

With CURIOSITY & MOTIVATION, the adventure begun and the ALTERNATIVE team started happening. Soon Mihai joined in, with his wider view of what can to be done to live & enjoy the outdoor leaving only footprints behind and zero trash, as a bike enthusiast & nature lover, also very much determined to make a positive change in the world starting with himself.

Starting this journey brought us many happy moments. But also clarity & vision. There are tones of things that we want to do. So we started to talk to everybody we knew (friends, family, colleagues, friends of friends) or didn't know about our project. And more and more people joined in, acknowledging that plastic pollution is a big problem of today's world to which we all contribute, even if we realize it or not. And because we all contribute to it, we can also contribute to change it.

Our enthusiasm gathered lots of beautiful people around our project. (Barna, Thomas, Cristi, Adi, Tessa, Alejandra, Mayu, Larisa, Zsolt, Ale, Andu, Dana, Viorica, thank you all for shining & making ALTERNATIVE happen <3).

And so we learnt that great things can be achieved, when there are many of us working for the same purpose. That there are ALTERNATIVEs to replace the single-use plastics, that there are people that are willing to get involved and do something, that we can contribute to our community by finding solutions to big problems and fixing them locally.

We took the responsibility of finding natural, ethical, sustainable & healthy alternatives to most common single-use plastics. Some of them are already developed with success by beautiful people, others were developed by us. And because we want to work within our community, thus involving as many people as possible and bringing the plastic problem and its solutions closer to us, we ask for your help.

We took an ought to live a plastic- free life and stop contributing to the production of new plastics. Therefore our products are completely plastic-free, including the packaging . We focus on using as little resources as possible in the making-of process. We track the materials we use and pay fairly all the people involved in the manufacturing process.

We have discovered and created alternatives to some of the most common single-use plastic objects that become trash (food wrappers, thin & thick bags, food packaging, food & drink containers, toothbrushes) and with your help we want to create more (cutlery, cups, toys, straws, napkins, composter).

40% of the world's plastic production is represented by packaging, which becomes unrecyclable trash the moment we started using the products inside.

Every piece of plastic ever made still exists somewhere on this planet, so every new plastic that we stop from being produced throughout changing our behavior will be a great accomplishment.

And just for the sake of illustrating what I am talking about, in 2013 I was cosuming about 3.467 pieces of plastic packging, compared to 21 in 2015. 

What We Need & What You Get

At ALTERNATIVE we believe in working together, working local within the community, being flexible and creative, accepting challenges and creating the perfect environment for win-win situations.

Every piece of plastic that we refused meant LESS NEW PLASTIC WAS PRODUCED. Every plastic item we succeed to replace in our daily life meant less trash in nature. And every ALTERNATIVE to a single-use plastic item we can share with you will be a great achievement.

We created some packages to enable you to start your plastic-free journey, be ready to receive them for Christmas (for orders before 10th of December) or in January, to support your New Years Eve Resolution of having a #Zen2017 (for orders placed starting 11th of December).

Choose the perk that fits your goals and aspirations. You can start with educating yourself on the matter of plastic and its negative impacts or start exploring the alternatives and be part of the solution.

And if you have any thoughts for us, questions, suggestions or wish to contribute in any way, we are waiting for your questions at hello@alternative.blue.

We used all of our funds to create, test & manufacture the bags. We ask for your support to start using our products, believe in them and make change happen. With the funds collected in this campaign we want to bring to life the next wave of natural, ethical & sustainable ALTERNATIVEs: food containers from safe materials, eco straws, plastic-free toys, outdoor cups, outdoor plastic-free kits for camping, eco cutlery, cotton napkins, ceramic composter.

All ALTERNATIVE products are manufactured locally, in Romania (Sibiu, Oradea & Cluj-Napoca) with the help, skills and enthusiasm of passionate creative people that love what they are doing. We work with friends & family. We involve our community and make objects come to life here, on a local scale.

The Impact

In Romania, only 5% of the trash is recycled. More than 7.000.000 tons of trash end up in landfills, rivers, lakes, waterways and other places in nature from where we source our food and take our water.

The plastic packaging consumed by Romanians varies between 470 & 5.500 items per person every year. Most of them (23%) are sweets & snacks wrappers, followed by thin plastic bags used mainly for fruits & veggies (16%). Take-away containers represent 12% of the plastic consumption, while 9% is claimed by food packaging. None of these plastics are recyclable (nor in Romania, nor in other waste facilities around the globe).

We invite you to DARE & take our challenge of measuring your single-use plastic footprint. Fill in the ALT postcard and acknowledge which are the most common plastics you use. Once you know where you stand, you will know from where to start the transformation. 

Risks & Challenges

We make products that are meant to last and be used over and over again (vs. single use), serving  various purposes. Made from durable high-quality materials, they are not meant for single-use and throw-away, the damage made to the environment being huge in this case. 

We love working with natural, old, upcycled, local materials. But there is still a strong trend between people and companies to opt for overseas 'exotic' products & materials vs. local ones,  or new ones vs. of old repurposed ones.

Throughout education, awareness raising, innovation, long-term vision and the power of example we try to make a change in how people and companies behave & react. We use recycled paper for packaging and printed materials, we buy our materials locally and organize workshops using old upcycled materials, we opt for quality instead of quantity, we value green ethical social companies and work towards being certified as one in the near future. We learn & innovate continuously and think about the impact we have on the environment and our health with every decision we take.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our main goal is to stop plastic pollution. If you want to help us spread the word, raise awareness, create new products, join our community or find out how you can too fight plastic pollution, drop us a line, we will be honored to hear from you.

And keep in mind: the most effective way to REDUCE the harmful effects of plastic is to stop using it and reduce the demand for new plastic production.

Other ALTERNATIVE projects

  • A petition that supports the introduction of a deposit-scheme for plastic bottles, aluminium cans and tetra packs in Romania, as part of a civic initiative at an European level .
  • 'Scientists Say'  campaign which used postcards with facts about plastic to raise awareness about plastic pollution.
  • 'Plastic-free August', a 1 month campaign which documents that living without plastic is doable & fun.
  • Member of Break Free From Plastic Movement.

Credits for 'ALTERNATIVEs to plastic' campaign

  • video Tessa Moult-Milewska 
  • photo Lost in East
story_txt:
Short Summary
The ALTERNATIVE story started in 2013, when I (Ioana) came across the devastating impacts of plastic pollution on wildlife. It turned out to be a global problem, no matter how far-away or close by the inhabited areas, plastic started suffocating life. Wild life and human life as well.
Not being the kind of person to give up, look away or get overwhelmed by the size of the problem, I decided to do something. TO CHANGE. The world. Turned out that was big to think and say, but quite relative to actually DO. So I started with the beginning: ME. This made sense. I started living without plastic. I refused all plastic bags that everybody so eagerly were handing out, I started buying fruits and veggies bag-free, made a habit of going to the local market and buy food in bulk, local grown & harvested and simply REFUSE buying supermarket goods wrapped in plastic. I gave up bottled water and looked for spring water in the neighboring areas and chose tap water when spring water was out of reach.
Then moved to new grounds: refused plastic straws, take-away containers made out of plastic, take away-cups & single-use cutlery. Then I discovered there are alternatives for personal care products as well, healthier and of course, plastic -free. Every section of my life changed for the better.
But please do not think that I gave up all stuff that make our lives easy, comfy & convenient. Nonono, I started a journey to discover healthy, natural, sustainable ALTERNATIVEs to these most common single-use plastic objects.
With CURIOSITY & MOTIVATION, the adventure begun and the ALTERNATIVE team started happening. Soon Mihai joined in, with his wider view of what can to be done to live & enjoy the outdoor leaving only footprints behind and zero trash, as a bike enthusiast & nature lover, also very much determined to make a positive change in the world starting with himself.
Starting this journey brought us many happy moments. But also clarity & vision. There are tones of things that we want to do. So we started to talk to everybody we knew (friends, family, colleagues, friends of friends) or didn't know about our project. And more and more people joined in, acknowledging that plastic pollution is a big problem of today's world to which we all contribute, even if we realize it or not. And because we all contribute to it, we can also contribute to change it.
Our enthusiasm gathered lots of beautiful people around our project. (Barna, Thomas, Cristi, Adi, Tessa, Alejandra, Mayu, Larisa, Zsolt, Ale, Andu, Dana, Viorica, thank you all for shining & making ALTERNATIVE happen <3).
And so we learnt that great things can be achieved, when there are many of us working for the same purpose. That there are ALTERNATIVEs to replace the single-use plastics, that there are people that are willing to get involved and do something, that we can contribute to our community by finding solutions to big problems and fixing them locally.
We took the responsibility of finding natural, ethical, sustainable & healthy alternatives to most common single-use plastics. Some of them are already developed with success by beautiful people, others were developed by us. And because we want to work within our community, thus involving as many people as possible and bringing the plastic problem and its solutions closer to us, we ask for your help.
We took an ought to live a plastic- free life and stop contributing to the production of new plastics. Therefore our products are completely plastic-free, including the packaging . We focus on using as little resources as possible in the making-of process. We track the materials we use and pay fairly all the people involved in the manufacturing process.
We have discovered and created alternatives to some of the most common single-use plastic objects that become trash (food wrappers, thin & thick bags, food packaging, food & drink containers, toothbrushes) and with your help we want to create more (cutlery, cups, toys, straws, napkins, composter).
40% of the world's plastic production is represented by packaging, which becomes unrecyclable trash the moment we started using the products inside.
Every piece of plastic ever made still exists somewhere on this planet, so every new plastic that we stop from being produced throughout changing our behavior will be a great accomplishment.
And just for the sake of illustrating what I am talking about, in 2013 I was cosuming about 3.467 pieces of plastic packging, compared to 21 in 2015.

Every piece of plastic that we refused meant LESS NEW PLASTIC WAS PRODUCED. Every plastic item we succeed to replace in our daily life meant less trash in nature. And every ALTERNATIVE to a single-use plastic item we can share with you will be a great achievement.
We created some packages to enable you to start your plastic-free journey, be ready to receive them for Christmas (for orders before 10th of December) or in January, to support your New Years Eve Resolution of having a #Zen2017 (for orders placed starting 11th of December).
Choose the perk that fits your goals and aspirations. You can start with educating yourself on the matter of plastic and its negative impacts or start exploring the alternatives and be part of the solution.
And if you have any thoughts for us, questions, suggestions or wish to contribute in any way, we are waiting for your questions at hello@alternative.blue.
We used all of our funds to create, test & manufacture the bags. We ask for your support to start using our products, believe in them and make change happen. With the funds collected in this campaign we want to bring to life the next wave of natural, ethical & sustainable ALTERNATIVEs: food containers from safe materials, eco straws, plastic-free toys, outdoor cups, outdoor plastic-free kits for camping, eco cutlery, cotton napkins, ceramic composter.
All ALTERNATIVE products are manufactured locally, in Romania (Sibiu, Oradea & Cluj-Napoca) with the help, skills and enthusiasm of passionate creative people that love what they are doing. We work with friends & family. We involve our community and make objects come to life here, on a local scale.

The plastic packaging consumed by Romanians varies between 470 & 5.500 items per person every year. Most of them (23%) are sweets & snacks wrappers, followed by thin plastic bags used mainly for fruits & veggies (16%). Take-away containers represent 12% of the plastic consumption, while 9% is claimed by food packaging. None of these plastics are recyclable (nor in Romania, nor in other waste facilities around the globe).

We make products that are meant to last and be used over and over again (vs. single use), serving  various purposes. Made from durable high-quality materials, they are not meant for single-use and throw-away, the damage made to the environment being huge in this case.

story:
10 reasons to help the vinaceous-breasted parrots:

1. Instituto Espaço Silvestre is a Brazilian non-governmental, non-profit, organization founded in 1999 with the mission to contribute and promote biodiversity conservation through science, education and socioeconomic development.

2. Every year, hundreds of vinaceous-breasted parrots are poached straight from the forests of South America to be kept as illegal pets. This is one of the reasons the species is endangered. These incredibly intelligent birds cannot disppear from the wild!

3. In 2010 we started a project to reintroduce the vinaceous-breasted parrot at the Araucárias National Park where it was extinct. This is the first reintroduction project approved by the Brazilian government in a Federal Protected Area.

4. We rehabilitate parrots victims of the illegal wildlife trade and their offspring and give them a second chance of freedom, Over 100 parrots have gone through a rigorous rehabilitation process, including health exams, genetic analysis and behavioral training.

5. The data we have been collecting and publishing is helping many other species. We are part of different Action Plans and Recovery Programs, including the Spix´s Macaw. 

6. A total of 83 parrots have been released at the Araucárias National Park, where it was previously extinct. We improve animal welfare, give birds a chance to play their ecological roles and contribute to the forest regeneration and species conservation.

7. In oder to decrease the threats that lead to local extinction, we have an environmental educational program. Over 1 million people are engaged in different ways including visit to properties, seminars, school events, distribution of activity guides and other educational material, messages on the radio, publications as well as monitoring of the released parrots through a citizen science program.

8. In order to add economic value to the presence of parrots in the wild, we implemented a work and income generating program for women living around the Araucárias National Park. By creating and selling handcrafted products with environmental themes, their income has increased 62%.

9. We have created the first Vinaceous-breasted parrot Safety Network in Brazil and now we can help birds confiscated all over the country!

10. The project has received many national and international awards!

We depend on people like you to make a difference in the life of animals, people and the forest. Make your donation today!

story:
This project was picked up from the Santa Barbara City College marketing team in order to restore a WWII fighter plane, the PBJ-1.

The North American PBJ-1 Mitchell is an airplane from World War II. Over seven hundred PBJ airplanes served for the US Marine Corp Units, most of them in the South Pacific. This specific plane wasn’t in any battle though, but it is painted to represent an example of one that has flown in the war.

The Commemorative Air Force’s SoCal has been working hard for twenty years to fix the plane. The PBJ airplane is now very close to flying again thanks to Mark Russel who has been one of the main leaders of the project. However, in order to finish and make the plane fly again, they need 50,000 dollars. Those that donate $1,000 or more to the cause will receive a ride from a mustang to the hangar and then embark on a 20 minute flight.

Our group of Students from Santa Barbara City College have been working very hard to compete this project. Here's a little blurb about our group: We are a dedicated group of students from around the world who are working together to achieve our goal and see the PBJ fly. Because of our different cultural backgrounds we are able to bring together different creative ideas for this project. We are enthused to achieve our goal and see a historical plane fly, we really appreciate and are thankful for your generous donation.  

By restoring this timeless aircraft, we are allowing people of all ages to take part in the exhilarating experience of flying in a WWII plane. Most of the replacement gear is modern (for safety reasons and longevity). Whether it be $1, $100 or $1,000, you can be part of a generous group that helped turn this dream of many people, old and young, into a reality.

If you would like to look at the CAF's Facebook page to learn more about the PBJ and what they do, here is the link: https://www.facebook.com/officialcafsocal?fref=ts

story:
Where Italian style and British charm meet sustainability.

We are Gigs Eyewear, a fully sustainable, biodegradable eyewear company created by 3 founders; the missing piece to the world of eyewear.

Our Indiegogo campaign is to create a brand new line of screen glasses and further upgrades to our current sunglasses range. Each order will come complete with a catalogue at the end of the campaign. You will get to choose your styles of eyewear whether it will be sunglasses or screen glasses. 

Gigs was born through a passion for our planet and care for our eyes to see it with. Originating in Chester, UK, the three of us began to design the perfect sunglasses that we thought would not only be essential for our environment, but a stylish icon to it. 

Contributing to this project would be a huge step towards a sustainable yet stylish product allowing us to expand our range and further our research. We ultimately want to bring more of our ideas to life and want everyone to have access to have a pair of Gigs across the world. 

 

What We Need & What You Get


Alongside the persistent hard work we have put into our sunnies; we want to incorporate finished upgraded designs for more styles, blue light filtering & prescription frames with added durability, Zeiss lenses and high tensile sprung hinges to maximize comfort, however we do not have the capital to complete our order, being a startup / standalone company last year and now in the current climate with limited funding it has been challenging. Having the additional capital through providing our product at a discount rate will also help further these amazing glasses and our marketing campaign.

Our campaign is to raise capital to be able to offer not only sustainable sunglasses but blue light filtering, computer glasses and prescription eyewear. 

"Each pair of our handcrafted sunglasses goes through a process of 250 steps to ensure the highest quality and the perfect protection".

 

 

Our packaging is 100% Biodegradable

We worked hard to create a fully sustainable brand, right down to the packaging.

We've worked hard to create fully sustainable sunnies, so why stop at the packaging? Each pair of Gigs will arrive to you in a sleek package which can be re-used or recycled.

 

 

The Impact

Here’s your chance! Gigs sunnies have so much to offer, our protection levels don’t stop at our health, but our planet.

We have analysed that contributing to the mass creation of wooden products is counterproductive, in 2018 the world emitted 37 billion tonnes of carbon dioxide, we see trees as the lungs of our earth so why use them to create our product? Instead we’ve worked with plant based acetate, which in it's design is far more durable but will compost or breakdown to nothing through sewerage over 12 months.

World we are with you! Grab yourself a pair now and contribute to our future. We love it, the world loves it.

 

 

 

The Next Step

Screen Glasses

The next step in our journey is to create screen glasses that have UV protection as well as blue light filters. This protects you indoors and outdoors, whenever exposed to blue light. Screen glasses are of paramount importance to the world of technology; allowing people to sleep better and prevent headaches. 

Sunglasses

We want to create a new range of sunnies using Italian inspired frames; finished with our signature coloured lenses, but designed by Zeiss. Zeiss is an industry leading lens specialist company, famous for creating the best lenses in the world used in Hollywood movies, top quality photography lenses and in many other high end environments. We also are adding new sprung hinges for a comfortable fit & a metal plated logos on the arms to give a quality clean finish.

 


Risks & Challenges

As a small company you could say our ethos is big and bold - we as business owners specialise in our product; always prepare and deliver the best product or service we can, but the reality of it is our customers make us better. We are always looking for ways to improve, and outlining our flaws can make us a successful, sustainable brand with something for everyone. It is now down to us to listen to you and continuously work towards a solution. Our future lies in the hands of our Gigs family. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in our ethics; please support us. We want to challenge the eyewear industry with a product that offers something for everyone. We believe for an affordable price, you will receive a luxury product with top tier protection from the sun and the exposure of blue light. If you can’t invest into us, please stay tuned. We have some very exciting things in the planning for the future and would love to see to see our brand challenge the market leaders and do our bit for the planet too! 

We believe Indiegogo is the perfect platform for us to increase awareness of our sustainable sunnies, whereby people can access affordable eyewear and will in return receive a premium product. Follow us on Instagram @gigs

If we are unsuccessful to our funding goal we will continue our mission regardless of our circumstances and endeavor to fulfill our valued customers orders, if for any unforeseen reason items cannot be shipped, we will ensure our customers a full refund.

 

Collections & Styles

Current Sunglasses Range:

 

Upcoming range:

Sunglasses - 3 New frames arriving in our store (No photos available yet)

Sutton - Clubmaster

Munro -  Hexagonal

Ricorboli - Round

 

Blue Light Range

Milo - Blue, Black & Horn

Roman - Blue, Signature (Black & Transparent) & Transparent

 

Meet the founders

IMPORTANT - How do we get to choose our eyewear?

Each order will come complete with a survey at the end of the campaign. You will get to choose your styles of eyewear whether it will be sunglasses or screen glasses.

Worldwide shipping available!
