story:
l'histoire - la historia - the story


idea, text, edition, translation: Ann (Ana) Trépanier

illustrations : Gilles Wanlinas Dorais

we wish that with this book, consciousness about our way of treating Mother Nature and all living on Mother Earth will raise in order to bring Peace and Harmony on our beautiful planet.  do you want to be part of the solution? please contribute either by sponsoring the publishing of this tale or by forwarding the information to a friend.

when i sent the book to the printing house in Mexico City, they liked the idea and message so much that they offered to start printing it without asking us for a deposit first, these people hardly know me and believe in it.  but in order to get the books,   well we need to pay at least half of the cost, so that is why we are putting this campaign together.  there are some 200 copies being printed right now.... and printing 1000 covers for it that will be available as we print more copies. i am touched.

like Ataksak, the grand-mother polar bear of the magical tale, our dream is for everyone and everything to be able to live in Peace and Harmony, respecting cultures, differences, toughts.  like a friend of mine told me one day: ''inside we are all the same''... just think about it!

i see this colorful, illustraded magic tale as a tool to bring people closer, reading, listening, observing together!!   i also see it being used to teach about different people and animals living on Turtle Island and their customs, languages... learning geography in the same time...

one of my wish for this book is to have it translated in Maya and in Inuktitut, by that becoming a way to learn native languages.

i already have on my agenda, a few readings of the book, with projections of the illustrations.  during this interactive presentation, the participants will be able to ask questions and find more information about nature, geography, people, customs, languaes.  this will take place at the Biblioteca Maurilio Sanchez de la colonia Zetina Gasca de Puerto Morelos.  it is part of the summer program for the youth of Puerto Morelos.  60 kids are registered to attend the summer camp... and at La Casa de la Cultura de Puerto Morelos.  i just can't wait!!!

we thank you for the time you take every day to bring love, warmth, hugs, respect to everybody and everything around you.... every gesture, every word counts! start with a big big SMILE and see how people respond, its amazing!!!

about us, Ana and Gilles:

we both are artists. each of us in our own way.

Ana

my name is Ann, but when i arrived here in Puerto Morelos, my mexican friends found it better to name me Ana, so i became Ana. gracias a mi familia mexicana!

in the past years i have developped a technique making a piece of plastic ''fabric'' while recycling plastic shopping bags. some people would call it ''plastic fusion''.  from that piece, i fashion wallets, handbags, beach and shopping bags, book cover, and many more items.  also used, are dog food bags for different parts of the products.  through this art i am bringing awareness about the plastic that surrounds us.  my dream is to have no more plastic bags to work with!!! 

also, i have put together my own local tour here.  i invite our visitors to walk with me in a part of town (la colonia) where not many tourists go, being further away from the beach zone.  through this they lean about history of our pueblo, environmental issues, education system, working conditions, some spanish and mayan words, local products available to them while supporting our local economy... and if i dont know the answer, i just ask around and get that answer... everybody enjoys it, locals and visitors...

we also organize events where the visitors can learn about the traditional way of Mayan cooking.  A Mayan couple from a small pueblo comes to our place and share their knowledge of preparing, cooking and sharing their food.  by that we want more and more people to be aware of the simple life that is enjoyed here and of the culture and traditions that still exist in our part of the planet.  a good time to learn Maya, as they speak together in their native tongue.  Malo Kin (Good Day)

in the past i have organized or participated in events promoting recycling, awareness of Water, local traditions and culture, youth entertainment...

while living here, i had the opportunity to meet people from all over the World.  All are concerned about Mother Earth just like us.  hopefully changes in our way of consuming will help Her!!!!  Gracias !

Gilles

has over 50 years experience as a painter, sculptor (wood, stone, bone) and worked for 25 years with Radio Canada in Montreal as a scenic artist.

in his art he likes to representant the first nations culture and traditions.  As he does when representing the Abenaki people in Pow Wow, international and local cultural events, schools, elders homes, historical parks.  he was recepient of a Grant from the Council of Art of Canada - First Nations for work that he did with youth.  his piece ''the signing of the Great Peace, Montreal, 1701'' is part of the permanent collection of the Musée de la Pointe à Calliêres in Montreal.

https://www.google.com/culturalinstitute/asset-viewer/dAHiPWAkwoYx-A?projectId=art-project

he has been involved in his comunity and he is a well respected member.

one of his wish is to bring people together, so in order to do so we put together events here in Puerto Morelos where the North (being represented by the Blue Wolf) meet the South (being represented by the Jaguar) while this takes place where visitors from all over the world can participate as well.  and we are looking forward to organize more of these events, where a group of elders from the North would come here and share their cultures and traditions with those living here.

he also enjoys transmitting his knowledge of painting to the youth, he has done so in the past and still is doing it.  the next project is teaching teenagers from Puerto Morelos on how to paint murals.  this will take place in October 2015 at the local library. The project is called ''Dale Voz a la Pared''. we are planning a campaing for it on indigogo life... please check it out!

this is only one of my dreams, to know more, please go to the perks and let's have some coffee!!

we both are concerned about the environment on Mother Earth and the changes that are ocurring which are endangering our future and the one of our children.  we both think that self-respect will bring respect to others.  we both participate and/or organize events supporting the culture, art, youth, environment. we both enjoy nature, people, cultural exchanges,  and simple life!

the video that you are able to see here, is one for you to enjoy a little bit of what we enjoy living.... the image is not so great, but hey i work with what i have available, a regular old school Kodak camera!!!

thank you for your time and support!!! Light, Love and Peace to us All !!

a few pictures to get to know us.....

mayan cooking experience with our mayan family Conchita and Santos

meeting North South at Jungle Market, Puerto Morelos 2014

mural ''el chiclero'' in honor of the chicleros that have the knowledge on how to make chewing gum from the sap of the zapote tree, painted by Gilles Wanlinas Dorais

all the funds will go to :
writing
illustrating
editing
printing
publishing
presentations in public
transportation
marketing
managing campaign
indigo fees
perks

if you think that it is worth supporting the message delivered by Ataksak, please sponsor or forward... sending you lots of sunshine from Puerto Morelos, gracias!

you can follow Ataksak activities on her page :
https://www.facebook.com/pages/LOurs-%C3%A0-Gants-La-Osa-de-los-Guantes-the-Gloved-Bear/1682041828748907
you can find out more about Ana and Gilles :
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Ana-de-las-Bolsa...

Ataksak personal facebook page:  Ataksak la Osa

tweeter: @ours_a_gants   the message is being transmitted, thank you for reading!!!

you may also ''google'' us:  Ana Trepanier, Gilles Wanlinas Dorais

AND LAST BUT NOT LEAST... A BIG GRACIAS A INDIEGOGO FOR PUTTING THIS TOGETHER.... ANOTHER DREAM, VISION COME THROUGH, SO GREAT !!!

story:
English version Deutsche Version  




Let's be honest: getting around the city can be really annoying. It does not matter if you are using your own car, public transportation or taxi services. All these different transportation modes have unavoidable drawbacks: delays, traffic jams, and pricing, just to name a few. This is why we started SEEMO.

SEEMO stands for sustainable, efficient and electric mobility and it is the revolution of public transportation. SEEMO combines the advantages of private vehicles with conventional public transportation systems and modern technology. It is public transportation on-demand.

Compared to private vehicles, SEEMO is able to reduce emissions by up to 91%, traffic by 73% and cost by 44%. Not to mention a 100% reduction of stress and commuter rage.

And these are not the only advantages. SEEMO is environmentally friendly, efficient, economical, easy to use, good for your health, flexible, reliable and quiet. SEEMO means less smog, less contribution to global warming, fewer traffic jams, reduced greenhouse gas emissions, reduced noise pollution, no parking issues, and less emissions and particulate matter.


SEEMO coordinates a fleet of electric vehicles, which are used to satisfy the travel needs of its users. New travel requests are dynamically integrated into existing routes using the latest optimization technologies. In this way it is possible to offer a transportation service which is not only environmental friendly and sustainable, but at the same time also flexible and efficient. These features are of great importance, but missing in most of the conventional public transportation services.

From the user point of view, SEEMO is extremely simple:

Using the SEEMO app, you just have to select your desired departure time, your departure location and your destination. That's all. At the desired departure time a bus will pick you up at your departure location. You then travel towards your destination, sharing the bus with other passengers who travel in the same direction. At the end, you exit the bus at your actual destination. No parking or walking required.


  • According to the World Health Organization, air pollution is now the world’s largest single environmental health risk.
  • Smog and ozone caused by traffic are a huge problem in many cities and metropolitan areas throughout the world.
  • According to the European Environmental Agency, transportation in Europe in 2013 caused a total of 887 million tons of CO2 emission. That's 887,000,000,000 kg of CO2.
  • People in Europe and the US are currently wasting on average 111 hours annually in traffic jams. [1]
  • Traffic congestion currently cost drivers annually $1,740 on average across Germany, France, the UK and the US. The annual cost of gridlock to these countries is around $200 billion. That's $200,000,000,000. [1]
  • According to a study conducted by APCOA, finding a parking spot in Germany takes on average almost 10 minutes, and in Italy even up to 15 minutes. Additionally, on average each search for a parking spot requires 4.5 km of driving, leads to 1.3 kg of CO2 emission and costs 1.35 euro.
  • According to several studies conducted between 1927 and 2001, "on average 30 percent of the cars in congested downtown traffic were cruising for parking." [2]
  • Conventional public transportation is of no practical alternative. A recent study shows that "71% of car users felt that public transport was not as convenient as a car, 72% said that a lack of connections was a problem, 64% mentioned a low frequency of services and 54% said they did not use public transport because it was not reliable." [3]


The ultimate goal of this campaign is to realize the SEEMO public transportation service as a pilot project in a carefully selected city. An integral part of this endeavor will be the development of a complex and sophisticated software system. This system consists of three main components:

  1. Core System: is responsible for the coordination of the vehicles and manages the interactions between the users and the SEEMO system.
  2. User Application: allows the user to book trips and provides real-time trip information and statistics.
  3. Driver Application: displays routing and customer information, provided by the Core System.

For the development we would like to form a small development team of skilled software engineers which share our vision. Our tentative schedule looks as follows:

  • Milestone 1: Simulation of the Core System using real-world map and traffic data and the integration of the User Application with the Core System.
  • Milestone 2: Integration of the Driver Application with the Core System.

The main difficulty of this project is the actual realization of a pilot project in a carefully selected city. This part of the project requires the support of cities and communities and might even involve other parties. We are aware of the fact that we will face multiple uncertainties. But we are also confident that we will successfully deal with all the upcoming issues.


SEEMO is a revolutionary transportation service and a vision for a better world. We believe that helping our environment and improving our health is the duty of all of us. Making this world a better place and providing a convenient, ethical and affordable transportation service are both extremely strong incentives to support this campaign.

We also provide special perks for everyone who supports us at this early stage of the project and who shares our vision of a better world.

The most spectacular perk is the "SEEMO unlimited lifetime perk". Claiming this awesome perk allows you to use any transportation service that will be based on SEEMO

  • free of charge,
  • in the whole world,
  • for your whole lifetime!

In addition, we offer a variety of perks directly expressing our gratitude for your support, including a list of supporters on our website, stickers and certificates. Furthermore, we offer several perks which can be used for any transportation service throughout the whole world that will be based on SEEMO.

Finally, there is also a limited amount of plates, displaying the names of supporters or supporting companies, available. These plates are placed on the vehicles used throughout the pilot project.


We already mentioned that we have conducted extensive research about on-demand transportation services during the last years. Our consistently positive results were the basis for the development of SEEMO. The results we presented earlier are only a very small excerpt of our comprehensive studies. For more information about our scientific work please contact us at ResearchGate.

Currently we are focusing on a traffic simulation using real-world map data. This simulation is used for the comparison of SEEMO with other modes of transportation in a realistic setting. Several performance indicators such as travel times, costs, emissions, responsiveness and scalability are measured. These indicators are extremely valuable during the planning phase of a SEEMO project.



Dennis Weyland - Researcher - Switzerland
Holds a PhD in computer science. Studied computer science and mathematics. Author of multiple scientific articles published in internationally renowned journals, in particular in the field of logistics and transportation. Worked at universities in Germany, Switzerland and Italy.


Peter Detzner - Software Engineer - Germany
Has a MSc in electric and computer engineering and a BSc in computing & networks. Holder of several patents in the field of home automation and human machine interfaces. Has a strong experience in the development of software systems and mobile applications.


Stefania Poletti - Advertising Creative - United States
Creative Director and founder of Kindvertising LLC. Has a Master of Science in Advertising from Boston University and over five years of agency experience - particularly in digital and social media marketing.



Mal im ernst: so richtig funktioniert der Nahverkehr in Städten doch nicht. Egal ob es das eigene Auto ist, der öffentliche Personennahverkehr oder Taxiunternehmen. All diese Transportmöglichkeiten haben schwerwiegende Nachteile: Verspätungen, Staus, Fahrpreise und noch viele weitere. Und aus diesem Grund haben wir SEEMO gestartet.

SEEMO steht für nachhaltige, effiziente und elektrische Mobilität und ist die Revolution im öffentlichen Personennahverkehr. SEEMO kombiniert die Vorteile des Individualverkehrs mit dem öffentlichen Personennahverkehr und modernen Technologien. Es ist öffentlicher Nahverkehr nach Bedarf.

Gegenüber privaten Autos könnten mit SEEMO Emissionen um bis zu 91%, Verkehr um 73% und Kosten um 44% verringert werden. Dazu kommt noch eine Reduktion von Stress und Wut im öffentlichen Nahverkehr um 100%.

Und hierbei handelt es sich nicht um die einzigen Vorteile. SEEMO ist umweltfreundlich, effizient, günstig, einfach zu benutzen, gesund, flexibel, zuverlässig und leise. SEEMO bedeutet weniger Smog, geringerer Beitrag zur globalen Erderwärmung, weniger Staus, verringerter Ausstoß von Treibhausgasen, weniger Verkehr, reduzierte Lärmbelästigung, keine Parkplatzsuche und weniger Feinstaub.


SEEMO koordiniert eine Flotte von elektrischen Fahrzeugen, welche die Transportbedürfnisse der Kunden abdeckt. Neue Fahrtwünsche werden mithilfe von modernsten Optimierungsmethoden dynamisch in die bestehenden Routen eingefügt. Das Resultat ist ein System für den öffentlichen Personennahverkehr, welches nicht nur umweltfreundlich und nachhaltig, sondern auch flexibel und effizient ist. Diese Eigenschaften sind extrem wichtig, fehlen aber in vielen herkömmlichen Transportsystemen.

Aus Benutzersicht funktioniert SEEMO wie folgt:

Um eine Fahrt zu buchen, muss in der SEEMO App lediglich die gewünschte Abfahrtszeit, der Startort und der Zielort eingeben werden. Das ist alles. Zur gewünschten Abfahrtszeit wird man von einem der Kleinbusse am Startort abgeholt. Auf dem Weg zum Zielort steigen gelegentlich andere Fahrgäste, die in die gleiche Richtung unterwegs sind, ein oder aus. So kommt man einfach und unkompliziert zum Ziel, ohne lästige Parkplatzsuche und ohne jegliche Fußwege.


  • Laut Weltgesundheitsorganisation ist Luftverschmutzung weltweit das größte umweltbezogene Gesundheitsrisiko.
  • Verkehrsbedingter Smog und Ozon sind große Probleme in vielen Städten und Ballungsgebieten weltweit.
  • Gemäß Statistiken der Europäischen Umweltagentur wurden allein im Jahr 2013 durch Verkehr 887 Millionen Tonnen an CO2 Emission verursacht. Das sind 887.000.000.000 kg CO2.
  • Menschen in Europa und den USA verschwenden jährlich im Durchschnitt 111 Stunden in Staus. [1]
  • Stau und dichter Verkehr kosten Autofahrern in Deutschland, Frankreich, Großbrittanien und den USA im Durchschnitt jährlich 1.740 Dollar. Die Gesamtkosten in diesen Ländern betragen jährlich 200 Milliarden Dollar. Das sind 200.000.000.000 Dollar. [1]
  • Gemäß einer Studie der APCOA, dauert es in Deutschland im Durchschnitt fast 10 Minuten um einen Parkplatz zu finden, in Italien sind es sogar bis zu 15 Minuten. Zusätzlich verursacht jede Parkplatzsuche im Durchschnitt Mehrfahrten von 4,5 km, CO2 Emissionen von 1,3 kg und Kosten von 1,35 Euro.
  • Laut mehrerer Studien zwischen 1927 und 2001 sind "im Durchschnitt 30% der Autos in dichtem Stadtverkehr auf Parkplatzsuche. [2]
  • Herkömmlicher öffentlicher Personennahverkehr ist keine praktische Alternative. Eine aktuelle Studie zeigt: "71% der Fahrer halten öffentlichen Nahverkehr für weniger komfortabel als das private Auto, 72% geben an, dass ein Mangel an Verbindungen ein Problem darstellt, 64% erwähnen die geringe Frequenz und 54% geben an, dass sie den öffentlichen Nahverkehr nicht nutzen, weil dieser nicht zuverlässig ist." [3]


Das große Ziel dieser Kampagne ist, SEEMO in einer sorgfältig ausgewählten Stadt als Pilotprojekt zu realisieren. Ein wichtiger Bestandteil hierbei ist die Entwicklung eines komplexen Softwaresystems. Dieses System besteht im wesentlichen aus drei Komponenten:

  1. Hauptsystem: ist zuständig für die Koordination der Fahrzeug-Flotte sowie für die  Interaktionen zwischen den Nutzern, Fahrern und dem SEEMO System.
  2. Nutzer App: diese App ermöglicht das Buchen von Fahrten und stellt in Echtzeit Informationen und Statistiken zu Fahrten bereit.
  3. Fahrer App: diese App stellt für den Fahrer sowohl Routen- als Nutzerinformationen (wer der nächste Kunde ist) dar, die vom Hauptsystem zur Verfügung gestellt werden. 

Für die Entwicklung würden wir gerne ein kleines Team von talentierten Softwareentwicklern aufstellen. Der vorläufige Projektplan sieht wie folgt aus:

  • Milestone 1: die Nutzer App wird in das Hauptsystem (Core System) integriert. Das Hauptsystem arbeitet hierbei mit realen Karten-  und Verkehrsdaten.
  • Milestone 2: die Fahrer App wird in das Hauptsystem integriert.

Eine Herausforderung bei diesem Projektes wird die Integration von SEEMO in die Praxis darstellen. Hierbei werden wir die Unterstützung von Städten, Gemeinden und weiteren Gruppen benötigen. Wir sind uns bewusst, dass wir mit vielen Unsicherheiten rechnen müssen. Aber wir sind auch zuversichtlich, dass wir diese Herausforderungen erfolgreich bewältigen werden.


SEEMO ist ein revolutionäres System für den öffentlichen Nahverkehr mit vielen Vorteilen für uns und unsere Umwelt. Wir glauben, dass es die Pflicht von uns allen ist, diese Vorteile auszuschöpfen. Die Welt zu verbessern und gleichzeitig noch ein komfortables, umweltfreundliches und ethisch vertretbares Transportsystem zu realisieren sind zwei sehr starke Anreize, um diese Kampagne zu unterstützen.

Zusätzlich stellen wir auch noch verschiedene Vergütungen (Perks) für all diejenigen zur Verfügung, die unsere Vorstellung von einer besseren Welt teilen und uns schon in dieser frühen Phase des Projekts unterstützen.

Unser spannendster Perk ist der "SEEMO unlimited lifetime perk". Mit diesem Perk ist es möglich alle Transportsysteme, die jemals mit SEEMO realisiert werden wie folgt zu nutzen:

  • kostenfrei,
  • in der ganzen Welt,
  • auf Lebenszeit!

Darüberhinaus bieten wir auch noch einige Perks an, durch die wir uns direkt bei unseren Unterstützern bedanken. Diese beinhalten eine Liste aller Unterstützer auf unserer Webseite, Sticker und Zertifikate. Desweiteren bieten wir auch noch zahlreiche Perks an, die für die Nutzung von Transportsystemen, die mit SEEMO realisiert werden, verwendet werden können.

Zu guter Letzt gibt es auch noch eine limitierte Anzahl an Fahrzeugplaketten, die den Namen des Unterstützers oder der unterstützenden Firma zeigen und welche gut lesbar auf den SEEMO Fahrzeugen im Pilotprojekt angebracht werden.


Wir haben bereits erwähnt, dass wir in den letzten Jahren verschiedene Forschungsprojekte über neuartige Systeme für den öffentlichen Nahverkehr durchgeführt haben. Die Ergebnisse, die wir weiter oben vorgestellt haben, sind lediglich ein kleiner Auszug aus unseren umfassenden Forschungsresultaten. Für weitere Informationen bzgl. unserer wissenschaftlichen Arbeiten stehen wir auf ResearchGate zur Verfügung.

Zur Zeit arbeiten wir an einem Verkehrssimulator basierend auf realem Kartenmaterial. Dieser Simulator wird dazu genutzt, SEEMO in einer realistischen Umgebung mit anderen Transportmöglichkeiten zu vergleichen. Wir messen mehrere Indikatoren, wie z.B. Fahrtzeiten, Kosten, Emissionen, Reaktionsfreudigkeit und Skalierbarkeit. Diese Indikatoren sind während der Planungsphase von SEEMO von großer Bedeutung.



Dennis Weyland - Wissenschaftler - Schweiz
Besitzt einen Doktortitel im Bereich Informatik. Hat Informatik und Mathematik studiert. Autor einer Vielzahl von wissenschaftlichen Artikeln, veröffentlicht in international anerkannten Fachzeitschriften. Insbesondere Arbeiten in den Bereichen Transport und Logistik. War an Universitäten in Deutschland, der Schweiz und Italien tätig.


Peter Detzner - Softwareentwickler - Deutschland
Hat einen MSc in Elektro- und Informationstechnik sowie einen BSc in Computing & Networks. Halter von diversen Patenten im Bereich der Gebäudesystemtechnik (SmartHome) und von neuartigen Benutzerschnittstellen (Human-Machine-Interfaces). Sein Fokus in den letzten Jahren liegt auf der Entwicklung von Softwaresystemen und mobilen Anwendungen.


Stefania Poletti - Marketing - USA
Kreativdirektorin und Gründerin von Kindvertising LLC. Hat einen Master in Marketing von der Universität Boston und mehr als fünf Jahre Berufserfahrung - insbesondere in den Bereichen digitales Marketing und Social Media Marketing.



References

  • [1] http://inrix.com/economic-environment-cost-cong...
  • [2] http://www.accessmagazine.org/articles/spring-2...
  • [3] http://ec.europa.eu/public_opinion/flash/fl_312...

Credits

  • The image used for the campaign picture, the video overlay and the first image in the campaign text is Bright Atlanta (CC BY-SA 2.0) by Brett Weinstein (Nrbelex).
  • The second image in the campaign text is Busy traffic (CC BY 2.0) by dingcarrie.
  • The third image in the campaign text is Vista de Ciudad Ho Chi Minh desde Bitexco Financial Tower, Vietnam, 2013-08-14, DD 13 by Diego Delso. Licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0 via Commons.
  • The fourth image in the campaign text is Traffic lights at night in a city by Petr Kratochvil. Licensed under Public Domain. Released to the Public Domain by the author.
  • The fifth image in the campaign text is Cidade Grande (CC BY 2.0) by Moisés Silva Lima (Field Biologist).
story_txt:
English version
Deutsche Version  



Let's be honest: getting around the city can be really annoying. It does not matter if you are using your own car, public transportation or taxi services. All these different transportation modes have unavoidable drawbacks: delays, traffic jams, and pricing, just to name a few. This is why we started SEEMO.
SEEMO stands for sustainable, efficient and electric mobility and it is the revolution of public transportation. SEEMO combines the advantages of private vehicles with conventional public transportation systems and modern technology. It is public transportation on-demand.
Compared to private vehicles, SEEMO is able to reduce emissions by up to 91%, traffic by 73% and cost by 44%. Not to mention a 100% reduction of stress and commuter rage.
And these are not the only advantages. SEEMO is environmentally friendly, efficient, economical, easy to use, good for your health, flexible, reliable and quiet. SEEMO means less smog, less contribution to global warming, fewer traffic jams, reduced greenhouse gas emissions, reduced noise pollution, no parking issues, and less emissions and particulate matter.


SEEMO coordinates a fleet of electric vehicles, which are used to satisfy the travel needs of its users. New travel requests are dynamically integrated into existing routes using the latest optimization technologies. In this way it is possible to offer a transportation service which is not only environmental friendly and sustainable, but at the same time also flexible and efficient. These features are of great importance, but missing in most of the conventional public transportation services.
From the user point of view, SEEMO is extremely simple:
Using the SEEMO app, you just have to select your desired departure time, your departure location and your destination. That's all. At the desired departure time a bus will pick you up at your departure location. You then travel towards your destination, sharing the bus with other passengers who travel in the same direction. At the end, you exit the bus at your actual destination. No parking or walking required.



According to the World Health Organization, air pollution is now the world’s largest single environmental health risk.
Smog and ozone caused by traffic are a huge problem in many cities and metropolitan areas throughout the world.
According to the European Environmental Agency, transportation in Europe in 2013 caused a total of 887 million tons of CO2 emission. That's 887,000,000,000 kg of CO2.
People in Europe and the US are currently wasting on average 111 hours annually in traffic jams. [1]
Traffic congestion currently cost drivers annually $1,740 on average across Germany, France, the UK and the US. The annual cost of gridlock to these countries is around $200 billion. That's $200,000,000,000. [1]
According to a study conducted by APCOA, finding a parking spot in Germany takes on average almost 10 minutes, and in Italy even up to 15 minutes. Additionally, on average each search for a parking spot requires 4.5 km of driving, leads to 1.3 kg of CO2 emission and costs 1.35 euro.
According to several studies conducted between 1927 and 2001, "on average 30 percent of the cars in congested downtown traffic were cruising for parking." [2]
Conventional public transportation is of no practical alternative. A recent study shows that "71% of car users felt that public transport was not as convenient as a car, 72% said that a lack of connections was a problem, 64% mentioned a low frequency of services and 54% said they did not use public transport because it was not reliable." [3]



The ultimate goal of this campaign is to realize the SEEMO public transportation service as a pilot project in a carefully selected city. An integral part of this endeavor will be the development of a complex and sophisticated software system. This system consists of three main components:


Core System: is responsible for the coordination of the vehicles and manages the interactions between the users and the SEEMO system.


User Application: allows the user to book trips and provides real-time trip information and statistics.


Driver Application: displays routing and customer information, provided by the Core System.


For the development we would like to form a small development team of skilled software engineers which share our vision. Our tentative schedule looks as follows:



Milestone 1: Simulation of the Core System using real-world map and traffic data and the integration of the User Application with the Core System.

Milestone 2: Integration of the Driver Application with the Core System.

The main difficulty of this project is the actual realization of a pilot project in a carefully selected city. This part of the project requires the support of cities and communities and might even involve other parties. We are aware of the fact that we will face multiple uncertainties. But we are also confident that we will successfully deal with all the upcoming issues.


SEEMO is a revolutionary transportation service and a vision for a better world. We believe that helping our environment and improving our health is the duty of all of us. Making this world a better place and providing a convenient, ethical and affordable transportation service are both extremely strong incentives to support this campaign.
We also provide special perks for everyone who supports us at this early stage of the project and who shares our vision of a better world.
The most spectacular perk is the "SEEMO unlimited lifetime perk". Claiming this awesome perk allows you to use any transportation service that will be based on SEEMO

free of charge,
in the whole world,
for your whole lifetime!

In addition, we offer a variety of perks directly expressing our gratitude for your support, including a list of supporters on our website, stickers and certificates. Furthermore, we offer several perks which can be used for any transportation service throughout the whole world that will be based on SEEMO.
Finally, there is also a limited amount of plates, displaying the names of supporters or supporting companies, available. These plates are placed on the vehicles used throughout the pilot project.


We already mentioned that we have conducted extensive research about on-demand transportation services during the last years. Our consistently positive results were the basis for the development of SEEMO. The results we presented earlier are only a very small excerpt of our comprehensive studies. For more information about our scientific work please contact us at ResearchGate.
Currently we are focusing on a traffic simulation using real-world map data. This simulation is used for the comparison of SEEMO with other modes of transportation in a realistic setting. Several performance indicators such as travel times, costs, emissions, responsiveness and scalability are measured. These indicators are extremely valuable during the planning phase of a SEEMO project.





Dennis Weyland - Researcher - Switzerland
Holds a PhD in computer science. Studied computer science and 
mathematics. Author of multiple scientific articles published in 
internationally renowned journals, in particular in the field of logistics and transportation. Worked at universities in Germany, Switzerland and Italy.





Peter Detzner - Software Engineer - Germany
Has a MSc in electric and computer engineering and a BSc in computing & networks. Holder of several patents in the field of home automation and human machine interfaces. Has a strong experience in the development of software systems and mobile applications.





Stefania Poletti - Advertising Creative - United StatesCreative Director and founder of Kindvertising LLC. Has a Master of Science in Advertising from Boston University and over five years of agency experience - particularly in digital and social media marketing.





Mal im ernst: so richtig funktioniert der Nahverkehr in Städten doch nicht. Egal ob es das eigene Auto ist, der öffentliche Personennahverkehr oder Taxiunternehmen. All diese Transportmöglichkeiten haben schwerwiegende Nachteile: Verspätungen, Staus, Fahrpreise und noch viele weitere. Und aus diesem Grund haben wir SEEMO gestartet.
SEEMO steht für nachhaltige, effiziente und elektrische Mobilität und ist die Revolution im öffentlichen Personennahverkehr. SEEMO kombiniert die Vorteile des Individualverkehrs mit dem öffentlichen Personennahverkehr und modernen Technologien. Es ist öffentlicher Nahverkehr nach Bedarf.
Gegenüber privaten Autos könnten mit SEEMO Emissionen um bis zu 91%, Verkehr um 73% und Kosten um 44% verringert werden. Dazu kommt noch eine Reduktion von Stress und Wut im öffentlichen Nahverkehr um 100%.
Und hierbei handelt es sich nicht um die einzigen Vorteile. SEEMO ist umweltfreundlich, effizient, günstig, einfach zu benutzen, gesund, flexibel, zuverlässig und leise. SEEMO bedeutet weniger Smog, geringerer Beitrag zur globalen Erderwärmung, weniger Staus, verringerter Ausstoß von Treibhausgasen, weniger Verkehr, reduzierte Lärmbelästigung, keine Parkplatzsuche und weniger Feinstaub.

SEEMO koordiniert eine Flotte von elektrischen Fahrzeugen, welche die Transportbedürfnisse der Kunden abdeckt. Neue Fahrtwünsche werden mithilfe von modernsten Optimierungsmethoden dynamisch in die bestehenden Routen eingefügt. Das Resultat ist ein System für den öffentlichen Personennahverkehr, welches nicht nur umweltfreundlich und nachhaltig, sondern auch flexibel und effizient ist. Diese Eigenschaften sind extrem wichtig, fehlen aber in vielen herkömmlichen Transportsystemen.
Aus Benutzersicht funktioniert SEEMO wie folgt:
Um eine Fahrt zu buchen, muss in der SEEMO App lediglich die gewünschte Abfahrtszeit, der Startort und der Zielort eingeben werden. Das ist alles. Zur gewünschten Abfahrtszeit wird man von einem der Kleinbusse am Startort abgeholt. Auf dem Weg zum Zielort steigen gelegentlich andere Fahrgäste, die in die gleiche Richtung unterwegs sind, ein oder aus. So kommt man einfach und unkompliziert zum Ziel, ohne lästige Parkplatzsuche und ohne jegliche Fußwege.


Laut Weltgesundheitsorganisation ist Luftverschmutzung weltweit das größte umweltbezogene Gesundheitsrisiko.
Verkehrsbedingter Smog und Ozon sind große Probleme in vielen Städten und Ballungsgebieten weltweit.
Gemäß Statistiken der Europäischen Umweltagentur wurden allein im Jahr 2013 durch Verkehr 887 Millionen Tonnen an CO2 Emission verursacht. Das sind 887.000.000.000 kg CO2.
Menschen in Europa und den USA verschwenden jährlich im Durchschnitt 111 Stunden in Staus. [1]
Stau und dichter Verkehr kosten Autofahrern in Deutschland, Frankreich, Großbrittanien und den USA im Durchschnitt jährlich 1.740 Dollar. Die Gesamtkosten in diesen Ländern betragen jährlich 200 Milliarden Dollar. Das sind 200.000.000.000 Dollar. [1]
Gemäß einer Studie der APCOA, dauert es in Deutschland im Durchschnitt fast 10 Minuten um einen Parkplatz zu finden, in Italien sind es sogar bis zu 15 Minuten. Zusätzlich verursacht jede Parkplatzsuche im Durchschnitt Mehrfahrten von 4,5 km, CO2 Emissionen von 1,3 kg und Kosten von 1,35 Euro.
Laut mehrerer Studien zwischen 1927 und 2001 sind "im Durchschnitt 30% der Autos in dichtem Stadtverkehr auf Parkplatzsuche. [2]
Herkömmlicher öffentlicher Personennahverkehr ist keine praktische Alternative. Eine aktuelle Studie zeigt: "71% der Fahrer halten öffentlichen Nahverkehr für weniger komfortabel als das private Auto, 72% geben an, dass ein Mangel an Verbindungen ein Problem darstellt, 64% erwähnen die geringe Frequenz und 54% geben an, dass sie den öffentlichen Nahverkehr nicht nutzen, weil dieser nicht zuverlässig ist." [3]


Das große Ziel dieser Kampagne ist, SEEMO in einer sorgfältig ausgewählten Stadt als Pilotprojekt zu realisieren. Ein wichtiger Bestandteil hierbei ist die Entwicklung eines komplexen Softwaresystems. Dieses System besteht im wesentlichen aus drei Komponenten:


Hauptsystem: ist zuständig für die Koordination der Fahrzeug-Flotte sowie für die  Interaktionen zwischen den Nutzern, Fahrern und dem SEEMO System.


Nutzer App: diese App ermöglicht das Buchen von Fahrten und stellt in Echtzeit Informationen und Statistiken zu Fahrten bereit.


Fahrer App: diese App stellt für den Fahrer sowohl Routen- als Nutzerinformationen (wer der nächste Kunde ist) dar, die vom Hauptsystem zur Verfügung gestellt werden. 


Für die Entwicklung würden wir gerne ein kleines Team von talentierten Softwareentwicklern aufstellen. Der vorläufige Projektplan sieht wie folgt aus:



Milestone 1: die Nutzer App wird in das Hauptsystem (Core System) integriert. Das Hauptsystem arbeitet hierbei mit realen Karten-  und Verkehrsdaten.


Milestone 2: die Fahrer App wird in das Hauptsystem integriert.

Eine Herausforderung bei diesem Projektes wird die Integration von SEEMO in die Praxis darstellen. Hierbei werden wir die Unterstützung von Städten, Gemeinden und weiteren Gruppen benötigen. Wir sind uns bewusst, dass wir mit vielen Unsicherheiten rechnen müssen. Aber wir sind auch zuversichtlich, dass wir diese Herausforderungen erfolgreich bewältigen werden.

SEEMO ist ein revolutionäres System für den öffentlichen Nahverkehr mit vielen Vorteilen für uns und unsere Umwelt. Wir glauben, dass es die Pflicht von uns allen ist, diese Vorteile auszuschöpfen. Die Welt zu verbessern und gleichzeitig noch ein komfortables, umweltfreundliches und ethisch vertretbares Transportsystem zu realisieren sind zwei sehr starke Anreize, um diese Kampagne zu unterstützen.
Zusätzlich stellen wir auch noch verschiedene Vergütungen (Perks) für all diejenigen zur Verfügung, die unsere Vorstellung von einer besseren Welt teilen und uns schon in dieser frühen Phase des Projekts unterstützen.
Unser spannendster Perk ist der "SEEMO unlimited lifetime perk". Mit diesem Perk ist es möglich alle Transportsysteme, die jemals mit SEEMO realisiert werden wie folgt zu nutzen:

kostenfrei,
in der ganzen Welt,
auf Lebenszeit!

Darüberhinaus bieten wir auch noch einige Perks an, durch die wir uns direkt bei unseren Unterstützern bedanken. Diese beinhalten eine Liste aller Unterstützer auf unserer Webseite, Sticker und Zertifikate. Desweiteren bieten wir auch noch zahlreiche Perks an, die für die Nutzung von Transportsystemen, die mit SEEMO realisiert werden, verwendet werden können.
Zu guter Letzt gibt es auch noch eine limitierte Anzahl an Fahrzeugplaketten, die den Namen des Unterstützers oder der unterstützenden Firma zeigen und welche gut lesbar auf den SEEMO Fahrzeugen im Pilotprojekt angebracht werden.

Wir haben bereits erwähnt, dass wir in den letzten Jahren verschiedene Forschungsprojekte über neuartige Systeme für den öffentlichen Nahverkehr durchgeführt haben. Die Ergebnisse, die wir weiter oben vorgestellt haben, sind lediglich ein kleiner Auszug aus unseren umfassenden Forschungsresultaten. Für weitere Informationen bzgl. unserer wissenschaftlichen Arbeiten stehen wir auf ResearchGate zur Verfügung.
Zur Zeit arbeiten wir an einem Verkehrssimulator basierend auf realem Kartenmaterial. Dieser Simulator wird dazu genutzt, SEEMO in einer realistischen Umgebung mit anderen Transportmöglichkeiten zu vergleichen. Wir messen mehrere Indikatoren, wie z.B. Fahrtzeiten, Kosten, Emissionen, Reaktionsfreudigkeit und Skalierbarkeit. Diese Indikatoren sind während der Planungsphase von SEEMO von großer Bedeutung.




Dennis Weyland - Wissenschaftler - Schweiz
Besitzt einen Doktortitel im Bereich Informatik. Hat Informatik und Mathematik studiert. Autor einer Vielzahl von wissenschaftlichen Artikeln, veröffentlicht in international anerkannten Fachzeitschriften. Insbesondere Arbeiten in den Bereichen Transport und Logistik. War an Universitäten in Deutschland, der Schweiz und Italien tätig.





Peter Detzner - Softwareentwickler - DeutschlandHat einen MSc in Elektro- und Informationstechnik sowie einen BSc in Computing & Networks. Halter von diversen Patenten im Bereich der Gebäudesystemtechnik (SmartHome) und von neuartigen Benutzerschnittstellen (Human-Machine-Interfaces). Sein Fokus in den letzten Jahren liegt auf der Entwicklung von Softwaresystemen und mobilen Anwendungen.





Stefania Poletti - Marketing - USAKreativdirektorin und Gründerin von Kindvertising LLC. Hat einen Master in Marketing von der Universität Boston und mehr als fünf Jahre Berufserfahrung - insbesondere in den Bereichen digitales Marketing und Social Media Marketing.





References

[1] http://inrix.com/economic-environment-cost-cong...

[2] http://www.accessmagazine.org/articles/spring-2...

[3] http://ec.europa.eu/public_opinion/flash/fl_312...


Credits
The image used for the campaign picture, the video overlay and the first image in the campaign text is Bright Atlanta (CC BY-SA 2.0) by Brett Weinstein (Nrbelex).
The second image in the campaign text is Busy traffic (CC BY 2.0) by dingcarrie.
The third image in the campaign text is Vista de Ciudad Ho Chi Minh desde Bitexco Financial Tower, Vietnam, 2013-08-14, DD 13 by Diego Delso. Licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0 via Commons.
The fourth image in the campaign text is Traffic lights at night in a city by Petr Kratochvil. Licensed under Public Domain. Released to the Public Domain by the author.
The fifth image in the campaign text is Cidade Grande (CC BY 2.0) by Moisés Silva Lima (Field Biologist).

story:
Hello, my name is Helen Haines and I am a professor of anthropology at Trent University, Canada. In 1990, I went to Belize as an undergraduate to learn archaeology in what I expected would be a 2-month field project.  What I didn’t expect was that I would fall in love with this wonderful country, its history, environment, and its people.  Now, a quarter of a century later, I am still working in Belize and bringing my own undergraduate students along to experience the wonders of this country. 

However all this is in danger as deforestation through agricultural development is threatening many ancient Maya ruins.  Ka’Kabish is a 3000 year old ancient Maya ruin, and now forms a rainforest refuge for many animals who have taken up residence at the site for shelter.  Our efforts, with your help will not only preserve the heritage of Belize from destruction but also continue to provide a rainforest sanctuary for these animals. 

We need to raise $70,000 CND ($55,000 USD) to save the site. All the money, which is managed through Trent University (not us personally), will go to the Institute of Archaeology, NICH, to buy the land and remove it from the agricultural land registry.  If we don’t make the total money needed through this endeavour we will continue until we are successful as we are dedicated to preserving what is left of the forest in this area of Belize.

Please help us save the site from encroaching agricultural development so that it can become part of the Archaeological Reserve System managed by the Belize Institute of Archaeology, National Institute of Culture and History. Donate money if you can or just help by spreading the word  through the Indiegogo share tools about the danger to the site and the animals in North-central Belize. 


All donation, now matter how small are appreciated and can be made directly though Indiegogo

OR

 US citizens or individuals with US income can be issued a tax deductible receipts if the donation is made directly through the Maya Research Programme.  Please contact Dr. Helen Haines at helenhaines@trentu.ca for details about this option.

story:
Short Summary

Eno River Dances is a site specific dance performance designed to raise funds for the Eno River Association:

  • Five Local Choreographers will present five site-specific dances along Buckquarter Creek Trail at Eno River State Park.  Storytelling guides will lead audience members to the performance sites while sharing their tales of conservation on the Eno River or personal stories about growing up near the Eno River.
  • Instead of ticket sales, donations made at the time of the performance will go directly to the Eno River Association, a local non-profit which works towards the conservation and preservation of the Eno River.
  • All performances will be environmentally friendly and non-disruptive to the State Park.

What We Need & What You Get

See the allocation of funds breakdown.
  • 40% of all funds raised in this indiegogo pre-performance campaign will go towards the Eno River Association's "Recovery and Rebuild" campaign.  
    On January 10, 2015 Durham’s sewer main line near the ERA's building became blocked.  "For an extended period raw sewage, on its way to an adjoining lift station from neighborhoods uphill, was diverted into their building."   1-3 inches of accumulated solid waste and wastewater were found running throughout the 2,500 square feet of office space on the main floor of the building.  They are in need of approximately $100,000 dollars to complete repairs and open their offices again.  This $100,000 is money that cannot be used to fund their incredible conservation and land accruing programs which "acquire land and conservation easements to protect water quality and wildlife, and work to make the outdoors accessible and enjoyable for everyone."  
  • We are in need of stipends to pay the choreographers so that they can afford costumes, compensate dancers for their time, hire musicians, and pay for transportation to the park for the 100+ hours of creative work they are doing in preparation for this endeavor.
  • Funds will also go to hire transit to take audience members from parking lots off grounds to the performance entrance at Eno River State Park, where there is not enough parking to accommodate what we hope will be a large number of attendees.
  • Money will be used to set up restrooms so that the large number of people in attendance that day can be comfortable.
  • Photographers and videographers will document the hard work of the artists.  Choreographers will use the photographs and videos to obtain jobs in the future, as well as to keep a record of the dances that only exist in the moment of performance.
  • Finally, advertising and marketing is vital to the success of the performance fundraiser.  We will use funds to spread the word and connect with the local community in the Triangle Area.
  • What you get:  1) the satisfaction of helping 5 ERA staff members, over 15 artists, countless ERA volunteers, and your beautiful Eno River and all of its wildlife.  2)  The opportunity to attend a unique and stunning performance on the Eno River, a stimulating outdoor hike, and a connection to the community that supports you and your local environment.
  • If this pre-performance campaign is successful, we will be able to give 100% of the funds donated on the day of the performance to the ERA.

The Impact

The performers involved in this project are dedicating their time because they believe in the conservation and retention of our valuable local resources.  

  • By contributing, you will allow the ERA to return to focusing on their land restoration efforts, rather than focusing on cleaning up from this unfortunate disaster.  
  • Similar projects that we've done in the past have served to present sites in a new light to community members who normally do not take advantage of the resource that is being showcased.  More people become aware of the programs the environmental non-profit offers, and shift their attitude towards the use of local resources in a positive manner.  
  • This will be a joyful event that will build en even stronger community focused on the maintenance of the Eno River and its surrounding lands.


Risks & Challenges

  • People see the large number we are trying to reach and think that a small contribution can't help.  In fact, if every person in our immediate circle contributed $2, we would raise over $2000, which is 20% of our goal.  We love the $1, $2, $5, and $10 contributions just as much as the large lump sums.  Even reaching just a portion of our goal can help out the volunteers that are putting in so many hours to make this project possible.
  • In the case that we do not meet our goal, funds will have to be allocated to publicity first, in order to make sure that attendance to our event is high, increasing donations to the Eno River Association.  After that, funds will go towards the port-o-potty, transportation of audience members to and from the park, and payment of photographers and videographers.  A portion will be set aside for choreographers to allocate as they see fit.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, we can still use your help!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools; pass this campaign along to others; and tell your friends, family, loved ones, and colleagues about the performance and our campaign!
  • Have a personal story to share about the Eno River?  Volunteer to be a guide for the hikes on the day of the performance.  Please email Natalie@anahatadance.org as soon as possible.
  • We are in need of volunteers from local businesses!  If you know anyone who would like to sponsor or host an after-performance celebration, let us know!  Also, if you own a large van or have access to a bus, we are in need of a passenger vehicle to transport the audience from the parking lot to the performance site.
  • You can donate your old car and benefit the Eno River!  Find out details here:  Donate Your Old Vehicle
  • Join our #ecodance campaign on instagram and have a chance to win a massage, yoga session, or postural analysis!
  • Finally, Come to the event!  Saturday, May 16, 2015 beginning at 11am, with a finale at 2pm.  Meet us at Few's Ford at the Eno River State Park in Durham.

 Instead of ticket sales, donations made at the time of the performance will go directly to the Eno River Association, a local non-profit which works towards the conservation and preservation of the Eno River. All performances will be environmentally friendly and non-disruptive to the State Park.
   What We Need & What You Get
See the allocation of funds breakdown.  40% of all funds raised in this indiegogo pre-performance campaign will go towards the Eno River Association's "Recovery and Rebuild" campaign.  On January 10, 2015 Durham’s sewer main line near the ERA's building became blocked.  "For an extended period raw sewage, on its way to an adjoining lift station from neighborhoods uphill, was diverted into their building."   1-3 inches of accumulated solid waste and wastewater were found running throughout the 2,500 square feet of office space on the main floor of the building.  They are in need of approximately $100,000 dollars to complete repairs and open their offices again.  This $100,000 is money that cannot be used to fund their incredible conservation and land accruing programs which "acquire land and conservation easements to protect water quality and wildlife, and work to make the outdoors accessible and enjoyable for everyone."  
We are in need of stipends to pay the choreographers so that they can afford costumes, compensate dancers for their time, hire musicians, and pay for transportation to the park for the 100+ hours of creative work they are doing in preparation for this endeavor. Funds will also go to hire transit to take audience members from parking lots off grounds to the performance entrance at Eno River State Park, where there is not enough parking to accommodate what we hope will be a large number of attendees.
Money will be used to set up restrooms so that the large number of people in attendance that day can be comfortable. Photographers and videographers will document the hard work of the artists.  Choreographers will use the photographs and videos to obtain jobs in the future, as well as to keep a record of the dances that only exist in the moment of performance.
Finally, advertising and marketing is vital to the success of the performance fundraiser.  We will use funds to spread the word and connect with the local community in the Triangle Area.
What you get:  1) the satisfaction of helping 5 ERA staff members, over 15 artists, countless ERA volunteers, and your beautiful Eno River and all of its wildlife.  2)  The opportunity to attend a unique and stunning performance on the Eno River, a stimulating outdoor hike, and a connection to the community that supports you and your local environment.
If this pre-performance campaign is successful, we will be able to give 100% of the funds donated on the day of the performance to the ERA.
    
The Impact
 The performers involved in this project are dedicating their time because they believe in the conservation and retention of our valuable local resources.    By contributing, you will allow the ERA to return to focusing on their land restoration efforts, rather than focusing on cleaning up from this unfortunate disaster.  
 Similar projects that we've done in the past have served to present sites in a new light to community members who normally do not take advantage of the resource that is being showcased.  More people become aware of the programs the environmental non-profit offers, and shift their attitude towards the use of local resources in a positive manner.   This will be a joyful event that will build en even stronger community focused on the maintenance of the Eno River and its surrounding lands.





Risks & Challenges  People see the large number we are trying to reach and think that a small contribution can't help.  In fact, if every person in our immediate circle contributed $2, we would raise over $2000, which is 20% of our goal.  We love the $1, $2, $5, and $10 contributions just as much as the large lump sums.  Even reaching just a portion of our goal can help out the volunteers that are putting in so many hours to make this project possible.
In the case that we do not meet our goal, funds will have to be allocated to publicity first, in order to make sure that attendance to our event is high, increasing donations to the Eno River Association.  After that, funds will go towards the port-o-potty, transportation of audience members to and from the park, and payment of photographers and videographers.  A portion will be set aside for choreographers to allocate as they see fit.    Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute financially, we can still use your help!
 Use the Indiegogo share tools; pass this campaign along to others; and tell your friends, family, loved ones, and colleagues about the performance and our campaign!
Have a personal story to share about the Eno River?  Volunteer to be a guide for the hikes on the day of the performance.  Please email Natalie@anahatadance.org as soon as possible.
We are in need of volunteers from local businesses!  If you know anyone who would like to sponsor or host an after-performance celebration, let us know!  Also, if you own a large van or have access to a bus, we are in need of a passenger vehicle to transport the audience from the parking lot to the performance site.
You can donate your old car and benefit the Eno River!  Find out details here:  Donate Your Old Vehicle

Join our #ecodance campaign on instagram and have a chance to win a massage, yoga session, or postural analysis!
Finally, Come to the event!  Saturday, May 16, 2015 beginning at 11am, with a finale at 2pm.  Meet us at Few's Ford at the Eno River State Park in Durham.

story:
Our bees are dying suddenly and at an alarming rate. I've notice in my area for the past few seasons that things seem a bit gray. Flowers and plants are losing color and variety with less and less growing each year.

Our neighborhood needs a little help from our bee friends. Bees pollinate about one-third of crop species in the U.S. They are indispensable in any plant environment...which is basically everything. Without plants there'd be no us!

I'm extremely passionate about bees and all they contribute to our environment. I'm on a mission to bring some color and vitality back into the world.

Your support will help establish one of the first colonies in the area and help to get our plants back on the right track. All of the contributions will go towards equipment and supplies for the hive to keep the honeybees happy and productive.

To show how grateful I am for your support donors are able to sample some of the honey that the "girls" will be working so hard to produce at the end of the season as well as get some bee-loving gear to sport around.

For the ultimate bee lover. One supporter will be able to have the first queen and hive named after them along with some other benefits!

Updates will be made so you are able to see how the bees are doing and what progress they've made throughout the season.

Please feel free to spread some bee love and share this campaign with all your friends!

*pitch image by Sam Droege: bit.ly/1kGAqH6

story:
INTRODUCTION

Are you a fan of barbecue? A conservationist who has been anticipating for a cleaner environment? Do you run an industry that uses firewood and charcoal? Aren't you tired of charcoal  and firewood  carbon  emissions and felling trees  which has  been  disastrous to the  environment?

We have now come up with an easier and cheaper solution that will not only guarantee less biomass emissions, spice up you barbeques giving it that pineapple aroma but also bring down fuel costs.

The Briquette Energy drive it is that one in a million campaign behind this great news.

ABOUT THE PROJECT

We have uniquely developed a heated non- carbonized biomass briquette that has heat value and green credentials yet low carbon- monoxide that makes perfect replacement for charcoal, improved cooker and firewood use. This has resulted in us being awarded a patent pending.

So instead of cutting down trees and interfering with the eco-system or stretching your fixed budgets, our briquettes offer cleaner, greener and affordable hotter renewable form of energy for households an industrial use.

The group behind this campaign is professional, energetic and a youthful team who are determined to set a global example on the use of alternative form of energy.

We think this project depicts the energy we have towards creating a better environment and we can’t achieve this without you.

So, if you are a conservationist, a big fan of juicy barbeques or you can donate to this cause, welcome aboard and make this campaign a reality. We think you will love it as much as we do.

HOW IT WORKS

THE REWARDS

Our project will have a great impact on the environment. 

Let’s do some rough math!

The average weight of a eucalyptus tree used for industrial fuel: 1.6 tonnes 

Daily output of biomass briquettes: 50 metric tones

Equivalent trees saved a day: 50/1.6 = 31 trees 

In one year you can help us save 11,406 trees!

Women and youth in Africa spend considerable amounts of time collecting firewood and charcoal which when used as a cooking fuel emits large amounts of harmful carbon monoxide gas. This can have serious long term health implications in the affected communities. These implications are greatly reduced by the use of our non-carbonized biomass briquettes. 

Mary, a chicken brooder – “The briquettes are an eco-friendly way to keep my chicks warm.”

Boniface, A charcoal dealer – “Many customers are switching to this alternative. Can we get more to stock?”

Mama Kiosk, an outdoor restaurant owner – “I use them at my small restaurant; they save me money and last much longer than charcoal.”

Our product is safe and natural and has no additives.

THE ORIGIN STORY

Allan Marega, started this project in 2008 after the need to conserve the environment bit him, years later more members flocked in. Although he was a well-trained Airline Pilot, he hanged his boots and did a lengthy research on use of biomass fuels.

Over the next few years, the briquette project has slowly picked momentum although the crowd funding campaign has been…(we need your help) now that it has come to our attention that people like doing what they know or should we say our (read Africans)quest for knowledge is wanting!

We have struggled with this project alot. Our goal of conserving the environment is playing Truth or Dare.

Our Project goal was broken down into three stages and we need your help on the second phase.

PHASE I: Phase  Cost: USD 1,200,000 Funds Raised:  USD 1,200,000

Key Activities

  1.   - Identify feedstock and do testing (completed)
  2.   - locate a suitable area for the plant (completed)
  3.   - Build the plant ( completed)
  4.   - Design and manufacture of the machinery (completed)
  5.    -Installing the machinery (pending)

 

PHASE II : Phase Cost: USD 50,000 : Funds Needed: USD 50,000
Key Activities

  1. - Begin production( pending)
  2. - Establish Distribution  
  3.  - Establish a market presence
  4.  - Maintain clientele

PHASE III:  Phase Cost: USD 1,800,000 : Funds Needed: USD 1,800,000

Key Activities

  1.   Increase the size of the plant to handle double the output
There will be a future round of fundraising for this phase.

SUPPORT THIS CAMPAIGN

We found our niche and began from there. We have put this project on social media and websites because it’s the fastest way to get this crowd funding campaign into your hands.

Our main aim was to create awareness, educate, fundraise and make improvements as a community. We think this crowd funding campaign is great but we need your help in making it even better.

So, if you like to reduce carbon emissions in the environment and bring about economic empowerment please back this project and help make the world a better place.

If everyone swept before their heels, then Africa would be a better place.

Let’s get involved. We need each other.

Our Partners
Our partners recognize the impact deforestation has on our environment and the need for sustainable renewable fuels while supporting the health and development needs of women and youth. They have given their support to this project to get us this far. They include the Africa Enterprise Challenge Fund, Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Partnership, Energy and Environment Partnership and the Kenya Climate Innovation Centre

Other Modes Of Support

We would love it if you talk to your friends and family about our campaign. Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Google plus with the hashtag #briquetteenergydrive

Contribute what you can to make a real difference in the environment! Thank you for your much needed support!

story:
Adopting a tea-ceremony house.

My name is iacopo torrini, I am an italian architect living in japan for 17 years.

I was introduced to the owner of a beautiful pre-war one story sukiya style building. It is presently used as tea-ceremony school and consists of 3 tatami rooms, kitchen, toilet and closets.

The sad part of the story is that this house and beautiful garden will be destroyed at
the end of january. The good side of it is thaof the house is a timber framed building and can be safely dismantled and relocated. Do you want to own a japanese house in pristine conditions which was used maniacally maintained and used as a tea ceremony school for the past 20 years? This is the right occasion. The building with all the accessories is available for free!
You will have to pay for the dismantling cost (about 42,000 USD) shipping cost (about 15,000 USD) and reconstruction (from 150 to 200K USD).
we have to act quickly as the demolition is starting on january 27th. 

view on google maps

Pictures and videos:

click the links below:

outside pictures

inside pictures



What We Need & What You Get

1) We will need at least 42,000 USD to carefully dismantle the house before the bulldozers come. (see below the quotation).

This part of the financing for the relocation project is the only one targeted in this campaign.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

2) Just for your reference, the person or institution who will adopt the house will then have to pack everything in two 40' containers and ship to the desired location. This cost is estimated in 15,000 USD in case of a shipping and delivery to a location in the UK. (see here the the quotation for your reference).

here below is the estimate of the packaging list

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

3) For the cost of reconstruction it depends on the country you are. I prepared an indicative quotation in case the house is relocated in Japan and in this case is about 20 million yen (170,000 USD).

In case the house is rebuild in the US, I think you can consider an average of 150-200 USD per square foot, the cost for reconstruction would be somewhere from 150,000 to 200,000 USD.

Consider about 20,000 USD to have a japanese carpenter supervising the construction and instructing the local workers.
The grand total (1+2+3) will then be 227,000-277,000 USD.

Putting on top another 20K USD to stay on the safe side, I think it is realistic that the cost for the total project will be just below 300,000 USD.

In case of failure

If we fail to collect the necessary amount for the demolition, the building will be bulldozed. I will keep the amount collected thru the perks in an escrow account and will keep the accounting on a public file of google docs.

The funds will be available for future similar projects.

Anyway, the main scope of this campaign is to find a single investor who will bring home the building so I am confident that the campaign will produce a clear result in any way.

The Impact

By granting success to this building adoption project, I think we can reach three important goals.
1) One is of course to grant the existence and continuity of this wonderful building.
2) The other purpose is to create a concrete example that may propel and promote similar initiatives.
3) Last, I hope that with this type of project we can impact the japanese public opinion and common sense and make the japanese more aware of the treasures they own and incentive them in implementing a smarter perspective about conservation of heritage buildings and ethical ways of its economic exploitation.

Risks & Challenges

There are several examples of timber frame buildings being reconstructed abroad, but I do not have the data at hand of how much it cost or how long it took.
The reconstruction process may not be easy, it may require additional material or the help of japanese craftsmen.
Anyway I am an architect and know hundreds of companies and I am sure I have all the resources to overcome the obstacles smoothly and in a cost effective way.

3 ways you can help

1) One is to pay for the cost of disassembly. (42,000 USD) The building will be safely stored until you are ready to pick it up. The house is be yours!

2) The second one is to purchase our perks.  50% of the sales will be devolved to a fund that will grant the dismantling and storage of the building in case nobody steps forward. If we raise more than necessary, the fund will be used for similar projects in the future and the accounting will be available thru google docs for public review.

3)The third way is to spread the word. Please share on the social media and with your friends. We have very little time but a great passion and with your help we can do it!

story:
WHO ARE WE

Ecocare International Foundation is a non-profit group in the USA started in 2013 as 501(c)(3) organization. Our focus is endangered species and critical habitat conservation. The target of this campaign is the critically endangered species the Great Indian Bustard and grassland habitat in Kutch, India. 

GOAL

To conserve and restore the fast vanishing and fragile grassland habitat of the Great Indian Bustard, the Lesser Florican Bustard and the Macqueen (Houbara) Bustard. Kutch region of India, their natural habitat, is under serious threat from cotton farming, urban development, over-grazing by domestic cattle populations, and heavy use of pesticides in the farmland. Today less than 300 Great Indian Bustards survive, only in India.

OBJECTIVES:

1. Develop a community-based conservation model for the village people and establish first-ever field station and research center for grassland /shrub land ecology. Such a protected reserve will provide a crucial safe and secure habitat corridor zone for birds and animals to rest during migration and provide cover for breeding during monsoon season.

2. We also plan to have an education and awareness campaign about the importance of habitat preservation. We will conduct seminars, exhibitions, field trips for school children in the villages which are part of the pristine arid grassland habitat. Our program will create a positive and sustainable long-term impact of conservation of the local wildlife.

3. We plan to work with local forest department and conservation groups to provide training and informative tools to the farmers and cattle grazers about the importance of grass and fodder harvesting, storing and grazing methods. It is very important to make them understand that such steps will ensure their survival and bring economic benefits in the future.

FUNDS

The funds will go towards:

1. Acquiring 20 acres land to convert into pristine natural grassland habitat with local plant species for the Great Indian Bustard species and other grassland birds in the region. This will cost over $80,000 in the next two years to create the sanctuary field station, a safe haven for birds to rest and breed. 

2. Dedicated staff members to conduct field research and collect information to monitor the progress of our project. This will cost about $30,000. 

3. Educational program to bring awareness about the critically endangered Great Indian Bustard. In the next two years we will develop posters, videos, films, presentations, social media campaigns, essay competitions, training for farmers, etc. for this purpose with accurate information of wildlife of the Kutch region. This will cost about $80,000.

of wildlife of the Kutch region. This will cost about $80,000.

story:
El proyecto Bogotá Biodiversa surge de la necesidad de generar información científica de calidad aunada a procesos de comunicación, apropiación y divulgación para el rescate de los valores urbanos asociados a la biodiversidad bogotana.

Nuestro proyecto inicia de forma preliminar en diciembre de 2012 cuando un grupo de residentes de los cerros orientales en colaboración con ProCAT inician un muestreo exploratorio de fauna a partir de las observaciones locales de algunos felinos inusuales. 

Luego de dos meses de muestreos preliminares, los resultados fueron sorprendentes; detectamos la presencia del tigrillo lanudo el cusumbo de montaña, la guagua de montaña, la chucha de montaña, entre otras especies que no se creían aún habitaran en las inmediaciones de nuestra ciudad capital.

 A PARTIR DE ESTE PRIMER ACERCAMIENTO SURGE LA IDEA DE BOGOTA BIODIVERSA!!!

Como un proyecto que englobe procesos de investigación aplicados a la conservación para las zonas urbanas y periurbanas de Bogotá, enfatizando la necesidad de educar, concientizar, empoderar y visibilizar la vida silvestre con la que habitamos y su relación con los habitantes capitalinos.  


DESCRIPCIÓN DE PROYECTO
Bogotá Biodiversa

Rescatando nuestro lado silvestre, empoderando nuestra naturaleza

Misión

Rescatar los valores asociados a la biodiversidad, en especial la vida silvestre de las zonas urbanas y periurbanas de Bogotá como mecanismo de sensibilización, rescate del sentido de pertenencia y conservación de la biodiversidad, generando actividades de investigación, educación, y apropiación para el mejoramiento de las condiciones de la vida silvestre en la ciudad, se promueva el mantenimiento y mejoramiento en la provisión de bienes y servicios ambientales de la biodiver- sidad y se logre un desarrollo urbano de la mano de la conservación de la biodi- versidad, la sostenibilidad y el mejoramiento del entorno ambiental de la ciudad.

Visión

Bogotá Biodiversa es una iniciativa que promueve la conservación e investiga- ción de la vida silvestre en la ciudad y sus alrededores con el fin de mejorar las condiciones humanas y ambientales y los beneficios que provee la biodiversidad en la capital del país.

A través de Bogotá Biodiversa se esta realizando el muestreo más grande usando cámaras trampa en el país.

  •   Promover el conocimiento, respeto y sensibilización hacia la vida silvestre existente en las zonas urbanas y periurbanas de Bogotá.

  •   Generar información científica de base para la conservación de la vida sil- vestre y los servicios ecosistémicos derivados de esta, con los criterios más altos de calidad.

  •   Rescatar los valores de pertenencia y respeto por la vida silvestre que con- vive con los pobladores capitalinos.

  •   Facilitar procesos de apropiación, conservación y rescate de valor en torno a las condiciones ambientales de la ciudad.

  •   Educar, sensibilizar y visibilizar la vida silvestre urbana y periurbana como mecanismo de educación, apropiación, mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida y sentido de pertenencia con Bogotá.

  •   Valorar y comprender los bienes y servicios ambientales derivados de la vida silvestre y la biodiversidad para la ciudad.

  •   Generar mecanismos de conservación, incentivos, beneficios ambientales e iniciativas de educación, y aprovechamiento sostenible de la biodiversidad

  •   Hasta la fecha, enfocados en las fases preoperativas y de preparación del proyecto, nos hemos enfocado en el establecimiento de alianzas, identifica- ción prioridades y diseño general del proyecto, a la vez que nuestra fase piloto esperamos esté aportando resultados en poco tiempo.

  Generar mecanismos de conservación, incentivos, beneficios ambientales e

  Hasta la fecha, enfocados en las fases preoperativas y de preparación del

piloto esperamos esté aportando resultados en poco tiempo.

story:
Short Summary

 

A lot of people talk about plasic pollution. Join us and let´s really work on a solution. This is the place where you can really make an impact on the future. If this goes well we have a really cool way to deal with our plasic mess. If this goes well the improvement cycle of this technology begins. Plastic decomposing farms will get better and better. And better. It all starts here and now.

Thanks to the latest discovery, our aim is to build a meal worm farm - with an automated food supply. With their ability to digest plastic, we want to significantly reduce the amount of plastic that ends up in landfills otherwise.  

Now, as you're still reading this, we know that you care about our environment. And this is great! But we also know, how hard it is for an individual to make a difference... especially if your daily necessities are wrapped in plastic or plastic waste is created during their production.

Don’ t worry, we've got your back: our intention is to feed our meal worms with the plastic waste produced by companies. Since the plastic is not harming the health of the worms it is a good alternative to start reducing plastic waste. In the meanwhile scientists can do research, as it is one of our goal to find the bacteria that enables the worms to digest plastic. In the long run we want to increase the degradation rate and make sure plastic can be biodegraded all over the world.

We believe it is possible to quickly biodegrade plastic one day.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 The funding will be going to:

 

  1. Renting a place that we can rebuild into the worm farm
  2. Equipment to feed, clean and move the mealworms 
  3.  Of course worms, worms and more worms to start with
  4. Equipment for the scientists
  5. Someone to look around who keeps the Worms happy and healthy
  6. Finance the campaign and future tasks
  7. Update the equipment as we make new discoveries

 

In return for your funding we have different perks. Everyone of our donors will get a social media shout out. 

The main reward though, is a cleaner future for you, for us, for our children and our planet.   

If we don't reach our entire goal on indiegogo, your donation will not be useless. We will continue our work till we managed to build this worm farm. Your money will be save and only used for what we listed above. We will constantly keep you updated in the process of building and you will see were the donations are going. It is very important to us to be transparent and share the success with the whole world. 

 

The Impact

We believe that not only lakes or rivers suffer from plastic pollution, but our whole globe.

And with our project, it is possible for the first time to decompose plastic!!

As our project is one of the first of its kind, there are challenges of course. But we don’t want any doubts to stop us from turning our bigger vision into reality. And with our team of experts we could not be better prepared for any upcoming challenges: eco-toxicologist Prof. Dr. Oehlmann from Frankfurt Goethe University and his team, whose laboratory we’re also using for further research, are working closely with us.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every single donation is greatly appreciated and helps “to make this world a better place”, just as Michael Jackson sang a while ago. And if you want to support our project, but cannot support us financially, please spread our project over social media!! #Wormify

 

 

For more information check out: www.wormify.net
