story:
- NORSK tekst - bla nedover

 - ÍSLENSKUR texti væntanlegur

********************************************

The Who and What

Hello Everyone! 

Tavonna Nira & Guðjón Örn here. With our team of tradesmen, engineers and specialists we are starting a farm in Norway where people can visit, stay & experience activities that promote well-being. The farm will have trails, gardens, amphitheater, venue spaces, and serve as a cold-climate demonstration homestead. It's called GledeGaard - roughly translated, means Happy Farm.

The Why

For Love and Happiness - GledeGaard is a dedication to natural simplicity, knowledge and creating  good for the community and those who will take over after us - our children [including floofs - aka other living creatures]. Through permaculture design, the farm gives back to the world not only by being sustainable, but also by regenerating natural resources like cleaner air, water and fertile soils. Our Mission is to contribute to The Happy Planet Index by reducing our ecological footprint and increasing happiness through our services and permaculture methods.

All within the beautiful Norwegian landscape.

Where are the Contributions going?

The funds are going to the purchase & final design of the property (88%), while the rest goes to IndieGoGo/PayPal processing fees (10%) and Perks (2%).

 

You might ask, "What's in it for me?"

Would you say you like breathing clean air, drinking clean water, eating yummy food, nature, farm stays, permaculture, local business, art or academia? You would get to directly and intimately support a project that inspires and maintains values you cherish, things of interest and the environment. Additionally, your contributions have a lasting effect on future generations and many of the features on the farm will be dedicated to those who supported its establishment.

Our Vision is to create and demonstrate lifestyles where human happiness and well-being does not cost the Earth, our ultimate scarce and finite resource.

What will be on the farm?

Its permaculture functional design will allow visitors to incorporate 5 daily actions that lead to well-being and happiness. We are looking to implement the following as the property allows:

  • 1) Be Active: activity areas to get you moving – Obstacle, orientation and parkour course; Wheelchair accessible walking/biking/skiing paths
  • 2) Be Connected: gathering areas to keep you close to the people you cherish – Barn with ‘tiny house’ rooms and venue space; Farm-stay cabins; Camping areas; Fire-pits; Amphitheater; 4 season Garden – also wheelchair accessible
  • 3) Be Mindful: opportunities to interact with your surroundings – Farm animal contact; Wild nature contact; Natural resource awareness; Organic farming methods
  • 4) Be Curious: stimulation for your mind – Hidden trails; Nordic rune signs; Art in the landscape; Workshops; Labyrinth market garden; Research & Development
  • 5) Be Generous: a system that nurtures altruistic giving – Pay it forward farm-stays for others; Assisting less-able visitors; Donation (books, funds, time, etc); Volunteer to help around the farm  and gain farm experience (WWOOFing)

Will there be animals?

Cows, sheep, goats, pigs, chickens, rabbits, hedgehogs, ducks, farm cat, farm dog and farmer are the animals that we are looking to have on the property. Depending on property allowances, climate and vet care, we will be able to have most if not all of them.

Our philosophy is to revere the balance of Nature, create symbiotic relationships with creatures in our habitat and be stewards acting in reflection of our philosophy.

What will the farm produce?

The farm will primarily provide services associated with venues, such as farm-stays, workshops, internships, and data collection. The homestead will maintain farming adequate to meet the needs of the people working on the farm. Later we are seeking to expand this to farm-to-table products, and should the local market and farm capacity allow, we will participate in local markets and CSAs.

The Current Challenges

Time is of the essence. As properties are publicly for sale, we are up against other very competitive bidders, for example - established commercial farms with excess capital. Additionally, banks are hesitant to take on the risk of a farm property concerning resale. Oddly enough, not everyone wants to be a farmer. Therefore, we have taken steps to ensure we can give a competitive offer and meet the financial institutions halfway.

  • We have amassed support in advance to ensure the best possibility for campaign success
  • We will match the first 15,000USD in contributions.
  • We have also applied for grants and funding that will be granted upon property purchase
  • We have assembled a team over experienced tradesmen, engineers, designers, investors and farmer who have committed their time, income and resources to establishing this farm
  • We have cut down on perks that require shipping, while retaining value to contributors - Shipping in and from Norway is very costly and would detract greatly form the contributions of backers
  • The start-up schedule is conservative so that we can establish a solid profitable infrastructure with minimal risk to the project
  • The revenue designated to support the farm start-up has been insured in the event of injury, illness or death.
  • We have baby floof picture...so so sooo cute.

Can one have Happiness as a product?

We think so.While we wish we could bottle up some happiness and sell it in charming brown paper packages, happiness cannot be produced in that sense. Anyone who says otherwise may be picking your pockets.

It is through the many products and opportunities of the farm that contribute to the well-being that happiness is obtained. We didn't think of this lightly with unrealistic idealistic optimism.  The pioneers of this concept is the New Economics Foundation (NEF) with their Happy Planet Index (HPI). Their statisticians have done extensive research, calculations and published the information for improving businesses and informing the public. The HPI, in conjunction with our Holistic Management, is the foundation and control used to present and measure our happiness product. The farms activities are created to allow people to exercise the 5 actions identified to increase well-being´, and thereby increase their happiness.

**For those curious folks wanting to know more, here is an extremely informative video about HPI put out by the NEF of their presentation for a TED talk.

How you can help

Contribute to our campaign to further this project and share it on social media and email. We have designed perks we believe you will love that make you an everlasting part of our farm.

We understand not everyone can give financially, so we ask that you share this on social media and more importantly via email. By emailing, you are making a more intimate contribution and people respond to genuine communication.

Please feel free to give us your ideas and suggestions for perks. We would love to hear from you and most definitely wish you to visit the farm.

Our Sincerest Gratitude and Well Wishes,

Tavonna & Guðjón

 

Additional information:

GledeGaard's Organization number: 911 721 821

**************************************

Hjelp oss å starte GledeGaard

Støtt etableringen av en gård som gror glede for familie, venner, lokalmiljøet og naturen.

 

Little lady, Big Guy, og snart kommende, Wee baby, vil kjøpe en gård for å starte et gårdsbruk, en boplass, og for å gro litt glede i de norske åsene.

Bli med på prosjektet og reisen med dine bidrag, og belønninger som vil bli en evigvarende del av gården vår, og verden.

**De første 130,000NOK donert, blir matchet (kroner for kroner) takket være GledeGaards Velgjørere**

 

Hvem og Hva

Tavonna Nira og Guðjón Örn her. Med vårt lag av håndverkere, ingeniører og spesialister skal vi etablere en gård i Norge, hvor folk kan besøke, overnatte og delta i aktiviteter som promoterer velvære. Gården vil ha stier, hager, et amfi, møteplasser, og fungere som en demonstrasjon av kald-klima demonstrasjonsgårdsbruk. Gården heter GledeGaard.

Hvorfor

For kjærlighet og lykke – GledeGaard er hengivenhet til naturlig enkelhet, kunnskap, og det å lage noe godt for de som tar over for oss, barna våre (inkludert floofs – andre levende vesen). Fordi gården er designet etter permakulturprinsipper gir den tilbake til verden ved å både være bærekraftig, og ved å regenerere naturressurser, som renere luft, rent vann og fruktbar jord. Målet til GledeGaard er å bidra til å bedre samfunnet (lokalt, regionalt og internasjonalt) gjennom naturen og naturens produkter.

Alt innenfor det vakre norske landskapet.

Hvor går ditt bidrag

Mesteparten av bidragene går til kjøp og endelig design av eiendommen (88%), og resten går til behandlingsgebyr hos IndieGoGo/Paypal (10%), og belønningene (2%).

Du spør kanskje, ”Hvorfor er dette viktig for meg?”

Vil du si at du liker å puste frisk luft, drikke rent vann, spise god mat, naturen, overnatting på gård, permakultur, lokalt næringsliv, kunst eller utdanning? Ved å støtte GledeGaard støtter du et prosjekt som inspirerer og opprettholder verdier du setter høyt, ting du interesserer deg for, og miljøet. Dine bidrag vil også ha en varig effekt på kommende generasjoner, og mange av særtrekkene til gården vil være dedikert til de som bidro til etableringen av gården.

Hva vil være på gården?

Gårdens permakulturdesign vil la besøkende delta i fem daglige aktiviteter som leder til velvære og lykke. Vi håper å implementere de følgende ettersom hva eiendommen tillater.

  1. Vær aktiv: aktivitetsområder som setter deg i bevegelse – hinderløype, orientering og parkour bane; gå/sykkel/ski-løyper som også er tilgjengelige med rullestol.
  2. Vær koblet til: samlingsområder der du kan være nær folk du verdsetter – låve med rom, og møtelokaler; gårdovernattingshytter; campingområde; bålplasser/grillesteder; amfi; helårshage; også tilgjengelig for rullestol
  3. Vær oppmerksom: Mulighet til å samhandle med omgivelsene; kontakt med gårdsdyr; kontakt med vill natur; bevissthet om naturressurser; organisk jordbruk.
  4. Vær nysgjerrig: Stimulering for hjernen – Gjemte stier; Nordiske runemerker; kunst i landskapet; Workshops; labyrinthage; Forskning og utvikling
  5. Vær generøs: et system som nærer altruistisk giverglede; ”pay it forward” gårdsopphold for andre; man hjelper besøkende med nedsatt funksjonsevne; donasjon (bøker, penger, tid, etc.); Melde seg frivillig til å hjelpe til på gården og få gårdserfaring (WWOOFing).

Kommer det til å være dyr på gården?

Dyrene vi planlegger å ha på eiendommen er kyr, sauer, geiter, griser, kyllinger, kaniner, piggsvin, ender, gårdskatt, gårdshund og bønder. Avhengig av eiendommen, klima og veterinærtjenester i området planlegger vi å ha så mange som mulig, om ikke alle dyrene.

Hva kommer gården til å produsere?

Gården vil primært fokusere på tjenester som lokaler som kan brukes til gårdsovernatting, workshops, praktikantstillinger, og datainnsamling. Gården vil opprettholde gårdsbruk som møter behovene til de som bor og jobber på gården. Senere håper vi å utvide dette til gård-til-bord-produkter og, hvis lokalmarkedet og gårdskapasiteten strekker til vil vi delta på lokale markeder og CSAs (lokalsamfunn støttet landbruk).

Utfordringene vi har nå.

Tiden løper fra oss. Siden eiendommer ligger ute for salg i offentligheten byr vi mot andre, konkurransedyktige kjøpere, for eksempel etablerte kommersielle gårder med ekstra kapital. I tillegg er banker uvillige til å risikere å gi store lån til små gårdseiendommer av frykt for at de ikke vil bli solgt videre. Merkelig nok er det ikke alle som vil være bønder. Derfor har vi gjort det vi kan for å forsikre at vi kan legge inn et konkurransedyktig bud og møte bankene halvveis.

  • Vi har skaffet støtte i forkant for å forsikre oss om høyest mulig suksess for kampanjen
  • Vi vil matche de første 15,000 USD i bidrag.
  • Vi har søkt på stipend og finansiering som vil bli gitt oss når vi kjøper eiendommen.
  • Vi har satt sammen et lag av erfarne håndverkere, ingeniører, designere, investorer og bønder som vil bruke tid og inntekt til å etablere denne gården.
  • Vi har kuttet ned på belønninger (perks) som sendes steder, men som er av en god verdi for bidragsytere. – Postsendinger i og ut av Norge er dyrt og vil forringe verdien av det bidragsyterne kan donere siden mer penger ville gått til postsendinger.
  • Timeplanen for start er konservative slik at vi kan etablere en solid og lønnsom infrastruktur med minimal risk for prosjektet.
  • Inntektene øremerket til oppstart av gården er forsikret i tilfelle skade, sykdom eller død.
  • Vi har bilder av baby floofs…. Så så såååå søte.

Kan man ha lykke som et produkt?

Vi mener det. Samtidig som vi skulle ønske vi kunne solgt lykke på flasker i brune papirposer kan ikke lykke produseres på den måten. Hvis noen sier de kan det er det mulig de prøver å rane deg.

Det er gjennom de mange produktene og mulighetene på gården som bidrar til velvære at lykken kommer. Vi ser ikke lett på dette, og heller ikke med urealistisk, idealistisk optimisme. Pionerne for dette konseptet er New Economics Foundation (NEF) som har en egen Lykkelig Planet Indeks (Happy Planet Index, HPI). Deres statistikere har drevet med omfattende forskning, beregninger og publisert informasjon for forbedring av virksomheter og selskaper, og for å informere offentligheten. HPI, sammen med vår Holistiske Ledelse, er fundamentet og kontrollen vi bruker for å presentere og måle vårt lykkeprodukt. Gårdens aktiviteter er lagd for å la folk trene de fem aktivitetene definert for å øke velvære, og dermed øke sin egen lykke.

**For de som er ekstra nysgjerrige og vil vite mer finnes det en informativ video om HPI lagd av NEF i forbindelse med deres TED-talk. (engelsk)

 

Hvordan kan du hjelpe

Bidra til kampanjen for å videreføre dette prosjektet og del det på sosiale medier og email. Vi har lagd belønninger vi tror du vil like, som vil gjøre deg til en evig del av gården vår.

Vi forstår at ikke alle kan bidra med penger, så vi ber deg om å dele dette på sosiale medier og, enda viktigere, via email. Ved å maile gir du et mer fortrolig bidrag og folk svarer bedre på genuin kommunikasjon.

Send oss gjerne ideer og forslag til belønninger (perks). Vi vil veldig gjerne høre fra dere, og vi vil veldig gjerne at du besøker gården.

Med største takknemlighet og gode ønsker,

Tavonna og Guðjón

 

Annen info:

GledeGaards organisasjonsnummer: 911 721 821

story_txt:
- NORSK tekst - bla nedover
 - ÍSLENSKUR texti væntanlegur********************************************The Who and WhatHello Everyone! Tavonna Nira & Guðjón Örn here. With our team of tradesmen, engineers and specialists we are starting a farm in Norway where people can visit, stay & experience activities that promote well-being. The farm will have trails, gardens, amphitheater, venue spaces, and serve as a cold-climate demonstration homestead. It's called GledeGaard - roughly translated, means Happy Farm.The WhyFor Love and Happiness - GledeGaard is a dedication to natural simplicity, knowledge and creating  good for the community and those who will take over after us - our children [including floofs - aka other living creatures]. Through permaculture design, the farm gives back to the world not only by being sustainable, but also by regenerating natural resources like cleaner air, water and fertile soils. Our Mission is to contribute to The Happy Planet Index by reducing our ecological footprint and increasing happiness through our services and permaculture methods.All within the beautiful Norwegian landscape.Where are the Contributions going?The funds are going to the purchase & final design of the property (88%), while the rest goes to IndieGoGo/PayPal processing fees (10%) and Perks (2%). You might ask, "What's in it for me?"Would you say you like breathing clean air, drinking clean water, eating yummy food, nature, farm stays, permaculture, local business, art or academia? You would get to directly and intimately support a project that inspires and maintains values you cherish, things of interest and the environment. Additionally, your contributions have a lasting effect on future generations and many of the features on the farm will be dedicated to those who supported its establishment.Our Vision is to create and demonstrate lifestyles where human happiness and well-being does not cost the Earth, our ultimate scarce and finite resource.What will be on the farm?Its permaculture functional design will allow visitors to incorporate 5 daily actions that lead to well-being and happiness. We are looking to implement the following as the property allows:

1) Be Active: activity areas to get you moving – Obstacle, orientation and parkour course; Wheelchair accessible walking/biking/skiing paths

2) Be Connected: gathering areas to keep you close to the people you cherish – Barn with ‘tiny house’ rooms and venue space; Farm-stay cabins; Camping areas; Fire-pits; Amphitheater; 4 season Garden – also wheelchair accessible

3) Be Mindful: opportunities to interact with your surroundings – Farm animal contact; Wild nature contact; Natural resource awareness; Organic farming methods

4) Be Curious: stimulation for your mind – Hidden trails; Nordic rune signs; Art in the landscape; Workshops; Labyrinth market garden; Research & Development

5) Be Generous: a system that nurtures altruistic giving – Pay it forward farm-stays for others; Assisting less-able visitors; Donation (books, funds, time, etc); Volunteer to help around the farm  and gain farm experience (WWOOFing)
Will there be animals?Cows, sheep, goats, pigs, chickens, rabbits, hedgehogs, ducks, farm cat, farm dog and farmer are the animals that we are looking to have on the property. Depending on property allowances, climate and vet care, we will be able to have most if not all of them.Our philosophy is to revere the balance of Nature, create symbiotic relationships with creatures in our habitat and be stewards acting in reflection of our philosophy.What will the farm produce?The farm will primarily provide services associated with venues, such as farm-stays, workshops, internships, and data collection. The homestead will maintain farming adequate to meet the needs of the people working on the farm. Later we are seeking to expand this to farm-to-table products, and should the local market and farm capacity allow, we will participate in local markets and CSAs.The Current ChallengesTime is of the essence. As properties are publicly for sale, we are up against other very competitive bidders, for example - established commercial farms with excess capital. Additionally, banks are hesitant to take on the risk of a farm property concerning resale. Oddly enough, not everyone wants to be a farmer. Therefore, we have taken steps to ensure we can give a competitive offer and meet the financial institutions halfway.
We have amassed support in advance to ensure the best possibility for campaign success
We will match the first 15,000USD in contributions.
We have also applied for grants and funding that will be granted upon property purchase
We have assembled a team over experienced tradesmen, engineers, designers, investors and farmer who have committed their time, income and resources to establishing this farm
We have cut down on perks that require shipping, while retaining value to contributors - Shipping in and from Norway is very costly and would detract greatly form the contributions of backers
The start-up schedule is conservative so that we can establish a solid profitable infrastructure with minimal risk to the project
The revenue designated to support the farm start-up has been insured in the event of injury, illness or death.
We have baby floof picture...so so sooo cute.
Can one have Happiness as a product?We think so.While we wish we could bottle up some happiness and sell it in charming brown paper packages, happiness cannot be produced in that sense. Anyone who says otherwise may be picking your pockets.It is through the many products and opportunities of the farm that contribute to the well-being that happiness is obtained. We didn't think of this lightly with unrealistic idealistic optimism.  The pioneers of this concept is the New Economics Foundation (NEF) with their Happy Planet Index (HPI). Their statisticians have done extensive research, calculations and published the information for improving businesses and informing the public. The HPI, in conjunction with our Holistic Management, is the foundation and control used to present and measure our happiness product. The farms activities are created to allow people to exercise the 5 actions identified to increase well-being´, and thereby increase their happiness.**For those curious folks wanting to know more, here is an extremely informative video about HPI put out by the NEF of their presentation for a TED talk.How you can helpContribute to our campaign to further this project and share it on social media and email. We have designed perks we believe you will love that make you an everlasting part of our farm.We understand not everyone can give financially, so we ask that you share this on social media and more importantly via email. By emailing, you are making a more intimate contribution and people respond to genuine communication.Please feel free to give us your ideas and suggestions for perks. We would love to hear from you and most definitely wish you to visit the farm.Our Sincerest Gratitude and Well Wishes,
Tavonna & Guðjón
 Additional information:GledeGaard's Organization number: 911 721 821**************************************Hjelp oss å starte GledeGaardStøtt etableringen av en gård som gror glede for familie, venner, lokalmiljøet og naturen. Little lady, Big Guy, og snart kommende, Wee baby, vil kjøpe en gård for å starte et gårdsbruk, en boplass, og for å gro litt glede i de norske åsene.Bli med på prosjektet og reisen med dine bidrag, og belønninger som vil bli en evigvarende del av gården vår, og verden.**De første 130,000NOK donert, blir matchet (kroner for kroner) takket være GledeGaards Velgjørere** Hvem og HvaTavonna Nira og Guðjón Örn her. story:
This particular station will be based at Sterling College in Craftsbury, Vermont. This station will be small, and contain a variety of sensors. These sensors can measure wind speed and direction, rain fall, temperature and humidity, and soil temperature and humidly. Also included is barometric pressure, and subsystem power consumption. This information will be used in conjunction to track how weather influences our crops. 

A 9v solar panel will be supplying the internal computer with power. Switch Doc Labs makes many parts for these kind of stations, so I will be using parts from them. The main computer will be a Raspberry Pi Zero, with a Switch Doc Labs WeatherPiArduino board, and a SunAirPlus solar board. The Raspberry Pi Zero will use WIFI signals to transfer data to a website that logs and graphs it. There is also wind speed and direction gauges already at Sterling I may be able to recycle. Both have RJ11 input jacks. The weather station needs to be able to handle at most -30 degrees F and at most 100 degrees F. It needs to be able to deal with the tough winters in Vermont and be able to supply accurate information all the time. Both the size of the solar panel and 6Ah battery are capable of running everything even on December 21st in Vermont. There will be a watchdog timer to reset and turnoff the Raspberry Pi during low solar times and when the battery gets low. To still record data, the WeatherPiArduino board is equipped with a small RAM board to store data until a good WIFI link can established. The RAM could theoretically store data for 94 years. The whole computer setup will be housed inside a waterproof box just like the image you see below. The only difference is that I'm using a Raspberry Pi Zero for less power consumption. 

Since climate change is to some the number one concern globally, developing lower cost stations may make it easier for average citizens or groups to do microclimate research. This will ultimately increase our wealth of knowledge of earth's natural systems and help us plan our actions accordingly. This is to a better future. Thank you.

story:
What is the project?

With this campaign, we'd like to raise $2,700 to build a fence to protect our trees from chickens, horses, cows and ants; and to water the trees now when it is the hottest time of the year.

The donations are for the cost of stakes, wires, staples and to pay workers from the local community to build it and to plant new trees and to water them.

It is one stage of Alvany's life project of reforestation, environmental education and pursuing a sustainable living, that she has been developing since 2012.

Where is it?

The community is Maria Preta, in Santo Antônio de Jesus, State of Bahia, the northeastern part of Brazil. See the map. The region belongs to the Atlantic Forest, but most of the trees have been cut.

Alvany's parents donated her a small piece of the land. She is using it for reforestation and ecological education. 

Why this project?

Santo Antônio de Jesus is a commercial town, with great urban expansion. Most trees were cut to raise cows in the late 1980s and later to build expensive and non-sustainable apartments. The nearby Taitinga River and the Milagroso Stream, which flows across the land are polluted from the urban sewage.  We are requesting cooperation of the local council to clean the stream and the river and to stop dumping the sewage. 

We are already seeing results:​ after planting the trees and restoring a part of the land, we found two springs​ and many animals are back, including a diversity of birds, armadillo, snakes, mico (a genus of New World monkeys), bees, moribondos etc.  The trees we have planted include Brazilwood (paubrasilia echinata),  yellow ipê (tabebuia chrysantha),  ipê rosa (handroanthus heptaphyllus), rose-acacia (robinia hispida),  jackfruit (artocarpus heterophyllus), muruçi (byrsonima crassifolia), cashew tree (anacardium occidentale), inga (shimbillo), tamarind (tamarindus indica), pé de cajá (spondias mombin), jequitibá (cariniana legalis), cedro rosa (cedrela fissilis), acaí (euterpe oleracea). Please find the diary at https://santiagoecoliving.blogspot.com.br.​

What is it about?

When Alvany was a child she had great joy drinking water from springs and waterfalls, and bathing in the stream. She went out for studying, but later, when she was about to get married, she took her fiancée for a trip there to show him that paradise. To her surprise, the waterfalls were gone and untreated sewage had been discarded into the stream and river. That was 30 years ago and since then the situation has kept on worsening. The learned lesson was: We need to take care of our nature.

Thus, she is reforesting and providing environmental education. She wants to pursue a sustainable way of living on the farm.  The project started in 2012. In 2015, Alvany planted 750 trees with the help of friends and neighbors. By the end of 2016 more than a thousand trees had been planted. The neighbors, childhood friends and also the NGO Gana have been helping to develop educational activities there. The activities have included ecological walks and we have plans to build a museum of natural history and a library.

The climate is tropical and the weather is hottest from November to April. However, with trees the climate feels very nice.

It is still early days. Further plans include making use of renewable energy, collecting rainwater, composting toilets, food system integration, rocket stove, natural furniture, and using recycled materials as much as possible, resorting to the principles of a circular economy. We also want to build a tree house, as a way to get more children involved with nature activities. And then there is the big goal of recovering the sources of water. 

Who are we?

Ville and Alvany are just two friends who met in England. Alvany is a sociologist from Brazil who changed career after living in the USA for four years. She decided to be a teacher and ended up becoming a professor. She has traveled extensively and is now setting a place to work with environment education and preservation. She is working to restore land and water. Ville is a physicist from Finland, helping with the project, as a gift for Alvany's birthday.

Isabel is Alvany's sister and her neighbor, who owns a piece of land as well and has been of great support.

We would appreciate if you logged in to the blog and left your support and wishes.
story_txt: What is the project?With this campaign, we'd like to raise $2,700 to build a fence to protect our trees from chickens, horses, cows and ants; and to water the trees now when it is the hottest time of the year.The donations are for the cost of stakes, wires, staples and to pay workers from the local community to build it and to plant new trees and to water them.It is one stage of Alvany's life project of reforestation, environmental education and pursuing a sustainable living, that she has been developing since 2012.Where is it?The community is Maria Preta, in Santo Antônio de Jesus, State of Bahia, the northeastern part of Brazil. story:
Who we are

We, Anna Maria and Lucian, grew up in families rooted in homesteading, farming, and stewardship of land and community. We were raised to love, respect and live in harmony with nature and all the people we encountered. We pursued higher education to better understand how we can continue this legacy and chose careers to do so also. For the past 10 years we have been working in the realms of sustainability, permaculture and regenerative work in academic, government, business and nonprofit environments. We designed, developed and implemented programs and projects that enhanced and continue to enhance the lives of thousands of people, and the health of numerous ecosystems. We are designers, educators, farmers, healers, stewards and regenerators of nature and communities. 

Our mission 

Throughout our lives and careers we experienced the health, abundance and joy regenerative and sustainability based lifestyles and practices can bring to people, communities and all life in general. We have also experienced and learned about the opposite when those practices are missing from people’s lives and their communities. Knowing this, early in our adulthood, we committed to spread awareness and help people learn and integrate practical regenerative and sustainability based solutions into their personal and professional lives. The results we helped create gave us a strong sense of purpose and we knew that this is the work we want to do for the rest of our lives: to be in service to all people, the environment, the common future of us all, and life in general. Our mission has been and continues to be: to inspire, empower and support a regenerative and sustainability based future.

Our Work 

Desert Bloom 

We joined this journey together in 2018 and already made beautiful impact in our local community in San Clemente in just 2 years. First, we transformed part of a 1 acre urban home and property into a thriving ecosystem that conserves water and energy, cycles and recycles waste, grows food and medicine, and exudes with native habitat and biodiversity. From this space we trained over 100 individuals with deep-dive courses in permaculture and beekeeping, while also educating hundreds more on related practical skills in other communities in the region. 

To expand our impact, to restore more degraded and sensitive ecosystems, to grow more nutritious food and medicine and share the surplus, and to inspire, empower and support more people to take on this journey for the benefit of all, we relocated to a 40 acre property in the arid high desert of Anza. We chose this space because it is a sensitive ecosystem, degraded and endangered, and has immense potential for regeneration. In a very short time, starting in July 2019, we renovated the house, produced lots of veggies and medicinal herbs from a small garden, planted fruit trees and shrubs, built a chicken coop for our 8 rescued chicks, started on some habitat restoration projects, hosted multiple work parties, a leadership course and a permaculture design certification course. 

Our plans with Desert Bloom 

Our plan, already in action, is to transform this degraded space into a working Permaculture and Regenerative Research and Education Farm. We planned it as a combination of entrepreneurial and non-profit endeavors. In this space we will:

  • grow food and medicine with regenerative practices for ourselves, our apprentices, our students and the market,
  • educate and train people in permaculture design, regenerative farming, ecosystems restoration, beekeeping, herbalism, earth and people centered leadership and many other related subjects in these realms, 
  • restore and enhance the farm sensitive ecosystems for long term resilience, 
  • host interested individuals to experience the beauty of our work and the surrounding nature,
  • track and record all of our practices and progress and share them with the world.

We are committed to demonstrate that this work is possible, feasible, beautiful and with extensive benefits to all life, even when done from a harsh high desert arid environment. We will use this model and the surplus it produces to help other similar projects get off the ground.

Why all of this matters to you

  • We all need and depend on healthy ecosystems to provide for our human needs, and we need people that know how and are willing to restore and maintain them. We practice regenerative farming and ecosystems restoration, and we train others to take on these tasks too. We are growing the number of individuals on this mission and with these skills. 
  • We all need food and medicine and farmers to grow it. We are farmers that can feed and heal people, while also enhancing the health and resiliency of the ecosystems that support farming in the long run! Our farm goods will be available to you. 
  • 34% of our planet’s land surface is desert or arid land. That percentage is growing in big part do to unsustainable farming practices. Over 2 billion people live in these lands, most without the means, knowledge and skills to deal with the growing desertification and the related localized climatic changes. Desert Bloom is in such a place and we are committed to demonstrate that regenerative farming and practices can feed and empower people, build long term ecosystems’ resilience and revert desertification. Our model is replicable and we will share it with the world as it unfolds.

Why we need your help 

We have the knowledge, the skills, the experience, the confidence, the commitment and the space to do this work. We need your help to be able to:

  • purchase materials and equipment for the farming and restoration operations, as well as for building infrastructure and operating the educational, hosting and research activities,
  • sample: greenhouses, seeds, propagation trays and pots, irrigation, some microstock and their feed, small tractor, various hand tools, lots of sustainably harvested lumber, screws, roofing, solar panels and canvas tents
  • hire farmers and permaculturists to help us implement and manage the farming, restoration and educational operations (we love and are committed to paying people a living wage)
  • hire experts to help us tap into available non-profit financial resources for this type of work (we plan to create a non-profit in 2020)Our campaign gives more than it takes. By giving to us and this project, no matter where you are in the world, you become part of it and community we have built around it. All of our perks can be gifted to others. 

Other ways you can help 

Beyond giving, we’d love your help to get the word out to friends and family about our project. You can:

  • Share this page to help us reach our crowdfund goal
  • Follow and share our Social Media Pages for updates
    • Desert Bloom Facebook
    • @DesertBloomFarm Instagram
    • @BeekeepingGypsy Instagram
    • @AboutAndForSustainability Instagram
    • AboutAndForSustainability Facebook
  • Come check any or all of our offerings at Desert Bloom, San Clemente Homestead, Farmers’ Markets in San Diego, Orange and Riverside Counties. You will be able to find a calendar of events on one of our websites. (Desert Bloom Farm or About And For Sustainability)

Transparency

We are open to the possibility that we may not achieve our crowdfunding goal. Regardless of the outcome we will move forward and make this vision possible, even if it will take longer due to funds. As eco entrepreneurs, we have encountered many hurdles in our quest to make regeneration and education possible. Many times we had to individually do the work of entire teams and even borrow to make school gardens and educational scholarships possible. We would do it again. We know our value and the value of what we are creating and we will push forward. We have an array of skills and experience that transfers to any industry, and we are willing and able to work hard to make Desert Bloom and our dream to bring regeneration and sustainability to the world possible. As for hurdles that we may encounter with the planned operations at Desert Bloom, we have already built enough flexibility in the plan and a community of people that committed to helping us troubleshoot issues pro-bono. Beyond that, we value integrity and authenticity, and will be openly share what we can and cannot do as promised. Your contribution will make our vision come to life faster.

More about us

Anna Maria is a beekeeper, herbalist, farmer, consultant and educator with close to 10 years of professional experience in the realm of sustainability, beekeeping, urban farming and community building around the farm to table movement. She has been rescuing and relocating to safe locations hundreds of honey bee swarms, and leading an apprenticeship program teaching others to do the same. In the food movement, she has gathered over 1000 individuals around community table that supports local regenerative farmers and chefs. As an educator, she has led over 100 workshops, lectures and courses on topics from the realms of beekeeping, urban farming and regenerative food systems. As a farmer, she has been a key designer, planner and manager of multiple neighborhood farms and farming based educational spaces in Reno, Nevada and Orange County, California. Anna Maria is also a college professor, the founder of The Honey Bee Hub, Bee Botanicals and co-creator of all things with About And For Sustainability. She holds a BA in Political Science from the University of Reno and an array of certifications in Permaculture, Master Beekeeping and Herbalism. ​

Lucian is a sustainability, leadership and permaculture designer, educator and consultant with over 8 years of professional experience in the design, development and implementation of regenerative programs and projects in academic, government, business and nonprofit environments. He has led over 250 workshops, lectures and courses on topics from the realms of sustainability, permaculture and regenerative leadership, touching the lives of over 6000 individuals of all ages. As a permaculture practitioner, he designed  and installed over 50 small, medium and large private and public spaces. Lucian is also a college professor, the founder of About And For Sustainability, the co-founder of reEarth Consulting and a senior advisor for Sustridge Sustainability Consulting. He holds a BA in International Relations and a MA in Global Leadership and Sustainable Development from Hawaii Pacific University and multiple Permaculture Design certifications.

A more personal appeal 

While our parent’s generation looked to the city life for fulfillment, we long for a return to an agrarian lifestyle.  A way of living that is simpler, with less consumption, more sharing, repairing damaged landscapes and food systems. For us, regenerative farming and permaculture provides the tools and pathways to this kind of living.  While we don’t expect everyone to be full fledged farmers like us, we do believe that everyone could be as self sufficient as possible and possess the skills to nourish themselves, their families and communities.

Desert Bloom is next to Anza Borrego State Park, the perfect backdrop for the type of learning and programming we wish to host.  Intensive permaculture education, beekeeping training, and herbalism are just some of the topics that will be hosted as students camp on the land, enjoy nourishing food grown onsite, reconnect with themselves and nature, all the while building community and new networks in finding like minded individuals.  This type of education coupled with powerful human connection and nature based experiences are exactly what transformed our lives and propelled us forward to our careers now. 

Desert Bloom will be the first prototype of multiple future locations with the same mission and goals all the while serving different communities across the globe.  We seek to streamline a model that transforms degraded landscapes into one that can host guests in a way that is in harmony with nature. Rebuilding what was lost and showing guests how to bring these skills, tactics and new ideals into their own lives.  A closed loop of operations where labor and time spent into programming, supports farming operations, habitat restoration that then supports programming again. A new model of farming, a new way to educate those seeking earth centric careers, both in ways that sustain each other for long term success.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT TO MAKE THIS BIG STEP IN OUR VISION A REALITY!

Links with Descriptions for our Perks

Bee Keeping Apprenticeship - 

https://www.aboutandforsustainability.com/beekeepinginsanclemente.html 

Permaculture Design Course San Clemente -

https://www.aboutandforsustainability.com/perma...

Ecological Garden Design -

https://www.aboutandforsustainability.com/suppo...

story:
FAQ: Hello World, we are doing the very best, but it is difficult, I don´t know what to do? So many vistors..... how can I get money for you? Anybody any idea?
This project is great and the very best for you, don´t know how to explain in a better way. May you help us?

The idea of the Gap-Cap

Hi, my name is Stefan Birg. My team (Jan, Carsten and Robert) and me are the founder of the gap-cap.
We added our skills to generate the maximum results.
We all have usual jobs but we also have a dream: Help the world to get a little bit more healthy and save the environment.
You have questions? We´ll answer all of it, so let us know.


Our idea about the lightened bottlecap is based on a simple idea: "By not putting anything into circulation it is the best possible way to safe raw material." So we have been sure: Our idea can help the world to get a little bit more healthy.

And so we have taken care of a whole little thing with great success: The Gaps in our Caps, in short: Our Gap-Caps.

Started with the first idea through first prototypes and tests for closing the bottles, pressure tests up to patent issues and registrations, finally we have brought the development to market maturity. Have a look at our number ONE below!

The No.1

Next steps

Further steps have to be done: Finding strategic partners, social media communication, advertising and getting proofed certificates. Of course we still have to put money into our Gap-Cap.

Each day we are doing the very best to bring the Gap-Cap up from the bottom but now the time has come: We need your help!

We love our world

If you love our world like we do then please help us. Let´s bring this project into success so that our Gap-Cap is soon a naturalness, because it is economically and sustainable.

Together we can be a solid group and we invite you to be part of this movement. Just now we want to thank everybody for your support and every Cent. Our environment will also be thankful.

Think Green and let´s get the world a little bit more sexy!

Bottlecap goes sexy

We all have usual jobs but we also have a dream: Help the world to get a little bit more healthy and save the environment.You have questions? We´ll answer all of it, so let us know.Our idea about the lightened 
bottlecap is based on a simple idea: "By not putting anything into 
circulation it is the best possible way to safe raw material." So we 
have been sure: Our idea can help the world to get a little bit more 
healthy.And so we have taken care of a whole little thing with great success: The Gaps in our Caps, in short: Our Gap-Caps.Started
 with the first idea through first prototypes and tests for closing the 
bottles, pressure tests up to patent issues and registrations, finally 
we have brought the development to market maturity. Have a look at our 
number ONE below!The No.1


Next steps
Further steps have to be done: Finding strategic partners, social
 media communication, advertising and getting proofed certificates. Of 
course we still have to put money into our Gap-Cap.Each day we are doing the very best to bring the Gap-Cap up from the bottom but now the time has come: We need your help!We love our worldIf
 you love our world like we do then please help us. Let´s bring this 
project into success so that our Gap-Cap is soon a naturalness, because 
it is economically and sustainable.Together we can be a solid 
group and we invite you to be part of this movement. Just now we want to
 thank everybody for your support and every Cent. Our environment will 
also be thankful.Think Green and let´s get the world a little bit more sexy!Bottlecap goes sexy

story:
I Need Your Help to Solve The Climate Crisis

My name is Andrew Grant Houston, however my friends call me Ace, and you can help me solve the climate crisis. I am a licensed architect based here in Seattle, a Texan born and raised, and the founder of my own architecture practice House Cosmopolitan. I am contacting you today because I need your help.

According to the Environmental Energy and Study Institute, in the United States nearly 40% of carbon emissions come from our buildings: which includes the materials used, the energy used to construct them, and the biggest chunk, the use of those buildings. Architects like myself and other building professionals have made reductions in energy usage over the last decade, with over a 20% reduction in carbon emissions from 2005-2015, however my industry only has 10 years to make an 80% reduction in carbon emissions. So how can I personally make sure we hit our target?

Passive House!

Passive House is a building certification created in Germany that aims to reduce energy usage in a home / office / any type of building by at least 75% and as much as 90%! This then allows that last 25-10% to be offset by renewable resources and potentially achieve net-zero energy usage. I want to become a Certified Passive House Designer so every single project I work on moving forward gets us closer to a sustainable solution against the climate crisis.

The Ask

Your next question: why is an architect asking for money? I thought architects made a lot of money! Short answer is no, I just started my own practice this year and though things are going generally OK making this investment would not be cheap. But as we know from the climate strike and what scientists are telling us, the cost of inaction is even higher and I want to make the most impact as quickly as possible and to do so with every project that I work on.

 

I am raising $3500 and that covers the following:

  • A week-long intensive Passive House Certification Course, which is located in the Bay Area (there isn’t one closer), that also covers the cost of taking the certification exam as well as the cost of being certified for five years
  • Air travel and housing for the week, including carbon offsets
  • All the lovely Indiegogo fees

I also have 2 Stretch Goals, that would make an even bigger impact:

  • If I get to $4000 I will make a video of my journey to help spread the word about Passive House and my journey to becoming certified
  • If I raise an additional $2000 doals (6K total) then I will create a FREE course done digitally so others can become certified as well.

Particularly given all the work that is happening around the Green New Deal in the US, I want to do my part in educating as many people as possible to help empower them to not only become consultants and designers of passive house projects but also be able to enter into the new green economy.

 

What's in it for you? The Perks.

Perks start from a simple thank you and go all the way to a seat in the potential online course!

  • $1:       A Thank You and Social Media Shout-out 
  • $10:    The above, plus a Personal Postcard
  • $25:   The above, plus a Personal Sketch
  • $50:   The above, plus a House Cosmopolitan blog and video shout-out
  • $100: The above, plus a two-hour design consultation
  • $500: The above, plus a *free* Project Feasibility Study OR all my PH Course Notes
  • $1000: *Everything* Above PLUS an official video sponsor PLUS a guaranteed seat in the online course 

 

The Impact

By simply getting certified and with a goal of designing at least 10,000SF each year, that would mean: 

  • More than 10,000SF will either be certified or designed to Passive House standards
  • Up to 3,000 metric tons of CO2 will NOT be produced for the life of those buildings
  • Net-zero energy on all projects will be a reasonable target

With teaching a course for 30 people, those numbers could quickly multiply to drive down carbon emissions even faster!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That is OK! Simply sharing my campaign would mean the world to me and increase the awareness around Passive House building and the ability for people like myself to make a significant shift away from carbon and to a sustainable future.

Let's solve the climate crisis.

story:
It’s Time for a Change

It’s time for us to raise our standards…

Hi! We are Scott and Rebecca Ross, and we are the founders of Raise Your Standards Wear (R.Y.S. WEAR).

We went out and found the best Eco-Friendly fabrics made from recycled plastic bottles, bamboo, soy, organic cotton, tencel, recycled nylon, and hemp. We worked with our designers to make awesome leggings, hoodies, shorts, and more. We blended amazing comfort and over-the-top functionality, while making our clothing look so good you can wear it anywhere.

We offer you superior fitness clothing and a chance be part of the change needed to save the planet. So what do you do now? You decide on which Perk you want to order and then which item(s) you want to receive for your perk. 

With every Perk you order, we are taking plastic bottles out of the country's and the world's eco-cycle! By hitting our campaign goals, we will effectively take thousands of plastic bottles out of landfills and oceans, and use them for something amazing and functional!  It might not seem like much, but it's a start... We need you and your support.

On top of that we will plant not 1, not 2… but 14 trees for every single purchase you make; we have partnered with The Eden Reforestation Project to make this happen.

Order a Perk today, start recycling plastic waste, and we will plant your first 14 trees.

"A monsoon has to start with a single rain drop. Be that rain drop.” ~ Unknown

R.Y.S. Wear is our rain drop!

 

Did you Know?

Plastic pollution has become one of the planet’s most pressing environmental issues. Rapidly increasing production of disposable plastic products has overwhelmed the world’s ability to deal with them.

Plastic made from fossil fuels is just over a century old. After World War II, development of thousands of new plastic products exploded the industry and transformed modern life.

Without plastic, modern life would be unrecognizable today. It has revolutionized medicine with life-saving mechanisms, made space travel possible, lightened cars and jets, and saved lives with helmets, incubators, and equipment for clean drinking water.

However, the conveniences plastics offers has led to a throw-away culture that is devastating the planet. Today, single use plastic products, like water bottles and food wrappers, account for a staggering 40 percent of the plastic produced each year. These items, with lifespans lasting only minutes, sometimes even seconds, will persist in the environment for hundreds of years to come.

The Sobering Numbers

  • Half of all plastic manufactured throughout history has been made in the last 15 years.
  • Production of plastic has increased exponentially over the last 65 years, from 2.3 million tons in 1950 to 448 million tons in 2015. By 2050, production is expected to be double that.
  • Each year, about 8 million tons of plastic waste from coastal nations ends up in our oceans.
  • Plastics often contain additives making them stronger, more flexible, and durable. Some estimates suggest at least 400 years to break down.
     

Raise Your Standards Wear

Raise Your Standards Wear is a family-run fitness clothing line based in Santa Rosa, CA.
Made In America, Hand Sewn, and 100% ECO-FRIENDLY

We realized we were part of the problem. We admit it. Over our 20 years in business, we have contributed to pollution in our environment and filling our oceans with plastic. The problem has cost the jobs of countless working Americans, and dumped the wages and working conditions for just as many workers overseas. The problem has flooded the market for apparel with cheaply produced, low quality garments every year…

It’s time for a change… So we changed!

We stopped making any of our products overseas, stopped using cheap, unsustainable materials, and set one important goal: to create our own designs and manufacture them here in America in truly sustainable fashion (no pun intended). 

The choice is yours… Are you going to continue unsustainable shopping habits? Or will you Raise Your Standards and reclaim our planet? — If you choose to get your sports apparel from R.Y.S. Wear, we promise that our clothing is hand sewn in California, and that everything, including packaging, is 100% eco-friendly.
 

Our Line of Eco-Friendly Clothing

ABC Legging

The ABC legging is made for workouts at any level or everyday wear - they are as simple as ABC. The light weight material flows with your every move and hugs you like a soft second skin.  Made from Eco-Friendly recycled polyester derived from recycled plastic bottles and spandex, this legging has 4-way stretch, wicking, anti-microbial, and odor resistant properties. We have squat tested, downward dog tested, and run tested all our leggings, and they pass with flying colors. 

Each pair of our leggings is made from 18-22 recycled plastic bottles. Recycled polyester is a benefit to the environment because it conserves non-renewable resources and reduces the release of harmful emissions into the earth.

  • Less waste ends up in landfills
  • Less demand for petroleum
  • Fewer greenhouse gases released
  • Less environmental impact

Content: 84% Recycled Plastic Bottles / 16% Spandex

The Cache Legging – Available in Black, Mykonos Blue

Greatness is the best description of the Cache Leggings. Made for the person looking for extreme functionality and comfort while being good to the planet. With its three pockets, perfectly placed seams, and curves in all the right places, you will LOVE this legging. We have squat, downward dog, and run tested these leggings, and they exceed expectations. 

This recycled polyester spandex is an Eco-Friendly fabric that is perfect for performance wear. Our fabric is one of the most certified, earth-friendly fibers available in the world. High-quality, recycled polyester yarns are made from 100% recyclable materials. Each pair of leggings is made from 18-22 recycled plastic bottles and spandex. You are now part of the solution. 

2 phone pockets & 1 back pocket, wicking, 4-way stretch, breathable, and odor resistant are just a few of the qualities of these amazing leggings. 

Content: 88% Recycled Plastic Bottles/ 12% Spandex

Each pair of our leggings removes 18 plastic bottles from the waste cycle!

The Perfect Hoodie 

This hoodie is the culmination of six months of reviewing dozens and dozens of hoodies and taking the best of each to make what we believe is The Perfect Hoodie. From its feminine lines to gentle flow, this hoodie is flattering to all female body types. With its curved base and french terry interior, this hoodie lives up to its title of Perfection. We will only have a limited number of these perfect hoodies available in 2019! 

The ideal blend of three truly Eco-Friendly fabrics makes for a ridiculously soft, breathable, and oh so comfortable hoodie. 

This will be your favorite hoodie. 

Content: 74% Tencel/18% Organic Cotton/8% Hemp 

The RYS Ultimate Compression Shorts 

We worked with hundreds of athletes of all levels to see what they love and, more importantly, don’t love about compression shorts. With this feedback, we created The Ultimate Compression Shorts.

Our shorts are 7” in length, have five pockets (two in the front and three in back), and are made from recycled plastic bottles and spandex! There are two options for the weight/thickness for your shorts:

Heavy: 300 GSM. These are great for increased heat and for any weather conditions.  

Light: 250 GSM. These offer awesome flow and feel like a second skin.

Whichever option you chose; you will love these shorts!

The RYS Wear Mission

Our mission is to take 1,000,000 plastic bottles out of the eco-cycle in our first year and turn them into high-performing, awesomely comfortable sports bras, compression shorts, and leggings.

We have also partnered with the Eden Reforestation Project to plant 14 trees for every garment sold during the life of this campaign. 14 trees!

Our goal is to plant at least 500,000 trees every year.

With your help, that can become reality.

What We Need

We have started this campaign to raise enough money to keep expanding our brand and reach our truest goal: To be able to plant 3,000,000+ trees in our first five years and remove 5,000,000+ bottles from our eco-cycle.

How You Can Help

Please take a look through our list of perks on the right hand side of this campaign page and see which one is best for you to help support our project.

We understand that not everybody is in a position to contribute financially. Every single share, like, and comment on social media helps us tremendously. If you’re reading this campaign, could you share with your friends and family on social media? Thanks!

story:
Finally! A company that allows you to shop by PRICE, EFFICIENCY and ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT!

Most companies only care about price, but Go Green Electrically cares about Price, Efficiency, and the environmental impact that product creates.

Go Green Electrically is compared to the Travelocity or Expedia of Green Energy Efficient products providing you the best PRICE, EFFICIENCY, AND LOWEST ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT.

With your help we can develop a new mobile app to help consumers make eco friendly purchases saving them money, shop by efficiency and reduce their C02 emissions.  Be the first to download it!

 Development of our Green Energy Platform 

We can continue to improve this giant GREEN community space, so individuals, organizations, and businesses can meet in order to make smarter money and energy saving decisions.

We are building new features, like real time posting, groups, city chat room, instant messenger, energy efficiency comparison tools and other cool features

Mobile preview that will have an efficiency calculator and an efficiency comparison tool.  Shop on the run by Price, Efficiency and Environmental Impact!

Our online shopping cart allows you to compare products from a "Cost To Run Annually" perspective.   No one else offers this.


Marketing & Advertising

Spreading awareness of this central online community platform through all green and energy efficient organizations,  individuals, & businesses around the world. Through direct contact, advertising & organizing a community events


Our target $100,000. Our dream = $250,000!   

Growing the Go Green Electrically brand and movement.

As a central Internet Store & Community Platform for the whole world there really are endless opportunities Go Green Electrically can explore and leverage making a better community and environment for us all. 

  • Hire staff to focus on community development. The more we connect with local people, organizations and business all around the world, the more we can hear what you need & the more we can do to help. We want to continually create new ways our platform can help raise awareness by promoting Greener Products and empower consumers to make an educated purchase

  • Collaborate with Individuals, Green Businesses, Organizations to hold fund-raising events to help people in all areas of our community

  • Green and Energy Efficiency Education, Events and Webinars.

---------------CLICK HERE TO CONTRIBUTE TODAY---------------

____________________________________________________________________________


Go Green Electrically a community social enterprise

We've built Go Green Electrically for EVERYONE to use

We're a company powered by people just like you and looking to take a step towards making a real impact helping our planet and save money on their electric bill. 

To sum it up...

  • Go Green Electrically is a multi-vendor internet store that focuses on energy efficient consumer electrical products thereby promoting the reduction of carbon emissions created to generate electricity.

  • The market value for green electrical products is over $700 million and is growing at an enormous rate. Go Green Electrically will take on a semblance of Amazon, Etsy, and Google Shopping, but with a focus on Green Electrical Products.

  • Go Green Electrically will centralize the myriad number of green electrical manufactures, stores and vendors thus providing a wide array of variable products of home or industrial electrical products for customers.

  • Go Green Electrically will allow the consumer to compare products from an energy efficiency, carbon emission, customer ratings, and cost perspective.

  • Go Green Electrically will allow manufactures, stores, and vendors a medium or platform to promote and sell the latest green technology available.

                        ---------------CLICK HERE TO CONTRIBUTE---------------


We really want to provide exposure

  • Go Green Electrically will provide environmentally conscious vendors, manufacturers, innovators and suppliers an online platform through which they are able to connect, showcase, and sell their products to consumers.

And we want somewhere that connects us all

  • Go Green Electrically works just like an online community. Environmentally conscious consumers will have access to easy-to-understand information and resources, and energy efficient products that will help them reduce their energy bills… and their carbon footprint!

Our goal is to work with as many

Innovators, businesses, individuals & organizations as possible to build whatever features we may need to promote Green Energy Efficient Products, so we can constantly make Go Green Electrically a better way to spread the amazing stuff we do  around the world.

So we'd love all of you to contribute towards this movement!


Here are some of the things we've done & want to continuing doing


  • Our interactive online learning center will educate consumers about energy efficiency, carbon emissions, energy usage, and energy production. This allows each person to make their own informed decisions about Going Green Electrically based on their individual lifestyle and capabilities.

  • Go Green Electrically is a go-to resource and specialized internet platform for companies and consumers who care about our impact on the Earth and saving money.

  • Join the movement and be part of the solution.

Marketing & Advertising
Spreading awareness of this central online community platform through all green and energy efficient organizations,  individuals, & businesses around the world. Through direct contact, advertising & organizing a community events
Our target $100,000. Our dream = $250,000!   
Growing the Go Green Electrically brand and movement.
As a central Internet Store & Community Platform for the whole world there really are endless opportunities Go Green Electrically can explore and leverage making a better community and environment for us all. 

Hire staff to focus on community development. The more we connect with local people, organizations and business all around the world, the more we can hear what you need & the more we can do to help. We want to continually create new ways our platform can help raise awareness by promoting Greener Products and empower consumers to make an educated purchase
Collaborate with Individuals, Green Businesses, Organizations to hold fund-raising events to help people in all areas of our community
Green and Energy Efficiency Education, Events and Webinars.

---------------CLICK HERE TO CONTRIBUTE TODAY---------------
____________________________________________________________________________
 Go Green Electrically a community social enterprise
We've built Go Green Electrically for EVERYONE to use
We're a company powered by people just like you and looking to take a step towards making a real impact helping our planet and save money on their electric bill. 
To sum it up...
Go Green Electrically is a multi-vendor internet store that focuses on energy efficient consumer electrical products thereby promoting the reduction of carbon emissions created to generate electricity.
The market value for green electrical products is over $700 million and is growing at an enormous rate. Go Green Electrically will take on a semblance of Amazon, Etsy, and Google Shopping, but with a focus on Green Electrical Products.
Go Green Electrically will centralize the myriad number of green electrical manufactures, stores and vendors thus providing a wide array of variable products of home or industrial electrical products for customers.
Go Green Electrically will allow the consumer to compare products from an energy efficiency, carbon emission, customer ratings, and cost perspective.
Go Green Electrically will allow manufactures, stores, and vendors a medium or platform to promote and sell the latest green technology available.



                        ---------------CLICK HERE TO CONTRIBUTE---------------
We really want to provide exposure
Go Green Electrically will provide environmentally conscious vendors, manufacturers, innovators and suppliers an online platform through which they are able to connect, showcase, and sell their products to consumers.
And we want somewhere that connects us all
Go Green Electrically works just like an online community. Environmentally conscious consumers will have access to easy-to-understand information and resources, and energy efficient products that will help them reduce their energy bills… and their carbon footprint!
Our goal is to work with as many
Innovators, businesses, individuals & organizations as possible to build whatever features we may need to promote Green Energy Efficient Products, so we can constantly make Go Green Electrically a better way to spread the amazing stuff we do  around the world.
So we'd love all of you to contribute towards this movement!

Here are some of the things we've done & want to continuing doing

Our interactive online learning center will educate consumers about energy efficiency, carbon emissions, energy usage, and energy production. This allows each person to make their own informed decisions about Going Green Electrically based on their individual lifestyle and capabilities. 
Go Green Electrically is a go-to resource and specialized internet platform for companies and consumers who care about our impact on the Earth and saving money.

Join the movement and be part of the solution.

story:
OCEAN LOVERS WE NEED YOUR HELP to replace sailing vessel MIR's old wooden masts & keep her out at sea working with island peoples to steward our oceans! 

Our campaign is urgent! Your support will help complete a $210K campaign that has been generously kick-started by friends.

Sailing vessel MIR

THE SCOOP
Biosphere Foundation has been working collectively with island peoples for decades because they are the ones most affected by depleted fish stocks, vanishing marine habitats and climate change.  

Working hand-in-hand with people in remote islands in Asia, our team learns about the challenges facing the people and then joins with them to implement basic practices and skills to safeguard the biodiversity and health of the marine environment.

MIR hosts a Captain and international crew that have been studying and initiating programs to protect coral reefs, marine mammals, and/or preserving sea turtle nesting beaches for decades. Also onboard are local and international volunteers who join the effort to steward the marine environment.

                                

Crown of Thorns, a predator of corals,
being removed by local & international volunteers

HOW CAN YOU HELP?
The only way that we can reach these island people, and spend time with their communities, is to base our operations on an ocean-going vessel. 

We have to replace the masts because they are dangerous. Please give anything you can and spread the word to other ocean lovers as this campaign has to be reached by August, 2016. 

ABOUT THE MASTS OF MIR
MIR is an old lady that was built in Holland in 1910. She has two 50+ year old wooden masts that are not repairable. Due to urgent safety reasons, we must replace the old gear to continue reaching locations in need and maintain our platform of operation in remote regions in Southeast Asia.

Mir, then known as the English Rose, in Rotterdam - 1947

LETS GO!
We are ready!  The masts are under construction now! Help us reach our goal and keep our work on the go!

LEARN MORE
Biosphere Foundation is a US 501 (c) 3 non-profit organization. It was Founded in 1991 and has championed a wide range of ecological research and education projects around the world.

WWW.BIOSPHEREFOUNDATION.ORG

 

Sperm whale breaching near MIR in Sri Lanka

story:
Hi There, My name is Krista- some of you may know me as Molly- and some of you may not know me at all!

I am a regular girl with a regular life but have an extraordinary opportunity to travel to Egypt to see one of the great wonders of the world! The Pyramid of Giza. WOW. I know.

This opportunity has fallen into my lap last minute and I am falling short on the funds to make it happen- I need just a mere $1600 to purchase my round trip flights from Calgary to Cairo, Egypt and the small participation fee to do this 10 day Egypt Unplugged Tour

Some of the highlights include:

Cairo Pyramids and Sphinx of Giza
Valley of the Kings
Temple of Hatshepsut

Egyptian Museum

Luxor and the Red Sea

 

I would love the opportunity to see this great wonder and document it for all my friends new and old to see- To stand at the foot of the Sphinx in all its wonder- to learn the history first hand and to see if the UFO's really did build the pyramids- So many questions!

 

Any donation would be appreciated! I love you all!! And thank you

story:
THE FACTS

  • 1 out of every 5 deaths of children under 5 is due to a water-related disease.
  • 1 in 9 people world wide do not have access to safe and clean drinking water
  • In developing countries , 80% of illnesesses are linked to poor water and sanitation conditions
  • ½ of the world hospital beds are filled with people suffering from a water-related disease.
  • By investing in clean water alone, young children around the world can gain more than 413 million days of health! 

Ref: https://thewaterproject.org/water-scarcity/water_stats

 

WHO WE ARE and WHAT WE WANT.

We are a group of students from Guatemala whom are conscience of the importance of water in our learning experience. We also know that the majority of kids and students in our country don’t have the resources to access drinkable water. Help us give to our world's future leaders the most basic human necessity clean WATER.

 

ABOUT THE SOLUTION

 ECOFILTRO is an invention of Dr.Fernando Mazadiegos created to provide drinkable water at a low-cost & a easy-to-use way. It has proven to be so successful that prestigious universities like MIT, have approved its effectiveness.

 

Easy-to-use

  1. Pour water from any source into the filter
  2. Wait for water to filter ( 1-2 lt per hour)
  3. Drink J

The Ecofiltro is made out of simple technologies and local material like clay, sawdust and colloidal silver (natural antibacterial).  Made with a controlled pore size that allows water to pass which eliminates smell and color while filtering out the bacteria, parasitic cysts and faucal residues.

Philip Wilson is a Guatemalan social entrepreneur whom has made it his mission to provide clean and drinkable water to 1 million families by 2020.

His method is supported by the fact that children are the present and future of Guatemala. When provided with clean water , the children will become healthier and forge a positive change in their community, family and themselves. By targeting  the youth, the company believes that it will commence a “domino” effect and soon the people will not only learn about ecofiltro but want one in their home.

The company starts by:

 1.donating filters to local schools to have inside the classroom

2. capacitating the teachers of the proper use of the filters

3. assigning a schedule to the children so they are responsible of pouring water onto the filter

story:
Recycling plastic to make eco-blocks

Isla Holbox is a beautiful island located on the north of Yucatan peninsula in Mexico. It is part of the Yum Balam Nature reserve. The island Holbox is the habitat of many species like the pink flamingo, the whale shark, turtles and many other marine species.  Jongik is aware of the environmental issues caused by the plastic waste produced by inhabitants and tourists in the Holbox island. 

                                                                                                                                                           

 

 

 

 

There is no process to treat or to recycle this plastic waste, and There is no process to treat or to recycle this plastic waste, and it is just transported 400 meters away of the beach and thrown up in the nature. It causes harmful impact to the ecosystem of the island. That is why we want to develop our project of plastic recycling.

Nowadays the association already has the place and the voluntary people to carry out the project, but we do not have yet the necessary machines (a mill machine and a concrete mixer machine). We are doing this crowdfunding precisely to the aim to raise funds to buy the machines and begin to implement our environmental project.  Help us to protect the habitat of the species which home is the Holbox island.

The change is possible and recycling is the future!

                              RECICLANDO PLASTICO  Y CREANDO ECO BLOQUES

Desde que comenzamos a viajar por el mundo nos dimos cuenta como los lugares hermosos se van arruinando con la contaminación, paradisíacas playas llenas de basura,botellas plásticas en su mayoría. Fue por esta razón que decidimos hacer algo para detener esta tendencia, por que aveces crear conciencia no es suficiente, queremos hacer algo importante y aportar con nuestro tiempo y dedicación para lograr reciclar el PET en nuestra isla y darle un uso positivo para la población, Tenemos fe y confianza en que juntos podemos hacerlo, llevamos más de un año preparando este proyecto, tenemos un espacio seguro para las instalaciones y muchos voluntarios con ganas de ayudar a reciclar, ahora solo nos falta juntar el dinero para una moledora de plastico y una revolvedora de concreto  que son un eje fundamental en la fabricación del Eco-block

   Nosotros esperamos recaudar lo suficiente para las máquinas, del dinero dependerá el tamaño y la calidad, pero el proyecto lo realizaremos si o si! por que es un sueño que tenemos desde que pisamos la isla... queremos mantener nuestro paraíso limpio para que todos ustedes puedan un dia ir y disfrutar de él... no solo de la playa más bella que vimos maravillosa de arenas blancas y mar turquesa, sino que también puedas disfrutar de la bioluminiscencia, nadar con el tiburón ballena, caminar por los bancos de arena, ver desovar las tortugas y disfrutar de los flamingos rosas y los más de 155 especies de aves que viven aquí

Por que hacer el cambio es posible y reciclar es el futuro!
