story:
My name is Daniel Pavlić and I'm the creator of SEFF – Smaragdni Eco Film Festival.

In Croatian language Smaragdni means Emerald, and everything started with emerald waters of the river Una.

Since my childhood emerald waters of Una fascinated me, it’s color, depth, movement… Throughout the years I’ve seen the river change, as life in Hrvatska Kostajnica changed as well. Once a buzzing small town today is a ghost town due to war, economy and environmental crisis.

But Una with its emerald waters is still here, a silent witness of time and change. And my heart’s desire is that it remains a witness of change, of growth not decay.

For the past 12 years, I and a small but courageous team with the smallest budget ever created a really great international festival. A festival that has preservation of the environment and Mother Gaia as it’s main goal, but also to bring cultural events and environmental awareness to small towns and villages living by an on the waters of Una.

To be completely honest, I am not sure how we managed to keep the Festival going. But I feel blessed nevertheless, cause the 11 editions we had by now were made possible by the love and hard work of all involved – Festival’s team, volunteers, environmental activists and incredibly talented authors whose films were screened.

This year we are facing yet another challenge. Due to governmental cuts in cultural support, our small budget has been compromised. And we are talking about a budget under 5000 euros with which every year we managed to pull off the Festival! Can you imagine traveling on bicycles for 7 days with 15 filmmakers, students and nature lovers to set up free screenings on the banks of the river for audiences that mostly don’t have film theaters in their towns and villages? And to do that with such a budget?

Definitely challenging, almost impossible. But we still did it! Please, help us do it this year as well!

With love,

Daniel

 

SEFF - Smaragdni Eco Film Festival (Emerald Eco Film Festival), a unique traveling ecological film festival, has been held for eleven years already, screening educational films with the aim to raise public ecological awareness.

Within SEFF annual activities, an international cooperation has been established and SEFF “Emerald Tour” initiated, starting from the spring of the river Una in Donja Suvaja, in the region of Lika, continuing from there to Bosnia and Herzegovina, using environmental friendly transportation means – bicycles. The Festival’s team has visited around thirty towns so far. The films were selected by Daniel Pavlić, who divided them into 3 groups – animations, shorts and feature films.

 

SEFF Visiting is the title of the post-festival part when the Festival’s team is traveling and visiting various towns as well as participating at ecological film festivals throughout the region. By the end of the year, SEFF will have visited; Koprivnica, Zadar, Šibenik, Dubrovnik, Otočac, Gospić, Ston, Korčula, Tribunj, Brodarica, Murter, Zagreb, Pula, Volosko, Perušić, Slavonski Brod, Rijeka, as well as the Green Fest in Belgrade, Serbia.

 

SEFF – Smaragdni Eco Film Festival, an annual event showcasing independent animation, feature and short films with an ecological topic from around the world, is inviting the filmmakers from all over the world to submit their films for its annual event taking place in 21. – 28. June 2019. in Hrvatska Kostajnica, Dvor, Jasenovac, Hrvatska Dubica, Zagreb, Croatia and Martin Brod, Kulen Vakuf, Bihać, Bosanska Krupa, Bosanski Novi - Bosnia and Herzegovina.


21.6. - starting from wheel of river Una (Donja Suvaja), Martin Brod
22.6. - Kulen Vakuf - National park Una (Štrbački buk), Bihać
23.6. - Bosanska Krupa
24.6. - Bosanski Novi, Dvor
25.6. - Kostajnica
26.6. - Hrvatska Dubica, Jasenovac
27.6. - Zagreb
28.6. - Hrvatska Kostajnica

story:
We all have places that make us who we are

I’m Domenica Busetti and like you all I have a place that is really close to my heart, a place that risks not to resist the passage of time. This place is the millenary Tower of Almese (Torre di Almese), collocated on the Via Francigena, at the foot of the Abbey “Sacra di San Michele”, near the city of Turin, and it represents a magnificent patrimony for the history of our Country, testimony of events that have built our past.

The Tower accuses the passing of time on the external walls and requires a conservative restoration. This is why, by linking the past with the future, the “Fondazione Salva la Torre” association was born, in order to raise funds to restructure and maintain this little wonder of our history, the history of everyone.

I ask everyone for help! We all have the opportunity to save a place with an important historical and artistic value, but above all a place that has been at the heart of many people. Together we can make the difference and bring the Tower to become a witness of history in the future, for another thousand years.

[ITALIAN]

Sono Domenica Bussetti e come voi ho un luogo che mi sta molto a cuore, un luogo che rischia di non resistere al passaggio del tempo. Questo posto è la Torre millenaria di Almese, situata sulla Via Francigena, ai piedi dell'Abbazia "Sacra di San Michele", vicino alla città di Torino, e rappresenta un magnifico patrimonio per la storia del nostro Paese, testimone di eventi che hanno costruito il nostro passato.

La Torre accusa il passare del tempo sulle pareti esterne e richiede un restauro conservativo. Ecco perché, collegando il passato con il futuro, è nata l'associazione "Fondazione Salva la Torre", al fine di raccogliere fondi per restaurare e mantenere questa piccola meraviglia della nostra storia, la storia di tutti.

Chiedo aiuto a tutti! Abbiamo tutti l'opportunità di salvare un luogo con un importante valore storico e artistico, ma soprattutto un luogo che è stato nel cuore di molte persone. Insieme possiamo fare la differenza e portare la Torre a diventare testimone della storia nel futuro, per altri mille anni.

 

An ancient story, the history of everyone

The "Save the Tower Foundation" association has the purpose of raising funds for the restoration and the maintenance of this wonder of our history, the history of everyone.
Years ago I decided to give the Tower free loan to the municipality of Almese because the whole community and tourists from all over the world could enjoy our historical and artistic heritage.

Thanks to the commitment of the municipality and the help of the volunteers, the tower can in fact be visited up to its seventh floor and the terrace and today is home to cultural events, exhibitions and artistic performances.
Unfortunately, given the problems on external walls, the risk of falling of some fragments is real and it is necessary to put it in safety so that it can continue to be used by the community.

This is why I decided to give life to the crowdfunding campaign, in order to raise funds for the most urgent recovery interventions.

This, unfortunately, is only a first step because the conservative restoration intervention is very big, but it is important because it would make it safe and usable again for years to come, allowing us to preserve the heritage of our fathers to future generations.

[ITALIAN]

L’associazione “Fondazione Salva la Torre” ha lo scopo di raccogliere fondi per il restauro e il mantenimento di questa meraviglia della nostra storia, la storia di tutti.

Anni fa mi sono determinata a dare la Torre in comodato d’uso gratuito al comune di Almese perché tutta la comunità e i turisti da tutto il mondo potessero godere di questo nostro patrimonio storico e artistico. Grazie all’impegno del comune e all’aiuto dei volontari la torre è infatti visitabile fino al suo settimo piano e alla terrazza e oggi è sede di eventi culturali, mostre ed esibizioni artistiche.

Purtroppo, viste le problematiche sui muri esterni, il rischio di caduta di alcuni frammenti è reale ed è necessario metterla in sicurezza perché possa continuare ad essere usata dalla comunità.

Per questo ho deciso di dare vita alla campagna di crowdfunding, per poter raccogliere fondi per i più urgenti interventi di recupero.

Questo purtroppo è solo un primo passo perché l’intervento di restauro conservativo è molto grosso, ma è importante perché permetterebbe di renderla di nuovo sicura e utilizzabile da tutti per gli anni a venire, permettendo di conservare per le generazioni future l’eredità dei nostri padri.

 

Your help, our thanks

Thanks to the help we receive, we will proceed with the restoration and security of the Tower, which we have already asked for some estimates.

We hope to get enough help to be able to ensure the safety of all facades, as this would reduce the costs for the restoration. For example, most of the cost involved in the intervention is represented by operations, such as the construction of scaffolding, which are necessary for each of the facades of the tower. However, if we do not reach the full amount necessary for a complete restoration of the tower, every contribution will be used for the maintenance and restoration of the Tower, starting from the smallest things to the most demanding jobs. Every contribution is important to us and helps us to envisage a better future for the tower. Details below:

  1. Upon reaching € 40,000 - Securing and renovation the most degraded portions of one facade ; 
  2. Upon reaching € 60,000 - Securing and renovation the most degraded portions of two facade ; 
  3. Upon reaching € 90,000 - Securing and renovation the most degraded portions of three facade ; 
  4. Upon reaching € 120,000 - Securing and renovation the most degraded portions of four facade ; 
  5. Upon reaching € 150,000 - Securing and renovation the most degraded portions of four facade and Securing and consolidating the crowning of the terracotta arches.

Each goal achieved is a better future for the Tower!

 

[ITALIAN]

Grazie all’aiuto che riceveremo, procederemo con il restauro e la messa in sicurezza della Torre, di cui abbiamo già chiesto alcuni preventivi.

Speriamo di ottenere abbastanza aiuti da poter provvedere alla messa in sicurezza di tutte le facciate, poiché questo permetterebbe di diminuire i costi per il restauro. Ad esempio, la gran parte del costo previsto per l’intervento è rappresentata da operazioni, come la costruzione dei ponteggi, che sono necessarie per ognuna delle facciate della torre. Tuttavia, qualora non raggiungessimo l’intera cifra necessaria per un restauro completo della torre, ogni contributo verrà usato per il mantenimento e il restauro della Torre, partendo dalle cose più piccole ai lavori più impegnativi. Ogni contributo per noi è importante e ci aiuta a prospettare un migliore futuro per la torre. Di seguito i dettagli:

  1. Al raggiungimento di € 40,000 - Messa in sicurezza e restauro delle porzioni maggiormente degradate di una facciata; 
  2. Al raggiungimento di € 60,000 - Messa in sicurezza e restauro delle porzioni maggiormente degradate di due facciate; 
  3. Al raggiungimento di € 90,000 - Messa in sicurezza e restauro delle porzioni maggiormente degradate di tre facciate; 
  4. Al raggiungimento di € 120,000 - Messa in sicurezza e restauro delle porzioni maggiormente degradate di quattro facciate; 
  5. Al raggiungimento di € 150,000 - Messa in sicurezza e restauro delle porzioni maggiormente degradate di quattro facciate e Messa in sicurezza e consolidamento del coronamento degli archetti in cotto.

Ogni goal raggiunto, è un futuro migliore per la Torre!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't help economically, but they can still make the difference! For us it is very important that we talk about the campaign and the Tower of Almese so that as many people as possible come to know and talk about our project and, who knows, one day they come to visit the Tower.
Remember to share the link to the campaign on your social networks and send it to your friends!

[ITALIAN]

Alcune persone non possono aiutare economicamente, ma possono comunque fare la differenza! Per noi è molto importante che si parli della campagna e della Torre di Almese perché più persone possibili ne vengano a conoscenza e parlino del nostro progetto e, chissà, un giorno vengano a visitare la Torre. 
Ricordatevi di condividere il link alla campagna sui vostri social network e inviarlo ai vostri amici. 

 

Historical and cultural details

 

  • The history of the Tower and of the fortified village

 

  • The trial for witchcraft

 

  • The legend of the hidden treasure
 
  • How to visit the tower and the beauties that surround it
story_txt:
We all have places that make us who we are

I’m Domenica Busetti and like you all I have a place that is really close to my heart, a place that risks not to resist the passage of time. This place is the millenary Tower of Almese (Torre di Almese), collocated on the Via Francigena, at the foot of the Abbey “Sacra di San Michele”, near the city of Turin, and it represents a magnificent patrimony for the history of our Country, testimony of events that have built our past.
The Tower accuses the passing of time on the external walls and requires a conservative restoration. This is why, by linking the past with the future, the “Fondazione Salva la Torre” association was born, in order to raise funds to restructure and maintain this little wonder of our history, the history of everyone.
I ask everyone for help! We all have the opportunity to save a place with an important historical and artistic value, but above all a place that has been at the heart of many people. Together we can make the difference and bring the Tower to become a witness of history in the future, for another thousand years.

[ITALIAN]
Sono Domenica Bussetti e come voi ho un luogo che mi sta molto a cuore, un luogo che rischia di non resistere al passaggio del tempo. Questo posto è la Torre millenaria di Almese, situata sulla Via Francigena, ai piedi dell'Abbazia "Sacra di San Michele", vicino alla città di Torino, e rappresenta un magnifico patrimonio per la storia del nostro Paese, testimone di eventi che hanno costruito il nostro passato.
La Torre accusa il passare del tempo sulle pareti esterne e richiede un restauro conservativo. Ecco perché, collegando il passato con il futuro, è nata l'associazione "Fondazione Salva la Torre", al fine di raccogliere fondi per restaurare e mantenere questa piccola meraviglia della nostra storia, la storia di tutti.
Chiedo aiuto a tutti! Abbiamo tutti l'opportunità di salvare un luogo con un importante valore storico e artistico, ma soprattutto un luogo che è stato nel cuore di molte persone. Insieme possiamo fare la differenza e portare la Torre a diventare testimone della storia nel futuro, per altri mille anni.

The "Save the Tower Foundation" association has the purpose of raising funds for the restoration and the maintenance of this wonder of our history, the history of everyone.Years ago I decided to give the Tower free loan to the municipality of Almese because the whole community and tourists from all over the world could enjoy our historical and artistic heritage.

This, unfortunately, is only a first step because the conservative restoration intervention is very big, but it is important because it would make it safe and usable again for years to come, allowing us to preserve the heritage of our fathers to future generations.

Purtroppo, viste le problematiche sui muri esterni, il rischio di caduta di alcuni frammenti è reale ed è necessario metterla in sicurezza perché possa continuare ad essere usata dalla comunità.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

If you own a cat, then you already know the wonders and the joys that these creatures can bring into any home. If you do not own a cat, then it is imperative of you to learn about these wonders and joys. Homeless cats deserve a better life too. At the moment, however, there is a serious dearth of information when it comes to pet ownership and how you can actually help homeless cats.

Right now, we are turning to you, Indiegogo, in order to raise $12,000. These funds are going to cover the costs of developing, launching, and marketing ChapyCat.com. As a thank-you to everyone who contributes to our campaign, we have put together some outstanding rewards you can see on the right (Perks).

The Impact

In addition to the widespread, positive impact that ChapyCat.com itself is sure to make, we intend to donate $500 of the first $12,000 that we raise here to shelters and nonprofit organizations. This, of course, is just the beginning. Once ChapyCat.com is ready it will immediately make a huge impact in people's lives making them understand that you don't have to be rich to help those in need. All it takes is love and the right knowledge they can find at ChapyCat.com and we will do our best to help homeless cats together.

What happens if goal is not reached?

In case we do not make it and are unable to proceed with the website, all funds will be donated to help homeless cats in Greece. We know we can do a lot more to help cats in need if we manage to reach our goal. But in the worst scenario, all funds will go to shelters and nonprofit organizations which will be carefully chosen by us to ensure that every penny helps cats in need!

Chapy

Mom and dad never had a pet before. They couldn't see a reason why to adopt one. Until they got me. Now they love every single cat, dog, human and all living beings on Earth. I am Chapy! I am a 2 years old Japanese Bobtail cat and all I want is to make all animals and humans on Earth happy. That is why they call me Chapy! I am a happy Chapy!

What is chapycat.com?

Chapycat.com is my personal website and my goal is to make everyone smile more and be happy. I used to post funny videos, inspirational and funny quotes, how-to videos like how to brush your cat's teeth, how to help homeless cats or how to bath your cat and in general trying to share (c)hapiness!

But I have stopped posting new things because my website has many issues and needs a lot of work to be fixed. I have decided to not only to fix my website's issues but also take it to the highest level. I want to show the world that all you need to be happy is a cat! And homeless cats need love and a home.

New website's goal and features

As I said before my goal is to focus on helping homeless cats and on making people happy by understanding that having a cat or two can make a huge impact on their lives making them better people.

Make humans happy ► Happy humans make pets happy too ► Everyone is happy ► AWESOME!

Features: The new website will include a lot of new exciting content!

Thank you for your support

In order to take my website to the next level I need your support. I need to reach my funding goal of $12,000 which will pay for all expenses needed. Here's the breakdown of the funding:

Anyone can help

There is no need to donate much. Donate as much as you want and can afford. Even $1 helps. If 12.000 people donate only $1 each then our goal can be reached.

Unique perks

I wish I had a way to show you how grateful I really am for your support. Trying to find a way to say "thank you so much" I have a added a few perks I believe will make you happy! Please check the perks and choose the ones that you like the most! Thank you!

Special Donation when goal reached

When this funding campaign reaches its goal I will donate $500 to several shelters and non profit organizations who help homeless cats in Greece. If you have ever been to Greece I am sure you have noticed that there are many stray cats all over the country. Most of them starve to death or get hit by cars. Unfortunately a cat being hit by a car is a common sight here in Greece and every time it just breaks my heart. One of the goals of this campaign is to help these cats with a new section on my new website were I will encourage adoption, encourage cat neutering and support shelters and non profit organizations. Plus I will immediately donate $500 once the goal of this funding is reached.

Referral Contest

Here is our referral contest where you get the chance to get all these unique gifts for FREE. All you have to do is to grab your unique referral link from my campaign and share it with your friends and family via social media or email.

To get your unique link simply go to the top right of my campaign. 

Then click on the link button and once the popup appears simply copy your unique referral link which you can share anywhere you want. This way when someone clicks your unique link and makes a contribution I will know it was done by you. So the more see and click your link the more the chances to win many gifts.

Refer as many friends as you can and win them all!

Other Ways You Can Help

There is no need to feel bad if you cannot afford to donate. There are other ways you can help.

Beyond making a monetary contribution, you can help us by sharing this campaign with all your friends and family. Go ahead and post the URL on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and any other social media platforms you may use. The more people know about ChapyCat.com, the smoother our launch will go. We want cat-lovers and non-cat-lovers alike to know that there is a platform for them to find out everything they will ever need to know about owning a cat (or two or three!).

We appreciate all contributions, monetary and otherwise.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. The more people know about it the sooner we will reach our goal. Remember that we need only 12.000 people to donate only $1 each.
  • You can copy the link of this page and share it with your family and friends. Sharing on facebook, twitter, instagram and other social networks would really help.
  • Follow my social accounts like facebook and comment on the new posts I will add about this funding. The more comments the more people will notice this campaign.
  • You can always use the Indiegogo share tools!

Risks & Challenges

There is nothing that can possibly go wrong with this project. Once the goal is reached we will start working on the new website to have it finished as soon as possible. As I said before if the goal is not reached and are unable to proceed with the website all the mney will be donated to help stray cats.

The Chapy Family

This is the Chapy family. Me with mom and dad, Katia and Endri! Mom is a teacher and dad is a travel blogger. We live in Athens, Greece. That's why I travel a lot! Love them both very much and I am a very happy Chapy for my Chapy family! But let's listen what they have to say:

Katia & Endri: We never had a pet before. We used to think of the huge responsibility without thinking of the bright side. Until we took the final decision. We adopted Chapy about 2 years ago. He was 4 months old. The happiest years of our lives and all thanks to this little naughty bobtail cat. Yes, he is a bit naughty but in a good way. His personality is unique. From the very first day he made us happy. That's why we called him Chapy, because he is a happy Chapy. He made us so happy that we couldn't hide it and we wanted to tell everybody. We wanted to share and spread this (C)happiness. Everyone deserves to be happy and smile more and usually we find happiness where we least expect it. We found it on this little wonderful create. We never thought that a little cat would actually show us what real happiness is.

Then we decided to create a Facebook page and Instagram account for Chapy. Twitter and YouTube as well. We had to spread (C)happiness. We ought it to the world. We started with a few photos and videos of Chapy. The response was enormous. We couldn't believe it. The thing with Chapy is that he doesn't have to do anything special to make you love him and make you smile more. You fall in love with him at first sight, even if you see a photo of him while you are miles away and have never seen him in person or touch him. His fur is ultra soft, silky fur!

Then we created his website chapycat.com. The initial idea was to have a place where everyone could be happy simply by watching Chapy, his photos and videos, his how-to videos and useful information about cats. The website used to work well but then started having many issues and we had to close it. We have decided to rebuilt the website and make it 100 times better than it was with tons of new content and extra features. Our goal is to spread happiness and make everyone smile more. Thanks to Chapy we love all animals and humans on Earth. That's why we want to focus on encouraging adoption and help stray cats in Greece and all over the world. We have many stray cats in Greece and most of them starve to death or get hit by a car. We feed stray cats every day. We just wish we could do more. We wish we could afford to adopt them all. We are not sure how Chapy would feel about that though!

Chapy had health issues when we adopted him. Well, 4 days after we adopted him, he was diagnosed with fungus. Fungus is not very rare in cats, almost 50% of cats have it but only a few have the symptoms and can infect other animals and humans too. Yes, trying to cure Chapy we both got infected with fungus. We started a family treatment immediately with syrup, pills, skin treatment and a few injections. The bad thing with fungus is that it is very hard to get rid of it and the treatment lasted more than a month. The worse thing is that Chapy had to wear a cone? Yeap, the well known cone of shame. He really hated that cone and that is so obvious in the next photo. He couldn't even walk straight or use the sand box.

Our hearts were broken but we never gave up. We did our best to get rid of fungus as soon as possible. With positive energy and love we made it. Both of us and Chapy have been healthy since. If you are happy, you are healthy. Thank you Chapy!

You can copy the link of this page and share it with your family and friends. Sharing on facebook, twitter, instagram and other social networks would really help.
Follow my social accounts like facebook and comment on the new posts I will add about this funding. The more comments the more people will notice this campaign.
You can always use the Indiegogo share tools!


Risks & Challenges

There is nothing that can possibly go wrong with this project. Once the goal is reached we will start working on the new website to have it finished as soon as possible. As I said before if the goal is not reached and are unable to proceed with the website all the mney will be donated to help stray cats.

The Chapy Family

This is the Chapy family. Me with mom and dad, Katia and Endri! Mom is a teacher and dad is a travel blogger. We live in Athens, Greece. That's why I travel a lot! Love them both very much and I am a very happy Chapy for my Chapy family! But let's listen what they have to say:
Katia & Endri: We never had a pet before. We used to think of the huge responsibility without thinking of the bright side. Until we took the final decision. We adopted Chapy about 2 years ago. He was 4 months old. The happiest years of our lives and all thanks to this little naughty bobtail cat. Yes, he is a bit naughty but in a good way. His personality is unique. From the very first day he made us happy. That's why we called him Chapy, because he is a happy Chapy. He made us so happy that we couldn't hide it and we wanted to tell everybody. We wanted to share and spread this (C)happiness. Everyone deserves to be happy and smile more and usually we find happiness where we least expect it. We found it on this little wonderful create. We never thought that a little cat would actually show us what real happiness is.
Then we decided to create a Facebook page and Instagram account for Chapy. Twitter and YouTube as well. We had to spread (C)happiness. We ought it to the world. We started with a few photos and videos of Chapy. The response was enormous. We couldn't believe it. The thing with Chapy is that he doesn't have to do anything special to make you love him and make you smile more. You fall in love with him at first sight, even if you see a photo of him while you are miles away and have never seen him in person or touch him. His fur is ultra soft, silky fur!

Then we created his website chapycat.com. The initial idea was to have a place where everyone could be happy simply by watching Chapy, his photos and videos, his how-to videos and useful information about cats. The website used to work well but then started having many issues and we had to close it. We have decided to rebuilt the website and make it 100 times better than it was with tons of new content and extra features. Our goal is to spread happiness and make everyone smile more. Thanks to Chapy we love all animals and humans on Earth. That's why we want to focus on encouraging adoption and help stray cats in Greece and all over the world. We have many stray cats in Greece and most of them starve to death or get hit by a car. We feed stray cats every day. We just wish we could do more. We wish we could afford to adopt them all. We are not sure how Chapy would feel about that though!
Chapy had health issues when we adopted him. Well, 4 days after we adopted him, he was diagnosed with fungus. Fungus is not very rare in cats, almost 50% of cats have it but only a few have the symptoms and can infect other animals and humans too. Yes, trying to cure Chapy we both got infected with fungus. We started a family treatment immediately with syrup, pills, skin treatment and a few injections. The bad thing with fungus is that it is very hard to get rid of it and the treatment lasted more than a month. The worse thing is that Chapy had to wear a cone? Yeap, the well known cone of shame. He really hated that cone and that is so obvious in the next photo. He couldn't even walk straight or use the sand box.

Our hearts were broken but we never gave up. We did our best to get rid of fungus as soon as possible. With positive energy and love we made it. Both of us and Chapy have been healthy since. If you are happy, you are healthy. Thank you Chapy!

story:
What Matters Most

Farming is the largest human endeavor on earth and by 2050 we will need to feed over 2.5 BILLION more people. Which means we will have to DOUBLE our current crop production. While water scarcity, limited land availability and increasing power costs impact crop production.

Currently there are 795 MILLION people in a constant state of malnutrition around the world. This is often caused by limited water availability, poor growing conditions and non cost effective power. Our ability to site our off-grid greenhouses any time, any where can have a dramatic impact on world wide health. 

Meanwhile 45% of Fruits and Vegetables are lost or wasted. We can reduce that waste to 10% by providing a controlled growing and processing environment in our Off-Grid Solar Greenhouses. Siting them near major metropolitan areas; delivering locally grown, organic produce and creating local jobs. 

Teaming for Success

PowerGrow is made up of a team of Energy, Construction and Greenhouse experts, with over 120 years of combined experience. Our advisory board includes three of the leading greenhouse experts in the country, helping to ensure our success. 

We have a patented process to integrate solar single-axis tracking systems and integrated battery storage that give growers a sustainable growing environment and the ability to provide locally grown, organic produce anywhere in the world. Being off-grid allows us to build facilities far faster and more economically than ever before. 

Your contribution to our cause will help us complete the first two pilot sites that are already under development. On average each commercial grow operation will save over 13,000,000 gallons of water every year, compared to an outdoor grow operation. While at the same time conserving natural resources, preserving habitats, reducing waste and improving food quality.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are raising $500,000. $400,000 will go directly to completing the first three commercial projects in Utah, Hawaii and Arizona. $100,000 will be spent on general operating expenses and submitting additional patents for our thermal energy storage applications in the greenhouses. 
  • Your contributions will go directly to developing the first three sites. You will also receive   fresh, organic produce from our Partner FarmBox Direct on a monthly, quarterly or annual basis; depending on your contribution. 
  • If we don't reach the entire goal, we will still use whatever funds are raised to complete in order: the 2 Acre Utah Project, 1 Acre Hawaii Project and the 15 Acre Arizona Project.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:​

Climate Change: Because the greenhouses are completely powered with solar power and battery energy storage, we have created growing environment that uses no fossil fuels. In addition, because you can grow 800% more produce per acre in our greenhouses, we can directly impact the need to further impact rain forests and natural habitats. On average, our greenhouses will generate enough clean energy to eliminate over 15,000 barrels of oil being burned or save 46 acres of forest from deforestation. 

Water Savings: Each standard 15 acre facility will save over 13,000,000 gallons of water every year. That is enough water saved for over 1,400 people annualy. Water scarcity and water quality issues are going going to increase. We can't solve this completely, but we can make a dramatic difference in the world. 

​Hunger: Our ability to site our greenhouse operations anywhere in the world provides an immediate opportunity to help solve world hunger and improve people's health. We are already in discussions with island nations such as the Bahamas and Virgin Islands, where growing is difficult due to water scarcity, soil conditions, and unreliable power sources. 

Waste: With over 45% of all fruits and vegetables, there is tremendous opportunity to reduce the percentage of produce that is lost or wasted across the supply chain. PowerGrow can directly impact over 30% of that waste through controlled growing environments and quickly delivering locally grown produces that lasts longer and tastes better. 

Our Team & Partners

Our Team has experience developing over 200 MW of solar projects, numerous complex commercial building energy projects and developing some of the most advanced greenhouse operations in the world. 

Our Partners include growers, wholesalers and equipment manufacturers. We are in active discussions with many of the top 100 growers in the country. In fact, we already Letters of Intent from growers for over 400 acres of greenhouses. We are in the process of creating vertical integration strategies for our grower, wholesaler and distribution partners to reduce the cost of produce and speed time to market. Over the past year we have established partnerships with Philips Lighting, MetLife, tenK Solar and several other manufacturing partners to extract cost out of the construction process and help us scale the business. 

     

Risks & Challenges

There are risks and challenges that every business faces over time. PowerGrow has worked diligently to identify and mitigate all potential risks and address the challenges all new businesses face. Below is a snapshot of our identified risks and what we have done to solve them. 

Competition Risk:  While some greenhouse manufacturers may be viewed as competitors, we are in active discussions with many of them exploring partnership opportunities. Because our solar tracking system is patented we have created barriers of entry for similar solutions. This intellectual property protection will insulate us from some level of competition for the immediate future. 

Execution Risk: To ensure the success of our sites, we are working directly with leaders within the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL), University of Arizona Department of Agriculture and Biosystem and the Colorado State University Horticulture Department. These partners help ensure we leverage best practices and apply the lessons they have learned over the past 30 years, with respect to greenhouse growing processes. 

     

Financial Risk:  Because of the our ability to integrate solar energy into the greenhouse structure itself, the projects qualify for a USDA loan guarantee program. This greatly reduces the financial risk to lenders and investors in our business. Since we are effectively delivering these greenhouses as a service to growers, it is important that we only partner with credit-worthy growers who have solid balance sheets and growing experience. In addition, we place a certain amount of capital in reserve accounts to ensure each project can overcome any financial issues that arise over time. 

              

Market Risk:  Produce prices change over time. This risk is borne by our Grower partners and not by PowerGrow. The risk of crop failure or lower crop demands is mitigated greatly by the greenhouse facilities themselves. We can dramatically limit precipitation, soil and temperature issues. Pests are also more easily controlled and eliminated in controlled greenhouse growing environments. Our Grower partners can more easily adapt our greenhouse facilities for different crops based on market demand and price. This helps ensure both their success and ours. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't invest or contribute, you can still help further our cause!

  • Please get the word and share our story with your friends and social networks.
  • You can even use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your time and consideration. Join our cause and help us change the way we feed the world. Powering the Future of Food!

- The PowerGrow Team!!!

story:
Short Summary

"Gone Paddling" is An adventure documentary about 430 miles of paddling, collective impact, and the revitalization of the longest river in Wisconsin. This film is about the incredible story of how thousands of people with different agendas came together for a common goal, revitalize the Wisconsin River. The film is told through the paddling adventure of Jesse Hieb where he paddles all 430 miles of the Wisconsin River while meeting up with and interviewing the people that played a significant role in the rivers revival.

Starting September 9th producer, Jesse Hieb, will begin paddling the Wisconsin River from start to finish (430 miles). He will do it solo and unsupported on a stand up paddleboard. He will camp out each night on the river and experience all that the river has to offer.

Along the way he will timelapse some of the most iconic spots of the river, film wildlife, and interview conservationists that played a major role in the river's revitalization.

Since the river is such a positive story about collective impact we plan to take the footage from this trip and create a documentary called "Gone Paddling". It will tell the story about how these groups worked together for positive change and inspire other communities around the world to do the same. 

Your financial support will help make the post production of the documentary "Gone Paddling" possible. Although Jesse was able to self fund the 430 mile paddle and the filming of the interviews we are in need of your help to take it the rest of the way.  Luckily as an experienced film producer Jesse understands the real costs associated with bringing a film to distribution. We will be using the funding to assist with editing, coloring, licenses, and music. Additional funds will be used to help with the distribution cost associated with a film like this.


What We Need & What You Get


We need $14,900.00 to bring this film to distribution. That means we will need to take all of the footage Jesse acquires, process it, edit it, add color correction, add music, render it, and then acquire the necessary liecenses. Not reaching the goal will mean cutting back on certain things and going beyond our goal will mean having funds available to hire even better professionals and get the film distributed.


Sweet perks for sure!!

$5 - Outdoor Industry Employees 

Contributors will get a shout out during the daily Facebook live events from the river. You will also be listed in the film credits as an industry supporter. 


$10 - Nature lovers

You get a hand written post card from me while I am on the river (as long as you support before September 25th, 2016 otherwise it will be from my home in Milwaukee). You will also be listed in the credits of the film as a supporter.


$30 - Water Advocates

Get a sweet "Gone Paddling" T - shirt, A hand written thank you from while on the river (as long as you support before September 25th, 2016 otherwise it will be from my home in Milwaukee). Also a listing in the credits of the film.


$100 - Support a day Sponsor

This is definitely your best option to get all the good stuff. Besides getting the benefits of Water Advocates I will do a shout out about your company during one of my Facebook live events. You will also receive two tickets to the premier and afterparty of "Gone Paddling".


Interested in being listed as the Executive Producer, Associate Producer, or an Industry Sponsor? Contact us at hieb.jah@gmail.com to discuss what that would look like.


In the event that we don't hit the final goal then we will have to cut back on hiring some of the professionals and instead work with other less experienced professionals. If the goal is exceeded then we will be able to hire better professsionals and use some of the funds to help with distributing the film.


The Impact

There is a fresh water crisis all around the world. People are dying because they don't have clean water. Wars over water rights happen daily. When water is so abundant it is weird that this is such a problem. And when unsafe water is caused by man made problems its odd that it is so hard for us to fix the problem. 


The story about the Wisconsin river revival is a positive story about collective impact. When people hear true stories about people in our world doing the impossible it inspires them to make a difference. This film will have the opportunity to inspire others to take action and take care of the natural resources they have been entrusted with. 


This is much more than a story about a big river in Wisconsin. It is an underdog story about the impossible. A story about how thousands of people with different agendas came together and worked together for a better outdoors.


Jesse has been a film producer for over 180 film productions including one very successful feature documentary film. He has been helping businesses, organizations, and people tell their stories successfully through film and media for over 10 years. You can visit his portfolio at www.JesseHieb.com.


Telling this story in a unique way is the perfect way to raise awareness about a world wide issue. Togther we can work together to revive our fresh water resources and support the incredible outdoors. We can change communities and we can save lives just by preserving our fresh water resources.


Risks & Challenges


Some of the obstacles we face with completing this film are time and money. Creating a world class film is not cheap and it requires thousands of hours of work. I know this because it is what I do. I manage and produce films of all different types and it is hard work. The ones that people pay attention to are the ones that were given the most time and the most resources to complete. 


My plan is to first use my organizing and management skills to develope a team of industry professionals who also have a passion for the outdoors to help me tell this story and complete the post production. I will also spend hundreds hours of my own time to go through and process as much of the initial footage. This will save on professional editing hours. I will also be working with a number of friends in the music industry to compose a sound track that will be moving and professional.


Other Ways You Can Help


I completely understand that you may not be able to help financially. I get it! Would you consider helping us by sharing the video above on your social platforms? Also go to our website (www.GonePaddlingTheFilm.com) and sign up for updates! We would love for you to follow the production of "Gone Paddling"!

story:
Food Heroes

Food systems and human consumption of food are fundamental to advancing the sustainable development of our world and enhancing the livelihood of our communities.

To motivate kids to change diets, we must go beyond this knowledge to emotions. These Food Heroes need to be compellingly designed with the various talents of master storytellers. The Food Heroes curriculum was collaboratively created with world-class experts around the world across multiple disciplines- sustainability, nutrition, medicine, chefs, teachers, gamification experts, regenerative farmers, policy influencers.

Now, we need help to productize and produce the curriculum into a user-friendly format for teachers, educators, and parents. This campaign will fund graphic designers, product designers, teacher testers and a first round of printing of the Food Heroes program.

Food Heroes starts in China, but has quickly gained traction around the world. Our program is in demand in several countries, and we hope to meet this global demand as soon as we can.

 

The Impact

Today's industrial diets has largely been responsible for our personal, planetary, economic, societal and spiritual challenges. Food education is the single intervention that can help achieve all the 17 Global Goals. Yet most countries lack food education.

The skyrocketing demand for meat and dairy has begun to strain the environment, causing an increase in greenhouse gas emissions and deforestation. Three food groups alone: soy, palm, and cattle, are responsible for 80% of global deforestation, and in China a 35% jump in meat consumption from 1994-2005 resulted in the emission of 230 million more tons of CO2. Processed food and its packaging creates trash which overwhelms oceans, rivers, landfills.  Non-local food distribution, uses 4-17 times more fuel and emits 5-17 times more carbon dioxide than local food distribution. Food waste is another massive drain of crops and energy. One-third of the world’s food production is wasted, accounting for 4.4 gigatons of CO2 emissions annually. Our food systems are hurting people's health and hurting the ecosystems.

By mastering JUCCCE's Food Heroes game, kids become "Food Heroes." Food Heroes change the way their communities eat and what foods they buy. By changing the foods kids want their parents to buy for them, the demand for healthy foods shifts the food supply chain towards a more resilient and regenerative agriculture. By changing the way kids share food with others, societies heal in the way they mindfully eat with each other and are grateful for the communities that worked hard to bring the food to their tables. Food Heroes is a food education program and story-driven game with touchpoints in the classroom, at home and online. 

 

What We Need 

Funding and donations will enable JUCCCE to produce and distribute Food Heroes' education packs, a year long curriculum for kindergarten, to schools and teachers at a very low cost. Donations will directly go to the following specific projects and project items:

1) Graphic Design of the education packs- we want Food Heroes to pop and for kids to love them!

2) Translation- professional translation and translation edits for Chinese, Maori, Bahasa, Spanish and other top languages around the world. 

3) Teacher Training- we need to get teachers onboard and excited about Food Heroes. Donations will fund in person training events, teacher recruitment, and the development of an online training course.

4) Additional Product Design- we hope to surround children at school and at  home with the Food Heroes message and lessons. Developing more products, games, and toys, like flashcards, placemats, and table cloths, will help us to reach into the home and educate more families

JUCCCE

Food Heroes is a program of JUCCCE, a NGO and global consultancy, based in Shanghai and working globally. 

JUCCCE's innovative partnerships have successfully created societal-scale changes in China since JUCCCE's inception in 2007. JUCCCE is well-recognized for our multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural convening power hosting large multinational China Energy Forums to smaller ideation workshops

We have been leading the conversation around Personal and Planetary Health since 2010. Storytelling for sustainability has been a key focus of our organization's capability building since we started a seminal project to collectively visualize a new China Dream as both prosperous and sustainable. JUCCCE is known for its working across sectors and countries in order to create innovative and impactful solutions through merging different industries, experts, and viewpoints.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to contribute in other ways to Food Heroes, please reach out to us! JUCCCE thrives on the power of collaboration. Advice, feedback, introductions, partnerships are all  important parts of making a 'societal scale' difference.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
story_txt:
Food Heroes
Food systems and human consumption of food are fundamental to advancing the sustainable development of our world and enhancing the livelihood of our communities.
To motivate kids to change diets, we must go beyond this knowledge to emotions. These Food Heroes need to be compellingly designed with the various talents of master storytellers. The Food Heroes curriculum was collaboratively created with world-class experts around the world across multiple disciplines- sustainability, nutrition, medicine, chefs, teachers, gamification experts, regenerative farmers, policy influencers.
Now, we need help to productize and produce the curriculum into a user-friendly format for teachers, educators, and parents. This campaign will fund graphic designers, product designers, teacher testers and a first round of printing of the Food Heroes program.
Food Heroes starts in China, but has quickly gained traction around the world. Our program is in demand in several countries, and we hope to meet this global demand as soon as we can.

 
The Impact
Today's industrial diets has largely been responsible for our personal, planetary, economic, societal and spiritual challenges. Food education is the single intervention that can help achieve all the 17 Global Goals. Yet most countries lack food education.
The skyrocketing demand for meat and dairy has begun to strain the environment, causing an increase in greenhouse gas emissions and deforestation. Three food groups alone: soy, palm, and cattle, are responsible for 80% of global deforestation, and in China a 35% jump in meat consumption from 1994-2005 resulted in the emission of 230 million more tons of CO2. Processed food and its packaging creates trash which overwhelms oceans, rivers, landfills.  Non-local food distribution, uses 4-17 times more fuel and emits 5-17 times more carbon dioxide than local food distribution. Food waste is another massive drain of crops and energy. One-third of the world’s food production is wasted, accounting for 4.4 gigatons of CO2 emissions annually. Our food systems are hurting people's health and hurting the ecosystems.
By mastering JUCCCE's Food Heroes game, kids become "Food Heroes." Food Heroes change the way their communities eat and what foods they buy. By changing the foods kids want their parents to buy for them, the demand for healthy foods shifts the food supply chain towards a more resilient and regenerative agriculture. By changing the way kids share food with others, societies heal in the way they mindfully eat with each other and are grateful for the communities that worked hard to bring the food to their tables. Food Heroes is a food education program and story-driven game with touchpoints in the classroom, at home and online. 
 
What We Need 
Funding and donations will enable JUCCCE to produce and distribute Food Heroes' education packs, a year long curriculum for kindergarten, to schools and teachers at a very low cost. Donations will directly go to the following specific projects and project items:
1) Graphic Design of the education packs- we want Food Heroes to pop and for kids to love them!
2) Translation- professional translation and translation edits for Chinese, Maori, Bahasa, Spanish and other top languages around the world. 
3) Teacher Training- we need to get teachers onboard and excited about Food Heroes. Donations will fund in person training events, teacher recruitment, and the development of an online training course.
4) Additional Product Design- we hope to surround children at school and at  home with the Food Heroes message and lessons. Developing more products, games, and toys, like flashcards, placemats, and table cloths, will help us to reach into the home and educate more families

JUCCCE
Food Heroes is a program of JUCCCE, a NGO and global consultancy, based in Shanghai and working globally. 
JUCCCE's innovative partnerships have successfully created societal-scale changes in China since JUCCCE's inception in 2007. JUCCCE is well-recognized for our multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural convening power hosting large multinational China Energy Forums to smaller ideation workshops
We have been leading the conversation around Personal and Planetary Health since 2010. Storytelling for sustainability has been a key focus of our organization's capability building since we started a seminal project to collectively visualize a new China Dream as both prosperous and sustainable. JUCCCE is known for its working across sectors and countries in order to create innovative and impactful solutions through merging different industries, experts, and viewpoints.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you would like to contribute in other ways to Food Heroes, please reach out to us! JUCCCE thrives on the power of collaboration. Advice, feedback, introductions, partnerships are all  important parts of making a 'societal scale' difference.
 THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Summary

Many rural smallholder farmers in Africa face soil degradation and reducing crop yields. Safi Organics, in collaboration with Takachar, produces a locally made fertilizer blend from new chemical process developed at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Our fertilizer---Safi Sarvi---improves farmers' yields by up to 100% at the same price they pay for agricultural inputs by restoring their soil fertility. At the same time, our carbon-rich, biochar-based fertilizer sequesters inert carbon into the soil. Therefore, we promote regenerative and carbon-negative agriculture while enhancing the livelihood of the poorest farmers.

We have already set up a production facility in Kenya and proven the technology and product.  Currently we are serving 2,500 farmers. Recently we received an exciting offer by the Nakuru County Government to expand our services to farmers in its county fertilizer subsidy program. This contract is for payment on delivery, and as part of this campaign, we are seeking an increase in our working capital in order to deliver on an order of this magnitude. Furthermore, in order to fulfill our expanded production sustainably in the future, part of the funds from this campaign will also be used to implement MIT/Takachar's newest production prototype in our existing operation.

If you have not already checked out our video above, please see it here: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l0HUk-dpftg].

 

Problem

Rural farmers in Sub-Saharan Africa often pay 2-3 times the world price for their fertilizers, due to the fact that most fertilizers today are produced in large-scale, centralized, and capital-intensive facilities, and then shipped via long-distance transport to rural areas. Due to the farmers limited income, they can often only afford the cheapest, synthetic varieties that over the long term may actually acidify and degrade their soil due to over-dependence. As a result, some farmers have seen their post-harvest yields decrease by up to 50% in the last 20 years. This is a significant concern for local food security.

Solution

We use a combination of technology (developed at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and proprietary recipes to decentralize and downsize fertilizer production, such that it can be carried out profitably on a village-level scale using locally available resources and labor. Imagine small-scale, low-cost, mobile systems that can be latched onto the back of tractors or donkey carts, and be moved from farm to farm to enable localized conversion of agricultural residues into a fertilizer base under 2 hours without needing external energy input. This base is then mixed with our proprietary recipes to complete the nutrient as standalone fertilizer application. Our process drastically reduces the long-distance logistics needed to deliver high-quality fertilizers to farmers by producing the bulk locally. Our branded and carbon-negative product, Safi Sarvi, improves farmers’ harvest yield and income by up to 30% for the same cost that they pay for fertilizer inputs. The technology as well as the product have been proven, in the course of the past 8 years, both in the lab and in the field (data available upon request).

Achievements to Date

We have our first production facility in Mwea, Kenya, from which we currently serve 2,500 farmers. Our product has been officially certified by the Government of Kenya as a standalone fertilizer as of 2018. As of 2019, our production has reached the financial breakeven point. We are winners of prizes such as the MIT Agribusiness Prize, MIT IDEAS Global Challenge Competition, the University of California Berkeley Big Ideas Prize, and the Total Startupper of the Year.

Our Ask

Recently, we received our first government tender: the Nakuru County Government wants us to supply US$58,000 worth of fertilizers to 1,000 farmers in a ward in Nakuru County. This is a huge progress for us in achieving scale and impact.

However, there is a catch: In Kenya, the normal standard of government orders is for payment to follow verified and documented product delivery. To finance production to meet the order, we need an increase in our current working capital. To increase our production capacity to fulfill anticipated future orders like this, we will also be implementing the newest production technique from MIT/Takachar. These activities require a total of US$25,000.

The funds we raise through this campaign will reside with us as an evergreen working capital, and will allow us to grow and fulfill other tenders and large orders in the future. Once the funds have been received from this contract they will be reinvested in the business to expand and hence create more impact.

 

The Impact

Meet Mr. Kibuchi, who holds a one-hectare rice farm. Over the past 15 years, he had seen his yield reduced by about half due to soil degradation. After using our product, his input costs remained consistent, but he has seen his crop yield increased by 30%, and income increased by 50%. This was sufficient to send his two children to school, and last year, for him to afford a second-hand tractor for his farm. Amongst the 2,500 farmers that we work with, these economic gains are widely reported, even after one season of using our product. For them, our fertilizer not only restores their soil health, but also leads to better economic outcomes.

Additionally, our work creates additional rural job and income opportunities, such that youths no longer need to migrate to cities to find jobs. Meet Japhet: he is from the local village, and joined our pilot production as a worker. After 3 years, he has been promoted to production foreman, and is considering getting an MBA degree in Nairobi to further his career.

Moreover, because our fertilizer is rich in inert carbon, when one ton of it is applied to the soil, it also effectively sequesters 1.5 tons of CO2 equivalent from the atmosphere for hundreds of years. Thus, the more we supply, the more carbon we also sequester.

Specifically, your contribution will help us fulfill our delivery to an additional 1,000 farmers in the Nakuru County through the government tender. Make your pledge today and help a new rural community in Karura Ward rise out of poverty.

story:
We reached our goal with off line donations and put a roof on the Jenner VC! 

Special thanks to the Sonoma County Water Agency for add the remaining funds needed!

About the Jenner Visitor Center

The Jenner Visitor Center (JVC) is an essential piece of the region’s history and continues to be an important site that provides visitors with access to the area’s marine ecology. During the late 1940’s, the structure was the Jenner Boathouse where handmade boats were constructed. The building was located on a wharf that served as a launching point for small boats. Now, the Jenner Visitor Center is a hub for welcoming visitors and educating them about the magnificent coastal region and its adjacent natural wonders, while providing spectacular views of the Russian River and estuary.

The JVC introduces over 14,000 visitors a year to the Sonoma Coast with its series of beaches separated by rock bluffs and headlands. From the deck of the JVC where the Russian River meets the Pacific Ocean, visitors can see harbor seals, river otters, osprey fishing and bald eagles. The estuary where the Center sits is an important area for restoration studies and habitat preservation. The JVC is a small gem along 17 miles of coastline along which visitors can enjoy more than 19 miles of hiking trails, whale and seal watching and viewing of nesting seabirds. The JVC serves as the gateway to State and Regional park campgrounds and recreational activities including boating, surfing, paddle boarding, wind sailing, kayaking and canoeing. 


The JVC is important as an education and outreach hub for the newly formed Sonoma Coast Marine Protected Area (MPA) Collaborative of which Stewards is a founding member.

The Center includes a wonderful Nature Store with an excellent assortment of educational items for sale as well as interpretive displays of Sonoma Coast cultural and natural history. Revenue from the JVC Nature Store provides funding to support Stewards’ educational programming on the coast and in the Willow Creek watershed. The JVC also supports local businesses by encouraging visitors to patronize the local shops and cafes.

As time has passed, the building has aged. Now, we’ve reached a pivotal point – either we repair and restore the Center, or we close it. Our organization is committed to the restoration of the JVC as it is a beacon for visitors to gather information about the region, find respite during a trip, and foster a connection with nature.  

The Work Ahead of Us

With State Park funding in short supply for major maintenance projects, Stewards is stepping up to secure funding for and complete this project. We are not simply repairing an old structure; we are working to save the life of a thriving center that provides educational information about the region and services to more than 14,000 visitors a year. While a range of building improvements are needed over the next 3 to 5 years, our immediate fundraising goal is set at $16,000. These funds will be used to replace the roof and stabilize the back deck in time for this fall and winter, which are likely to be El Niño seasons. 

We raised over $13,000 which was enough to put a roof on the building. 

As we implement these critical building repair measures to ensure that the JVC doors remain open, we’re planning for the next phases of restoration work– fully rebuilding the deck; replacing the siding, windows and doors; adding ADA accessibility features; and eventually raising the building out of the flood zone, which will protect the building for the long-term and support estuary restoration efforts. 

Why Your Support is Important

  • The Jenner Visitor Center is strategically located at the north end of Sonoma Coast State Park to help visitors learn about and experience the coast as well as the redwoods and other natural wonders in the area.
  • The JVC provides a home base for experienced staff and volunteers to share their knowledge and passion about the region to park visitors. From travelers looking for directions, to those eager to learn about the natural history of the Sonoma Coast, to local kayakers checking on estuary conditions, the Center is an important resource for the region.
  • By keeping the JVC open, we are ensuring the unique vantage point for observation and access to the mouth of the Russian River will remain easily accessible.
  • An open JVC means support for local businesses and continued revenues from the Nature Store to fund Stewards’ educational programs.
  • The JVC will become increasingly important as an education and outreach hub for the newly formed Sonoma Coast Marine Protected Area (MPA) Collaborative of which Stewards is a founding member.
  • Keeping the Jenner Visitor Center open can only be done with your help.
Let’s work together to ensure that the Jenner Visitor Center gets the immediate repairs it needs so that this special place can remain open. 


About the Stewards of the Coast and Redwoods

For the past 30 years, Stewards of the Coast and Redwoods has worked with California State Parks to preserve the iconic Redwoods and Pacific coastline in the Russian River region. We are a non-profit centered on conservation through environmental education and stewardship of 29,331 acres of coast, redwood groves and park lands, including Armstrong Redwoods State Natural Reserve, Austin Creek State Recreation Area (SRA),Sonoma Coast State Park and the Willow Creek watershed. We are a leader in interpretive programs focused on conservation and wildlife/habitat preservation and in training over 300 volunteer docents/stewards who give 10,000 hours annually and who come in contact with 110,000 visitors. Our programs and people work to increase visitor awareness and appreciation for the Russian River region.

Stewards of the Coast and Redwoods works diligently to preserve awe-inspiring acres of land and shorelines, and to provide engaging educational programs. The Jenner Visitor Center is a critical link that connects these conservation efforts to park visitors.

story:
The Soil is Alive with YOUR support!

We wrote a song in partnership with 4-H to excite youth about soil science! Soil science is particularity unique in that it integrates STEM topics such as physics, chemistry, entomology, microbiology & geology, which can all be difficult to teach in the classroom, especially if hands-on activities are limited. However, if youth are introduced with  appropriate modalities, such as animation and music, soil science serves as a well rounded platform to enhance Science Technology Engineering & Mathematics goals. Our song combined with vivid and scientifically relevant animation will support teachers seeking outside resources. 

This is a not-for-profit initiative aimed at creating a short video that provides a one-of-a-kind teaching tool to STEM educators, at no cost to them. We need your help to bring it to reality.

Our animators Tynesha Foreman and Joe Paquette are excited to move forward with animating this song, but they need fair compensation for their time. Your contributions bring this song to life. 

How this Song Came to Be

(Click here to listen)

The Soil is Alive is a song written by University of Maryland Alumni,  Spencer and Max Ernst, and Tony Dimeglio, as part of a fun introduction to soils for middle schools enrolled in a 4-H program called Adventures in Science. 

The song was an afterthought inspired by the Ernst brothers as a way to turn a standard PowerPoint presentation on soil formation factors into something the students could actually get into--and they did!  The voices you hear in the song are the students, and with the help of numerous sustained hours in the studio Spencer and Max were able to professionally remaster the classroom recording into a catchy song with modern beats.    

When we brought the song to life, we had no idea it would retain such educational value. We shared it with several middle and high school teachers and they unanimously agreed that it needs animation to become a teacher-friendly classroom tool.  

Our rough storyboard inspired by the song:

Why are we so excited to animate the song?


Scientists are still scratching their heads about life in soils. There is so much that needs further explore to fully understand soils role in supporting food systems, life for important ecological niches, sustaining healthy air quality and climate cycles, & reducing hazardous waste. For young minds to dream a curiosity for soil science, we have to spark their imagination--and what a better way than with an animated video. Whether their curiosity for soils leads an award winning STEM fair project, helping out at a local garden, or getting into college, this animated sing-along will propagate that first step into inquiry,

Legendary soil chemists, Dr. Bruce James, sees value in animating this song. 


The Team:

We are diverse in life experiences, education and upbringing. This diversity builds a team that works cohesively to bring this song to life. 

Music and Melody

Tony Dimeglio - Environmental Science - University of MD 2013  & Virginia Tech Entomology Graduate Student (M.S. Candidate 2016)

The soil enthusiast who had the idea to use music in the classroom to excite youth about soils

Animation

Our animators Tynesha Foreman and Joe Paquette are working so well together already and cannot wait to animate this song. 

Tynesha has a knack for character development, stop-motion and mixed media. She'll bring life into the animation. Joe is talented with digital media, overlaying natural textures and adding lighting effects. He is key for creating the setting for Tynesha's characters. 

Check out some of their work below:

Tynesha Foreman  - Maryland Institute College of Art


Joe Paquette - George Mason University


Here are two original works from each animator to illustrate the overall vibe to their synergistic talents: 

Joe Paquette (life-like additions to the animation)


Tynesha Foreman (2-D theme)


How your money is spent:

We are a group of artists and scientists personally investing time and limited financial resources into this project. Our goal is to see this song come to life, but we need to raise the last remaining funds to take care of our animators; they will not move forward until we reach our minimum goal.

Your contributions are allocated to covering the minimal amount needed to compensate our artists. Tynesha and Joe split the final amount raised evenly. They are eager, bright emerging animators leaping into science animation careers. Other animators would charge at least five times our funding goal, but Tynesha and Joe see promise in this animation, and are ready to animate after we reach our goal.

Please donate and take advantage of our limited supply of prizes.


We truly appreciate your support! 


This will not be just another YouTube video on the internet:

The Entomological Society of America posted a short blurb about this project on EntomologyToday; please check it out:

http://entomologytoday.org/2015/07/08/animation...

We are traveling to Minneapolis, MN in November 2015 to present the project to entomologist, horticulturalists, agronomists and soil scientists at a National conference joined by American Society of Agronomy, Entomological Society of America, Soil Science Society of America, and Crop Science Society of America. This is a big event and expands the visibility of the film and message.

An internet release of the final film will make a wide appearance on World Soils Day (December 5th, 2015).

To reach an influential adult audience our video will be submitted to the 2016 Environmental Film Festival in Washington, D.C.; a teacher packet guiding educators will shortly follow in the Spring. We welcome other invitations and ideas to promote the video to science educators.


Please let us know if you have any questions or ideas on collaborations.


With sincerest appreciation,


Tony Dimeglio


Photography by Morgan. H West - morganhungerfordwest.com. 

Interview videos by Sam Janesko- samjanesko@gmail.com
story_txt:
The Soil is Alive with YOUR support!We wrote a song in partnership with 4-H to excite youth about soil science! Soil science is particularity unique in that it integrates STEM topics such as physics, chemistry, entomology, microbiology & geology, which can all be difficult to teach in the classroom, especially if hands-on activities are limited. However, if youth are introduced with  appropriate modalities, such as animation and music, soil science serves as a well rounded platform to enhance Science Technology Engineering & Mathematics goals. Our song combined with vivid and scientifically relevant animation will support teachers seeking outside resources. This is a not-for-profit initiative aimed at creating a short video that provides a one-of-a-kind teaching tool to STEM educators, at no cost to them. We need your help to bring it to reality.Our animators Tynesha Foreman and Joe Paquette are excited to move forward with animating this song, but they need fair compensation for their time. Your contributions bring this song to life. How

story:
Discover the perfect solution for keeping paint in your surroundings clean when you choose Bucket Buddy 2in1, the ultimate bucket bag.

Advantages & Benefits

Prevent paint from drying out due to oxygen exposure with our product. When you securely place our liner over a filled bucket of paint, the elements stay out, which helps your paint retain its color and last longer.

Great Job-After-Job

The Bucket Buddy 2in1 liner completely lines the interior of your standard paint buckets, ensuring the tightest seal and security. This eliminates the need to clean your bucket with water or washing solvents since our product captures all excess liquids. In addition, since our liner covers the entire interior of the paint bucket, new paint remains free from debris and residue left behind from previous paint jobs.

Environmentally Friendly

The Bucket Buddy 2in1 liner proves to be an environmentally friendly product by eliminating the need to wash paint pigment, solvent chemicals, and flaky, dry paint chips down the drain and into our water drainage systems. The liner also saves gallons and gallons of water used to wash the paint buckets.

BENEFITS

The Bucket Buddy 2in1, made in Palmdale, California, is a uniquely designed, disposable paint bucket liner. It does not matter if your bucket is new or used, these liners protect and keep paint from getting out and allows you to switch colors in seconds.

Unlimited Benefits


Cleanup is fast and easy when you use our bucket liners. You will save money on buckets and help the environment worldwide by using less water to wash them out. In addition, by using Bucket Buddy 2in1 liners, there will be no more:

•Contaminating Our Environment Due to Washing Paint Buckets
•Homeowner Workers or Employees of Contractors Washing Paint Buckets on Wasteland or Real Property
•Paint or Foreign Substance Products Entering into Our Water Drainage Systems
•Pouring, Splashing, and/or Splattering Paint or Foreign Substance Products on All Surfaces
•Cleaning Paint Buckets in Extreme Weather Conditions: Hot, Cold, Rainy, and Windy
•Wet Clothes or Shoes from Stepping in Paint Puddles and/or Foreign Substance Product Puddles
•Washing Time Cleaning Paint Buckets after Every Use

FEATURES AND DIRECTIONS

Manufactures of durable, yet flexible plastic material 7.0 mils painters plastic (low density polyethylene) the Bucket Buddy 2in1 liner is a tubular shaped bag boasting a round, flat base. Our product is designed to rest flush against the bottom of the paint bucket with the sides of the bag configured to line the walls of the paint bucket. A stretch-elastic banding runs the length of the bag's opening, securing the unit in place over the mouth of the paint bucket.


  1. Insert liner and mold to bucket
  2. Fold lip of liner around mouth of bucket
  3. Pour product into liner
  4. Pull lip of liner away from mouth of bucket to release excess air between liner and bucket (if necessary)
  5. After use, empty bucket content into container
  6. Remove liner and allow drying before disposal
  7. Overnight or during breaks, apply second liner cover bucket to prevent contents from drying

About Us

The days of paint splashing everywhere and causing a mess are over thanks to the Bucket Buddy 2 in1. This is a revolutionary paint bucket liner and a complete game-changer for homeowners, commercial painters, and all professionals who need reliable liners for large projects. Through extensive research, we’ve determined low-density, 7.0 Mils polyethylene is one of the secret ingredients that goes into producing these miracle workers. Please help us today to benefit from our creation.

About Christopher

The Bucket Buddy 2in1 was invented by Christopher McNeil. He said "There is no mess, no fuss, and no clean up when the Bucket Buddy 2in1 is utilized. Every painter whether he or she paints professionally for themselves, a subcontractor, or a Do-It-Yourselfer, will recognize the benefit of no clean up which is typical of the disposable inserts for paint buckets with this product. A great point is there is no washing with water or solvents and it saves gallons of water to rinse."

About our Perks

My apologies for the delay in perks delivery. We do not have the funds for shipping and handling until the campaign is finished. Estimated delivery of perks will be November 2015. Thank you in advance for your time and patience and I hope you love what we have to offer.  

How You Can Help

Money is needed for equipment, marketing and advertising, Public Relations, and supplies. Your support will increase the impact of our disposable paint bucket liners in addition to saving water worldwide. Please donate what you can.  

1.  Please donate to make this project succeed. You can make donations with a credit card or with Paypal. To make a donation, just click the "Contribute Now" button at the top of this page.

Contribute anonymously if you wish. When making a donation, just click the "Change Visibility" button and "Save Changes" to prevent your name or the amount of your contribution from being displayed on the campaign page.

2.  Spread the word to your family, friends, colleagues, and anyone who might welcome this enjoyable opportunity to help save the environment, water, and land!  Invite them to our campaign.

3. You can also support us by shopping at www.bucketbuddy2in1.com

Another great reason to support this campaign

Out of each $1,000,000 net of company's revenue, donations of 10% - plus will be given to Children's Outreach Funding worldwide.

Thank you so much for stopping by and to everyone who has supported this. Please be sure to check back for updates!
