story:
Donate to help us, but also yourself, future generations and our planet!

Gaia s.r.l.  was founded in Bologna, Italy, to create innovatory projects that will preserve our environment.

Modular Eolic Centrifuge is our first internationally visible project. After 5 years of hard work we are attracting global attention with an international patent released in March 2015.

            

This project has incredible potential and aims to become an alternative to current green technologies, reducing costs significantly and increasing productivity as well as expanding the possible areas where it can be installed.

Interest in this project is considerable. Proof of this is that many Italian and foreign investors have already shown their interest by making their offer.

So far we have declined all offers because we want to succeed by ourselves, with you, with crowdfunding.

This would help us keep management control over the project and give the founders and inventors of this patent major quotas.
Our main goal is do something good for the planet! In order to do that, we need  you all!

If we succeed, we'll be able to focus on preserving the planet and its inhabitants rather than on profit.

M.E.C. can be a long term solution to climate change and to expensive, polluting and non renewable fossil fuels.

Our goal is also that of helping poor areas of the planet with our technology, bringing electric power where economic interest is low. If we were to fail with crowdfunding and had to resort to private investors this intention might be lost.

The epic win is settled on 1 million euro. This would allow the company to start the project and be autonomous and active even after industrial production and engineering.

We are determined to carry out our project no matter what as we think we can help the world's population through renewable energy.

How long we have to wait before it is up and running and showing its benefits depends entirely on your support.

WE ARE READY, WHAT ABOUT YOU?

PECULIARITIES

 



Where the funds will go?

80% of funds will be used for the product.

MEC needs a complex process of industrialization and systems standardization. All components must be well defined for the industrialization to start and power plants to be active.

20% will be used for the team's work.

In these last 5 years of work, the team has been fueled by passion and the belief that it could really change things. A share of the funds will be used to reward their efforts made in research and studies, but most of all to pay back the costs of building prototypes.

The same share will be used to secure the upper hand on the competition by registering the international patent in as many countries as possible to copyright the idea and reward the consultants that have brought us so far.

The higher donations are, the faster the process will start and the sooner its benefits will be available. It will be a revolution not only for the world's inhabitants but also for the planet itself.


Founders

PERKS

Bare in mind that your donation will help not just us, but yourself, future generations and our planet.

15€ - One of Us!

Your name and that of all the others that helped us carry out this project will be on a web page. The same list will be on a plaque made for the first ever MEC turbine! Via email you will receive a certificate of your donation and of your effort to save our planet!

35€ - Wear the M.E.C., World Healer!

Get a fantastic MEC t-shirt!
Remember to tell us the size!

And other "one of us" perk gifts!


49€ - M.E.C. Trophy 

By choosing this perk you'll receive the M.E.C. Trophy!
It is a transparent plastic-made object, with silkscreen printed details and laser cutter logo.

You'll will also receive a plastic pedestal that holds the trophy vertical.

Sizes: 
trophy --> 8cm x 8cm x 0,8cm
pedestal --> 1cm x 8cm x 8cm

You will receive also the "one of us" perk gifts!


99€ - 3D printed Module reproduction

You will receive a 3D printed reproduction of a M.E.C.'s single module.
It is made in a fully-recyclable and semi transparent material.
The perk also include a 3D printed support to put on the Module! (better than the one in the photo, update will come)

Sizes: 6,8cm x 6cm x 6cm

You will receive also the "one of us" perk gifts!

189€ - M.E.C. 4x4 structure Trophy

You'll receive the M.E.C. 4x4 structure Trophy.
It is a transparent plastic-made object, with silkscreen printed details, which reproduces the modules' front, and laser cutter empty spaces.
You'll will also receive a plastic pedestal that holds the trophy vertical.

Sizes: will come soon!

You will receive also the "one of us" perk gifts!

[Photo will come soon]
400€ - Visit a real M.E.C. structure!

When construction starts you'll be able to go to any location where there is an MEC (or you can wait until one is installed near your own house!) and have a guided tour with one of our technicians who will show you the structure and its functioning. 

If you are in Italy, you'll be able to meet one of the inventors!

And you'll also receive other "Wear the MEC, world healer!" perk gifts. 

4000€ - Be part of the Start!

We will pay for a 2 night stay in Italy for two in a 3 star hotel (at least) to be at the first ever MEC turbine inauguration. You'll meet the inventors and you'll be shown on the spot all MEC's characteristics.  

The date is yet to be decided. 

And you'll also receive other "Wear the MEC, world healer!" perk gifts. 

With your donation you'll help not just us, but yourself, future generations and the planet.

REMEMBER that you could help up even after a donation:

SHARE THIS PAGE to all your friends and tell them to help us realises this dream, the dream of a clean planet, with energy for everyone in the world.

If you are in Italy, you'll be able to meet one of the inventors!
And you'll also receive other "Wear the MEC, world healer!" perk gifts.

We will pay for a 2 night stay in Italy for two in a 3 star hotel (at least) to be at the first ever MEC turbine inauguration. You'll meet the inventors and you'll be shown on the spot all MEC's characteristics.

story:
50 WAYS TO LEAVE YOUR GUZZLER

GET ON THE BUS, GUS

CLIMB ON THE TRAM, SAM

HOP ON THE TROLLEY, DOLLY

Will provide free transport for locals around the lake. Many people have moved to the area because housing prices are less. While the lake is only an hour away from everything. It is an hour away from most jobs. A day off from driving is good : 

                                          A CNG TROLLEY IS BETTER FOR ALL

story:
We are from the same family let’s start helping. No one can prepare for loss. It comes like a swift wind and taking away comfort and happiness. Our deep sympathy, condolences and prayers go out to all families affected by earthquake in Nepal. Words seem inadequate to express the sadness we feel about the loss. Stay strong and safe. God bless Nepal. Our small help can save thousands of lives. Please support this campaign. Lets use human power…
Nearly 1,000 are known to have died in a powerful earthquake. They need our support..

story:
Good day, my name is Pierpaolo Cortesi, I am 46 years old and Italian. I Worked for 20 years as a Commercial Manager for multinational company with the sole purpose of making profit. But since I became the father of a beautiful little girl (now 6 years old) maybe something has changed in my head and I've changed.  I wanted to improve the quality of people's lives and increase respect for the environment. So being a (moderate) smoker I tried to find a solution for the 10 BILLION cigarette butts littering in the environment every day. In fact in addition to the risk of fire (newest example 02/21/2015 Torch Tower in Dubai), I well understand the serious environmental damage caused by these cigarette butts, declared by many International scientific research to be highly polluting, toxic and carcinogenic. Important enough to be considered "the  main urban waste in the world "!!!

After several studies, tests and research results, I designed the first portable multifunction pocket, that would make it easier to avoid having to throw the butts into the environment. It  is named SMOOKEY with the functions of Lighting / Putting Out cigarettes (in 5") and hermetically containing butts ( Maximum 6 )  in complete safety, until the smoker finds a suitable place to dispose of them !

Pending disposal of cigarette butts, Smookey can then be kept inside the pockets of pants and jackets or bags lady, safely and total absence of unpleasant smells !!!

Because the solution of the big problem is to make it simple and fast for every smoker to manage their toxic waste (butts), in any place and moment but "immediately" and safely when they want to or have to putt out their cigarettes !!!  

Indeed, certainly the solution to the problem, is not to install an "endless number of special containers in all public places" (with obvious huge installation costs, operators for recovery and disposal, etc...), but rather using the existing bins and containers combined with the use of SMOOKEY or other accessories pocket !!!

This image below could be the result  of the environment with or without SMOOKEY.

If you are a civil and polite smoker or even a non smoker but tired of seeing this mess everywhere in the environment, "with total and absolute indifference of those directly and primarily responsible for the problem that are the Producers and Distributors of cigarettes and in the same way almost all National and International Institutions around the world, we kindly ask you :

- Help us with a small contribution to achieve the necessary funds for the realization of a mold injection plastics to 6/8 figures, in order to optimize and reduce the current  cost of production,  to make "SMOOKEY" really cheap and accessible to all and make this simple and possible innovation public knowledge !!!!!

 - If you can not in any way contribute to this project of social benefit and protection of the environment around us, thanks anyway if you help us to spread to the world the existence of "SMOOKEY" and then make it public knowledge, as a possible solution to the serious problem universally shared, in order to improve the environment for all of us and in particular for our children !!!

 The links and images below document the size of the problem and the environmental impact !!!

http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0117393

http://www.theguardian.com/environment/2014/may/15/ban-cigarette-filters-hazardous-tobacco-waste

                                                                                        http://www.yourcommonwealth.org/2015/01/15/awareness-can-help-end-cigarette-littering/

http://www.nationalgeographic.it/ambiente/2015/02/09/news/mozziconi_di_sigaretta-2478177/

http://www.tobacco.org/tagged/litter

However a few videos (hundreds available on Internet) about environmental problem !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TpSWsMaof-g

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9QjiLxIHk30

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=izbbnaL4b0I

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=izbbnaL4b0I

Indeed, awareness of the problem is increasing and many Countries have already established new laws and penalties for offenders, such as Singapore, USA, Australia, Japan, UK, France and others including Italy from July 2015, but this not enough !

If you really want to change all this environmental disaster .................... the solution easy, fast and safe now there is and its called SMOOKEY  !!!

This (picture below) is in fact what is now ESSENTIAL for a smoker to have with himself for  "smoking comfortably respecting the environment".

* That is, the package of cigarettes and lighter contained within SMOOKEY  !!!!!

 .... then disposal  

The image below is an example of containment capacity of Smookey  :

> open and empty  > then opened with max. 6 butts inside (2 crushed in the larger chamber)  > finally with lid closed tightly all content !!! 

* In addition, the chamber shutdown larger can be used for ashes of cigarettes or chewing-gums.

Look at some examples of Smookey, in graphic (both sides) available in assorted colors, because it's not only useful but also " DESIGN & FASHION" :

 

 

 

 

Presentation of SMOOKEY at the International Fair SABO in Rome (ITALY).

Color range available in the "Neutral Version" (without graphics and excluded lighter BIC Mini J25 or compatible) :

Example of packaging for the "Neutral Version"(without graphics and excluded lighter BIC Mini J25 or compatible) for possible customizations and/or realization promotional gadgets, etc...... quantity possible 40 units; 80 ; 400 ; 800 or over :

For sale to the public are available displays from 20 units each in assorted colors and graphics :
 

For any further information and detail about please send email to :

info@onoffcigarette.com

- Our web site is :    www.onoffcigarette.com

We are only a small company with a great idea and a project to which "we devote all our energy day by day" to improve the quality of life people and the environment.

- Moreover, it appears unbeliveble that "NO ONE" between Media, National and International Institutions, Manufacturers and Distributors of Tobacco sector, etc... communicate or publish "at least the existence" of this simple and possible solution to a problem so serious shared around the world !!!! 

With greater force so if you feel this project worthy and deserving .......

HELP US TO MAKE IT HAPPEN !!!

Pierpaolo Cortesi 

Inventor of SMOOKEY and General Manager On-Off Cigarette Srl (Italy).

Risks and challenges :

The risks are in eve thing we do, but we have worked hard to avoid them.

Here are some of the key areas we've covered :

DESIGN :  The design has been conceived in order to obtain a product "all in one" easy to use, pocket-size and multi function, minimizing the costs of production.

PRODUCTION :  The production is conducted by a local manufacturer with proven experience. This means that we are in place for checks on production and quality control. We have worked hard to optimize our project with of course my 2 Partners Santo and Salvatore, the Designer Nicola and toolmaker Drusiani, before production.  *In any case, with obtaining the necessary funds, it will be possible the realization of a new mold to multiple figures with further improvements technical-functional and strong reduction in the current cost of production.

SUPPLY CHAIN :  Smookey is designed to remove complexity and optimize the production process.  As a result we haven't need assembly, multiple suppliers, offshore manufacture, etc....

DISTRIBUTION :  Often the best ideas/products/projects fall precisely because of the difficulty of distribution. The current difficult global economic situation makes it even more difficult initiatives to promote and push radically innovative products and therefore "not known and obviously not distributed". In response to this big problem then,  if  SMOOKEY is somehow known,  understood and like getting, it can be sold as  slight  (only 24gr.) and small (only 8x5x1,5 cm), and sent in small quantities around the world, in a normal envelope, minimizing the cost of packing, shipping and distribution.

FAQ :

- Smookey has a slot for insertion of a Lighter  BIC Mini J25  (the  most commercialized in the world) or other compatible size.

- The same Lighter can be easily extracted and replaced when finished gas.

- The only clarification, if the smoker has crushed too the filter during use of the cigarette, before insertion into the camber off slightly re-round the filter/Butt to maximize ease the fall of butts during disposal.

- For any further details, questions or requests, please send an email to :

  info@onoffcigarette.com

HELP US TO MAKE IT HAPPEN !!!

story:
Who We Are and What We're Doing

As seven Harvard students organized under the name “Harvard Climate Justice Coalition,” we allege that the Corporation’s funding of global warming harms its students and future generations, and that Harvard’s leaders have a duty to divest the university’s endowment from the reckless activities of the oil, gas, and coal industries. On November 19, 2014, we sued the Harvard Corporation to compel it to withdraw its investments from fossil fuel companies. On December 10, Defendants served us with their Motions to Dismiss. On January 5 and January 6, we served Defendants with two memoranda in opposition to their motions to dismiss. There will be a hearing on Defendants' motion to dismiss in the Suffolk County Superior Courthouse, and all are welcome to attend in support!

We’re bringing this case by ourselves, without lawyers, because we believe that every one of us has a responsibility to confront the reality of climate change. That reality has arrived; it poses and will continue to pose serious dangers to the most vulnerable among us. Unless and until institutions like Harvard act to stigmatize the root causes of global warming, we will remain addicted to a system of energy production and economic injustice that guarantees catastrophe. Our university has a legal obligation — and, more importantly, a moral duty —to stop profiting from human suffering and environmental destruction. Our lawsuit simply asks Harvard to live up to its centuries-old promise to promote “the advancement of youth.”

What We Need & What You Get

The costs of filing the lawsuit came to a total of close to $3000 dollars. Our partner organization, the student-run campaign Divest Harvard, paid that cost upfront, but the campaign for fossil fuel divestment on Harvard's campus can only continue with your help. Help us raise this money by our first appearance in court on February 10! 

If you donate:

Any amount- If you are comfortable, we'll post a thank you on the lawsuit's Facebook page!

$20- We'll post a thank you on Facebook and mail you a handwritten thank-you note!

$100- Facebook post, mailed note, and we will  make you a short video thanking you for your contribution!

$200- Facebook post, mailed note, thank-you video, and we will send you a copy of the lawsuit signed by all seven plaintiffs!

Join Us! 

Sign our petition, available at www.divestlawsuit.org! If you're local, join us at our first court hearing at the Suffolk County Superior Courthouse (date coming soon). Questions? Email us at harvardclimatejustice@gmail.com, and learn more about the fossil fuel divestment campaign on Harvard's campus at www.divestharvard.com. 

Our funds are managed by the Better Future Project. All donations are tax deductible!

story:
This Full Length Version of Synthetic Forests and the 4-minute trailer are available at
asilentforest.info

Our documentary provides an investigation into the devastating effects GE trees could have on our health and the environment.  With increasing public awareness and our work together we stop these trees before they are released.

Please help us show Synthetic Forests Worldwide!

It is critical to translate Synthetic Forests into Portuguese, Spanish, Chinese and other languages, as well as mail DVDs internationally so our message travels as far and fast as possible.

Your donations to our first Indiegogo campaign made it possible for us to produce Synthetic Forests and to now provide it free online. Please share it widely with by emailing a link to the film with Facebook or other social media.


How your contributions will be used in our second campaign

Our  2007 video, A Silent Forest, was successfully distributed on DVDs in English, with Spanish and Chinese subtitles. And hundreds of thousands of people worldwide learned about genetically engineered trees while watching the film at online sites. Beginning with translations to Portuguese, Spanish and Chinese, funded with your help, millions of viewers will see GE trees for the disaster they are. Please consider supporting our film with a donation to help create translations and subtitles in Portuguese, Spanish and Chinese.

How your contributions were used in our first campaign

We completed many hours of research and traveled to shoot amazing interviews. Your tax-deductible donations were critical for filming, editing and post-production as well as graphics and a limited run of DVDs.  But there is much more to do…as you can see the difficult work of film making is completed thanks to your donations. We now need your help to get the word out as fast and far as possible and to translate Synthetic Forests so that people all over the world can understand the dangers that are on lurking at their doorstep.  Together we can stop this worldwide threat to our health and our environment.

From the Director:

"I have been making environmental documentaries for more than 20 years. When I made Food for Thought in 1998, it was one of the first videos to tell the story of the dangers of GMOs. Then, Raindancer Media, Global Justice Ecology Project, Three Americas and Earth Links, in 2007 jointly produced A Silent Forest in which scientist David Suzuki passionately and eloquently warned us about GE trees. Now with GE trees in the ground for testing and the pending release of many genetically engineered tree species for fruit and fuel, we made Synthetic Forests to bring its cautionary tale up to date." 

—Ed Schehl

"The rush to apply these ideas is absolutely dangerous because we don't have a clue what the long term impacts of our manipulations are going to be..."

— Dr. David Suzuki, from our 2007 film, A Silent Forest -The Growing Threat of Genetically Engineered Trees.


Synthetic Forests features interviews with leading scientists and activists who share their insights and experience on the negative effects genetically engineered trees can have to communities, ecosystems and indigenous peoples.

Corporations in the US and Brazil have requested government authorization to release hundreds of millions of genetically engineered eucalyptus trees for fuel and pulp. We have recently learned that the GE Loblolly Pine and Arctic Apple have been approved by the USDA, so the time to act is now!

GE Pollen can drift hundreds of miles!

If communities do not learn about, organize and STOP the requested unrestricted release of 500 million GE eucalyptus trees or the Loblolly Pine, inhaled pollen could perhaps take away our choice to live GMO free, FOREVER.

Here are links to some of the organizations fighting the development and introduction of GE trees.  Go to their sites and type GE Trees or Genetically Engineered Trees into their website search function:

  • The Campaign to STOP GE Trees
    stopgetrees.org
  • Center for Food Safety
    centerforfoodsafety.org
  • Institute for Responsible Technology
    responsibletechnology.org
  • World Rainforest Movement
    wrm.org.uy
  • Indigenous Environmental Network
    ienearth.org
  • Biofuelwatch
    biofuelwatch.org.uk
  • EcoNexus
    econexus.info

See our website, SyntheticForests.info for links to excellent reports on Genetically Trees produced by the Center for Food Safety and STOP GE Trees.

Please make your Tax Deductible Contribution Now.  We have a matching grant of $1,000 that will double the first $1,000 in contributions.

If you would like to donate by check, go to: SyntheticForests.info

Whether or not you are able to donate, please share a link to our campaign through social media and emails. 

Thank you for watching Synthetic Forests!

make your Tax Deductible Contribution Now. 
We have a matching grant of $1,000 that will double the first $1,000 in contributions.
If
you would like to donate by check, go to: SyntheticForests.info 
Whether
or not you are able to donate, please share a link to our campaign through social media
and emails.  
Thank
you for watching Synthetic
Forests!

story:
There are over 1400 food plants that give us the nutrition we need to survive. Of those 1400, 80% of them need pollinated to produce the fruit and crops we enjoy!

My wife and I already raise Monarch butterflies to help increase their population so we have more pollinators. Raising Monarchs is virtually free. We go out in nature and find eggs, chrysalis and butterflies to raise them. Raising them inside improves the survival rate of an egg being hatched from 2%-5% to around 90%!

This is the reason we want to raise honeybees! Honeybees pollinate constantly to feed themselves and they also produce honey! But, unlike Monarchs, beekeeping takes a little money. Once established, a good apiary can fund itself and beyond.

On average, a hive will produce 50 pounds or more honey! What will we do with this honey? We will sell it to get more equipment to have more honeybees and the cycle will be repeated each year.

The funds that are donated will be used to buy all the equipment needed to start a hive, sustain the hive and to harvest the honey and package it for sale or perks. The funds will also pay for fees associated with this campaign.

If by chance we raise more than the asked amount, we will put those funds towards more hives and bees! That would be great!!!

So we hope you will find it in your heart to help us out and get our bees going! Thanks for your interest and for stopping by.

The following is a breakdown for what the money will be used for:

  1. Hive - $261 Hive comes ready to go and is expandable to 2 more supers
  2. Veil & Hat - $21.00 For protection
  3. Smoker - $32.00 Needed to calm bees
  4. Frame Grip - $10.00 For removing frames full of honey!
  5. Extractor - $200 For removing honey from frames
  6. Strainer - $6.00 To strain wax etc from honey
  7. Honey Jars - $15 For putting fresh stained honey in to sell
  8. Bees & Queen- $200 This price is variable and is determined by demand
  9. Perks and Fees - $55.00 For paying fees for campaign and shipping and perks

 Total - $800

  • So what happens after this campaign? Well, it will take a couple of years, but the growth of the apiary is priority. The following are goals for the near future:
  • Growth of apiary to 20 hives
  • Set up program to teach local students the importance of pollinators like the honeybees and butterflies.
  • Expand the product list from honey to also include bee wax products like candles and lip balm.
  • With expansion of apiary, also plant host and nectar plants for the Monarch butterfly to help increase their population. This will also give pollen source for the honebees too.
  • And maybe.....a small butterfly house may be planned down the road too!

Thanks again for your support an please share this campaign with your friends and family!


April 27, 2015 - Wow! This campaign is off to a great start so far! At the rate it is going, there will be no problem meeting the goal $800! Thanks again!!!


May 6, 2015 - With less than three weeks to go in this campaign, please share this campaign with all of your friends and family and ask them to do the same! Thanks!!!

story:
There is no doubt that  nowadays  we could hardly imagine our daily lives, without petroleum products, from transport to clothing, we can find products that we owe to the existence of oil. However, the petroleum extraction, processing and transportation has a many sources of danger to the environment and thus for humanity. Firstly from human irresponsibility, to the destructive power of nature, can cause oil disaster, which can cause serious and long-term damage to our living environment, the economy and society.

When oil spill occurs, there are various products in use removing the pollution. However, the problem with these products is that in many cases, whether the oil spill or a variety of chemicals and oil sorbents itself pose a greater damage on the environment. Therefore it is very important that the substance which we use for oil remediation is environmentally friendly, which do not cause further harm to the environment.

We offer the latest generation Oil Resist - our oil absorbent product, which is an important step forward in protecting the environment. Not only can it be used as a future oil spill response, but also can eliminate the existing contamination which has already occurred.


It's always difficult to introduce a new product to the market, but we are committed to our goals and we are all making efforts to make our project successful.

Our campaign is designed to fundraise financial support and to spread the word about Oil Resist to people and organisations, who find it important to protect the environment and who may support us with our aims and goals.



Who we are


TECDRY group was established in 2014, mainly due to the production and distribution of Oil Resist, which is made of 100% natural raw materials. With a greater emphasis being placed on the environment and the importance of protecting it, Oil Resist should be taken seriously as it provides a treatment which not only protects it also removes pollutants. We are dedicated beyond the production and distribution of Oil Resist as we do further development with our technology finding new applications to be used as widely as possible.



What Oil Resist is

Oil Resis is a fine powder with a 100% natural origin. It is capable of adsorbing of a wide variety of oils and oil derivatives, whether of plant, mineral or synthetic. The Oil Resist strongly binds the oil and this binding will be kept either dry or aqueous ambience. Furthermore it is suitable to remove oil stains, cleaning oily surfaces, areas and equipment, and can be used for remediation of oil contaminated soil.

The main content of Oil Resist is caustic lime - calcium oxide (CaO) - as well as the different plant derivatives. The lime is widely used in: construction industry (mortar, environmentally friendly whitewash), food industry (acidity regulator), pharmaceutical (anti-inflammatory). Due to the nature of its alkalinity it neutralizes the acidity, reducing the greenhouse effect. In agriculture it is used as an environment-friendly slug and worm killer as well as an excellent fungicide.

The discovery of Oil Resist is a fabulous story. Our enthusiastic team conducted research to develop an environmentally friendly waterproof additive, primarily for the production of waterproof plaster (used in construction). This work is mainly focused to modify the widely used lime making a water resistant additive. The developed material showed excellent hydrophobic properties during testing and made the plaster, plasterboard and the concrete to be waterproof.


During the tests, a certain amount of powder accidentally fell down onto the floor, which was oil contaminated. When the floor was cleaned up the powder surprisingly removed the oil as well. The explanation is that the hydrophobic substances has a non-polar structure - such as oil, so the powder and the oil excellently attract each other. And as it has a very high specific surface area (about 25 m2 / g) it can be adsorbed in high amounts of oil.


Oil Resist features:

  • High specific surface area, it means very porous → high oil adsorbing capacity

  • Low specific gravity - lighter than the water and floats on the surface

  • Ease of use

  • 100% hydrophobic

  • Environmentally friendly material - doesn’t contain any ingredients that are harmful to the environment

  • High thermal stability can be used against burning oil or fuel

  • Quickly eliminates the volatile hydrocarbon vapors, thus greatly reducing the risk of explosion!

  • If the oil has been already adsorbed to Oil Resist, the oil will not cause more damage to the environment. This means there is more time clean up operations

  • Can be integrated with existing technologies as well as machinery and equipment

  • Technology for the processing of residual materials are environmentally friendly.


The area of remediation

Using Oil Resist on Water


Perhaps the biggest challenge with oil spills is when it happens on the water surface. The main first task of oil spill response is to locate it quickly and prevent the oil spill spreading further, and the contamination reaching the shore. Then the oil removal can begin. Because the oil is flammable, it is very important that the remediation technology minimizes of this risk and is environmentally friendly as well.


You can see using Oil Resist with oil spills on water in the following video. It is a fast and efficient solution for remediation, the adsorbed oil does not have further pollution on the environment and the final oil and Oil resist mixture will float on the surface which can then be removed by skimming and after that, processed in an environmentally friendly manner.


Using Oil Resist on dry surfaces

Oil Resist effectively collecting oil on dry surfaces. Suitable for industrial use, oil spill response at road accidents or any oil contamination of remediation during oil refining process. Simply sprinkle Oil Resist on to the oil, wait a few minutes until the oil is absorbed, then clear it up with a rough brush and a shovel. The fine-grained dust does not scratch the surface. See the following video:


Using Oil Resist on wet surface

As you saw Oil Resist can be used either in water or on dry surfaces. In the following video you can watch how to collect diesel in these conditions.



Other applications

Oil stain removal with Oil Resist

Oil Resist consists of very small particles that can penetrate into the irregularities of the surface and trap the tiny oil drops. It can be supported by a small amount of water to unbind the oil, using Oil Resist to remove oil stain is an effective environmentally friendly solution. Suitable for cleaning any hard even porous surfaces such as concrete, paving and tiles. You can see the process in the following video:


Removing algae and moss

The lime has been known as an excellent long-lasting fungicide, it is an environmentally friendly solution removing algae and moss from patios, pathways or driveways.

Just add a small amount of powder to the surface, scrub with a wet brush for a few seconds and wash the surface with water. You do not need chemicals!



Cleaning and anti-slipping method for greasy surfaces

We can use Oil Resist for making an anti-slip surface at a greasy workplace . Sprinkle the powder on to the floor, leave it until sweeping up at the end of the day. The powder collects the existing oil-grease particles and binds all oil generated during the day giving a safe, non-slippery surface for the day. Environmentally friendly solution for the safe working area.


Cleaning oil tanker

The oil tankers used to be cleaned internally by high pressure water with a special developed equipment. We can use Oil Resist for cleaning the oil contaminated water in site saving cost and water usage as the cleaned water reusable.


Remediation of oil contaminated soil

As it is known, the oil is able to pollute large areas depending on its structure - especially encouraged by rain and groundwater washing. The oil-contaminated soil is unable to bind oxygen, thereby preventing the growth of plants, and also preventing the oil contaminated soil to be moisturized and stock water.


There are more technologies for remediation of oil-contaminated soil, our studies aim was to find ways how to adopt the use of Oil Resist to existing technologies.  This importance is highlighted by the recent oil pipeline injury at south of Israel at Eilat-Ashkelon oil spill where millions of gallons of oil was spilt in the national park area. The restoration of the disaster is expected to take several years.


In our laboratory experiments we investigated how we could apply Oil Resist into the remediation of oil-contaminated soil. The following examples illustrate some of the possible ways of use.


Soil washing


The technology is based on where the soil is washed with water, thereby reducing the concentration of the pollutant. The main problem in this, is that the tiny oil droplets mixed in the water and is difficult, time consuming and expensive and many case it's not possible to clean the water in site.


In the first experiment, we mixed well the oil-contaminated sand with water, then separated the contaminated water from the sand. We added Oil Resist to the contaminated water then mixed well again. The Oil  Resist has a very small (approx. 5 microns) particles powder, which easily absorbs oil droplets in water. About 20 minutes later the water cleared and the Oil Resist and oil mixture floating on the water where it could be easily removed by skimming. The purified water can be recycled. The skimmed Oil Resist can be reuse until the entire saturated has been reached.


We mixed the Oil Resist and the oil contaminated sand in dry stage at our second experiment. The Oil Resist with its effective oil adsorbing capacity could pick up the oil from the sand during the mixing. After the stirring was completed, we added water and mixed well. Since the Oil Resist floated up as it lighter than the water even saturated with oil, after 20 minutes the oil and Oil Resist mixture could be easily removed by skimming. As a result, we got clean sand and water. The Oil Resist can be reused until it is fully saturated with oil.


The mixture is the oil-saturated Oil Resist powder. As mentioned earlier, the adsorbent is made of only natural ingredients, so the powder does not has any dangerous effect for the environment. The mixture can be incinerated and the energy can be recovered, and also we have some successful experiment where we could recover the oil itself.


Stabilisation


In some cases the remediation is focused to stabilize or neutralize the oil in the soil. The Oil Resist absorbs the oil, the oil and the powder particles have a strong molecularly bind whereas the powder itself is hydrophobic, so this binding remains in an even contact with water. If we mix Oil Resist to the oil contaminated soil, the powder absorbs the oil and neutralizes its environmental impact. As the Oil Resist is environmentally friendly material, no further harmful effects to the environment.



What our long-term plan is with Oil Resist


Oil Resist is such an environmentally friendly material that it can be applied successfully in many areas, mainly due to the efficient oil adsorbent and water repellent properties. Application of Oil Resist provides an opportunity to adopt into the existing technologies, replacing those materials for the same purpose, which can be potentially harmful to the environment.



What we already have done


The Oil Resist formulation and technology is patented since 2010. There are available all necessary permits, quality certificates (TÜV, EMI) and safety data sheet  for the production and trading. There are available the full technology and equipment and the production has begun. There are two options for delivery: 15 kg bag and 1 ton big-bag  container. Councils, fire services, garages use it for oil spill response and cleaning oil contamination in Slovakia and the surrounding countries.

We created our own Oil Spill Kit, which we offer for on the go. The kit includes 4 x 2 kg Oil Resist, scraper, brush, shoe covers, mask, gloves and a special shovel with a sieve in the middle.


We already have presented the Oil Resist at several forums, and we are very proud of achieving  great success everywhere, because it offers a truly revolutionary and environmentally friendly solution. Trials were taken to  the Slovak and Hungarian National Rescue Service where they have been successfully tested on water and  land. Currently we are working on being listed in their service.

Progress has been made in a number of using Oil Resit in remediation of oil contaminated soil adopting it to the existing technologies.


Organisations and communities who can support us


Today there are a lot of people, companies and organizations living in "Green" eco-friendly lives who not only take care, but also take the appropriate steps to protect our future and the next generations. We are happy to hear from all those who are able to stand with us in this fight, and who are able to support us. Please let us know if you have any question, we have a great incentive for your support - an experiment set which contains samples to see with their own eyes the usage of this environmentally friendly material..


What is our target for fundraising and what we need it for


Although Oil Resist has a great feature for oil adsorbency and its associated manufacturing technology is ready to be widely known and used, it needs further development in a number of areas. To do this we need to keep presenting, taking part at shows and  exhibitions, we need to promote our Oil Resist in different widely known forums. Experts must be involved at the development process to work out the exact technology, and develop environmental studies proving the benefits of using this material. In addition, we need to achieve those potential customers who buy and use this product.

We need a lot of time and also some money and we believe that we can find those partners who will help us in this task and recognize the great potential of the Oil Resist. We believe that with this material we can contribute to the protection and the possible repercussions of natural disasters as much as possible to limit the environmental impact. Our campaign designed to achieve a minimum of 15,000 Pounds, which can support us to introduce into the wide market and financing a variety of research for Oil Resist.



What our plan is after the first step


We do not plan to stop the developments after market introduction, there are some ideas for different application areas that require further research. We are planning to finance them from our own resources, which will be covered by selling Oil Resist..



And finally let's have a fun ....


Oil Resist has a highly hydrophobic property and makes the particulate material such as sand or sugar hydrophobic as well by adding as an additive. You can try it yourself with our test kit, as you can seen in the following video:


Thanks for your support!

Share our campaign with people who may support us as well!

Share our campaign with organisations who stand next to us!

Share our campaign with people who may be interested in this!

Share our campaign with experts who can support us with any advice!

You can try it yourself with our test kit, as you can seen in the following video:Thanks for your support!Share our campaign with people who may support us as well!Share our campaign with organisations who stand next to us!Share our campaign with people who may be interested in this!Share our campaign with experts who can support us with any advice!

story:
Short Summary

There comes a time when the useful life of an oil rig comes to an end, at least when it comes to drilling for oil, and that's when we dive in! We are not your typical diving duo. We are marine scientists and co-founders of Blue Latitudes LLC, who dive on active oil rigs to explore the artificial reefs that thrive below the surface. 

The $15,000 from this Indiegogo Campaign would enable us to travel, scuba dive and visually document oil rigs that are functioning as artificial reefs in the Gulf of Mexico and California. The sites we will explore are proofs of concept, and largely unknown to the outside world. With this funding we will assemble a team of underwater, aerial, and interview videographers to create a mini documentary on re-visioning the decommissioning process through the Rigs to Reefs program in California. 

This short film will investigate the pros and cons of repurposing abandoned offshore platforms as artificial reefs to enhance biodiversity and fisheries productivity in California. Our purpose in creating this film is to empower the public and policy makers to make informed decisions on Assembly Bill (AB) 2503, the "Rigs-to-Reefs" bill, which is up for legislative debate in California. AB 2503 encompasses 23 of the 27 platforms scheduled to be decommissioned in the next 2-10 years.  


This is a three part project.

Part 1: Scotland, June 2015 

We will be presenting at the second largest Conference on Offshore Oil and Gas Decommissioning in Scotland, this June. Attending this conference is a unique opportunity to network with international oil company representatives and consulting professionals. We will publish our first paper as a result of collecting and processing information from this conference. These industry connections and published paper will be essential in creating a network and audience for our upcoming mini documentary on Rigs to Reefs in California. 

Part 2: Gulf of Mexico, July 2015 

Aboard a NOAA vessel, we will dive converted platforms functioning as artificial reefs in Texas Flower Gardens National Marine Sanctuary. This expedition will include other scientists, directors of both the Texas and Louisiana Artificial Reef Program and oil company representatives. The purpose of this expedition is to get regulators (i.e. government agency personnel) together with the regulated (oil/gas platform owners) in an environment where issues of policy, management, and ecology can be discussed. 

Part 3: California, August 2015

Armed with the experiences of how to successfully implement a Rigs to Reefs Program in the Gulf of Mexico, where oil rigs have been converted to reefs for the past 30 years, we will embark on the second part of the expedition, diving coastal California platforms. 

The Impact

California has entered a new era of outer continental shelf oil and gas activity. With 23 of 27 platforms due to be decommissioned in the next 2-10 years, the decommissioning of California's offshore oil and gas facilities into artificial reefs is rapidly becoming an issue of public concern, scientific study, and policy debate. 

Oil companies have long been perceived as the enemy, while bustling ecosystems exist quietly below the surface. Converting these rigs to reefs provides a silver lining to the realities of offshore oil and gas development.  

We are on a mission to reveal the ecological and economic value of converting these rigs to reefs. Through our media outreach, public lectures, and blog posts for National Geographic, we strive to empower the public to make informed and responsible decisions regarding the ocean and its resources. 

Knowing is key. As the National Geographic Explorer-in-residence, Dr. Sylvia Earle, once said, "with knowing comes caring, and with caring there is hope for the future of our oceans."


What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown:

  • $5,000 for travel expenses (Scotland, r/t), conference fees, and accommodations. 
  • $3,000 for travel expenses (Gulf of Mexico, r/t), including flight, accommodations, and boat travel. 
  • $7,000 for documentary costs, including underwater, aerial and interview videographers. 
  • That's a total of $15,000
Perks!
  • Incredible underwater photos, framed in recycled wood frames.
  • A private, guided underwater snorkel tour of California's kelp forest in La Jolla.
  • The opportunity of a life time to join Rig2Reef Explorers on a private, guided, underwater tour of oil rigs in California.
  • Post Cards with epic rig photos sent to you with a personalized thank you note from Rig2Reef Explorers.
  • 30% off Matuse vintage products. 

Risks & Challenges

Diving on these oil rigs, found in a blue ocean setting, is challenging, both physically and logistically. But Emily and I are qualified to overcome these hurdles. We are both certified scientific divers by the American Academy of Underwater Sciences (AAUS) and in the past two years we have dived on and documented 7 of the 27 platforms off the coast of California. We are also certified in CPR/FirstAid/O2 and covered by DAN insurance. 

Rig2Reef Exploration is a project managed by Blue Latitudes, LLC. We are accepting funds through a fiscal sponsorship with National Geographic Explorer-in-residence, Dr. Sylvia Earle's, 501(c)3 non-profit, Mission Blue. This means all donations made to Blue Latitudes LLC are tax deductible.

story:
Ambelopoulia is a controversial dish of pickled or grilled songbirds served in some Cypriot restaurants. They are trapped by indiscriminant methods (e.g., mist nets and limesticks), often combined with the broadcasting of recordings of bird calls over speakers to attract the birds.

Bird trapping is an illegal, non-selective and cruel practice that is still used extensively in Cyprus and which involves the large-scale and indiscriminate killing of thousands of birds of over 150 different species, including many endangered ones.

These trapped birds are offered illegally in restaurants as a ‘delicacy’ at prices ranging from 40-80 euros (or more) per dozen and is now a lucrative business of millions of euros, controlled to a large extent by organised crime.

The main idea of our project is to help fighting with bird killing by cutting the demand for this ‘delicacy’ and creating the awareness in island's guests' minds through tourism infrastructure promotional campaign.


Who we are and what we want to do
Being a couple of young professionals with big experience in tourism sector of Cyprus economy we still keep being strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development of the island. More hotels and nice beaches must not necessarily mean more great habitat for migrant birds being destroyed, more restaurants and tavernas must not mean more songbirds being trapped and killed.
With respect to all that is being done by local and international NGOs, we want to approach to the problem from another side: to run an agressive media campaign to fight the demand for Ambelopoulia in local restaurants through tourist channels of the island:
- Airports media channels
- Digital signage in hotels
- Public transport media
- Informational blocks in island maps
- Informational stands and leaflets in main points of tourism interest
- "SAY NO To Ambelopoulia" signs in local tavernas and restaurants
- etc
The quantity and width of the channels and the lenght of the campaign will depend on the funds raised with your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

No matter if you could contribute or not, we kindly ask everyone who cares to support the work of local and international NGOs such as
birdlifecyprus.org
terracypria.org
You can choose any way of support that is ok for you, every LIKE matters.
Some more tips for Cyprus future visitors:

1.  Talk about your enjoyment of birds with local Cypriots. Many of them will be confused or bemused that you watch birds but don’t eat or shoot them, but most will listen at least. Open their minds to the possibility.

2.  When you come to Cyprus and go to a local tavern, ask if they serve ambelopoulia. You have to ask, because they are smart enough not to put it on the menu (they know that it’s technically illegal). If they serve ambelopoulia, walk out, and tell them why. If they don’t, enjoy the restaurant – traditional Cypriot food is quite good.

3.  If you’re from the EU, write to your local EuroMP about the issue. Brussels can do more to put pressure on Cyprus to end poaching.

4.  Become a ‘supporting member’ of the BirdLife Cyprus anti-trapping campaign. It costs only €5 and is valid for one year.


We kindly ask you not to forget to share our campaign through  Indiegogo share tools.
Any possible contribution is welcome! For generous contributors we will purchase some great perks from birdlifecyprus.org to say "Thank You" to you and support birdlifecyprus.org to do what they do. It means you help twice))

Robin © Steve Round from the surfbirds galleries

story:
FEED EARTH NOW is a sustainable start up with a unique process that converts commercial food waste, by the addition of naturally existing microbes, into a soil nutrient. The name of this environmentally valuable product is “Terreplenish.”

The beginning for this company started when Cathy Scratch, the founder of FEED EARTH NOW, discovered in her work as waste consultant that a downtown Chicago hotel's waste stream generated more than seven tons of waste a week. That’s equivalent to sending 2.5 elephants in volume to a landfill each week! This discovery sparked an interest and a passion within Cathy to find more sustainable options for food scrap recycling. 

After many years of research and discussions with top industry experts and Agronomists, Cathy developed a unique way to repurpose food waste into a beneficial soil nourishing substance.

Terreplenish:

*Increases the available nitrogen to plants for growth

*Restores soil microbiology

*Reduces water usage for irrigation demands

*Improves plant health in organic agriculture

More importantly, Terreplenish makes it easier for conventional farmers to break their reliance on the use of harmful chemical nitrogen and pesticides thus ensuring safer food and water for us all!

Our Goal at FEED EARTH NOW:

We are currently recycling thirty (30) tons of food scraps each week at our production facility in Poplar Grove, Illinois. We have the capability to increase our recycling capacity to fifty (50) or more tons per day. This would enable 350,000 acres of farmland to be treated with our certified for organic use Terreplenish.

The problem is that our operations are outdoors and we have to stop production in winter.  With a new enclosure for our production and a heat source for round year production we can reach our goal, but we need your help!

THE REQUEST: $95,000

Construction: $55,000

  • Concrete
  • Enclosure 
  • Insulation
  • Furnace and duct work

The new construction and added heat source will allow us to process year round

Laboratory: $40,000

  • Vacuum Filters
  • Lab Ovens
  • pH Meters
  • High performance liquid chromatography machine
  • Analytical Scale
  • Anaerobic Incubators

Building out our current lab will enable us to better blend and monitor production. This quality assurance will help us:

  • Create and customize newer and more effective blends.
  • Increase the fixing of atmospheric nitrogen for plant use.
  • Control pathogens like E. Coli, Salmonella, and Powdery Mildew.

COLLABORATE WITH US TO FEED EARTH NOW!

Help us finance this project! Please support our crowd-funding campaign so that we can continue to FEED THE EARTH with TERREPLENISH!

You can support us by making a contribution and/or by sharing our journey with your Facebook, Twitter and email contacts. With your help and support we will meet our goal to expand our facility and increase production.

story:
Who are we?

ICOE Research Limited is a not-for-profit research firm located in Edinburgh, Scotland. 

We are a dynamic, interdisciplinary team of practitioners, consultants, research analysts, planners, engineers and scientists who promote the development and application of Environment, Health & Safety Practice in offshore Oil & Gas operations.

 

Say "NEVER!!!" to Offshore Disasters and promote Preventive Safety culture and Environmental Awareness in Offshore Operations

Marine and human lives were lost, livelihoods disappeared and billions of pounds spent in cleanup operations after Piper Alpha and Deepwater Horizon...  Two preventable offshore disasters.

The solutions to these travesties are explained in our e-book on the Principles and Practice of Environment, Health and Safety (EHS) Management in Offshore Oil and Gas Operations. The principles outlined in this comprehensive work will be transferable across all sectors and industries, and will ultimately help to create a cleaner, greener and more sustainable world for all...

The e-book will contain 59 chapters in 10 sections set in 3 volumes and is written by professionals in different fields including Ecology, Marine Biology, Law, Economics, Petroleum Engineering, Risk Assessment and EHS Management. 

http://prezi.com/lzpdudp4ybrv/?utm_campaign=sha...

From its inception, ICOE Research Limited has promoted EHS in the energy industry. Our e-book is not just an academic resource, it's a movement to promote health and safety in the workplace and increase environmental awareness worldwide. This e-book will be continually reviewed and updated, but we need your help...

 

What We Need & Why We Need It?

This project is a unique and major undertaking which requires funding to bring it to fruition.

Engaging over 50 professionals to research, write and edit this work requires effort and finance. Seventy-five percent of this e-book has been completed while 25% is being edited. But academic research requires continuous editing, illustration, graphics and use of copyright material. 

Our goal is to raise £100,000

 

You will receive these fantastic rewards for your contribution:

 

We believe in transparency

Contact us at http://www.icoeresearch.co.uk/#!contact/c1fn2 and give your input.

 

The Benefits

Who benefits from this e-book? Everyone...

"Knowledge is Power..." Increased awareness of Environment, Health and Safety (EHS) issues facilitates a cleaner, healthier and safer environment. The Marine environment is highly susceptible to accidents in offshore oil and gas operations, many of which are preventable. Moreover, only until there is a viable renewable alternative will there be a perfect solution. Meanwhile, we can mitigate against such risks.

ICOE's e-book takes a comprehensive view of EHS best practices across both technical and non-technical areas of offshore operation. 

With your help, our hope is for this publication to become the catalyst in a movement which will eventually incorporate and adapt our comprehensive EHS Principles and Practices transforming general industrial practice worldwide.

 

Team

Our Remarkable Administrative Team:

  • Williams Cairns
  • Ann Wilkie
  • Rosemary Otieno
  • Simon Scott
  • Alastair Murray
  • Vanessa Eghobamien 
  • Rhonda Hypolite 

Our Profoundly Committed Team of Section Editors and Authors 

We thank our team of over 50 academic and professional writers who have worked tirelessly to dispense their knowledge of Environment, Health and Safety Management principles which will improve offshore operations and the marine environment in the long run.

Special thanks to all who have participated in the development of this meaningful project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Join us via facebook, twitter and linkedin in our movement to make the Principles and Practice of Environment, Health and Safety (EHS) Management the standard across all industries worldwide.

If you believe in the importance of EHS please click and share the link below:

https://sway.com/U3POlybLrzSFxyL7 

Remember, one solitary call for action can become a global force for good 

Let's do the right thing...

Protect marine & avian lives and habitats

Save human lives and livelihoods

Promote preventive safety & environmental awareness 

And say loudly and proudly...

OFFSHORE DISASTERS? NEVER...  EHS, ALWAYS!!!

story:
Needs

We will require an estimated $12,000 in funding by September 1st, 2016 to pay for supplies, install as many trash cans as possible along the entire route, as well as noticeboards. The entire project will be visually captured by professional film crew that will produce a short documentary of the entire journey. 

Impact

This endeavor is unique considering the challenging long-distance trek and the environment it will be done in. There are several goals that this project would like to achieve:

  • Engage with the local communities and promote the significance of environmental awareness, cleanliness and sustainability in Pakistan.
  • Facilitate the local communities to take ownership and management of these issues by providing them with as many rubbish collection bins as feasibly possible.
  • To install signposts along the route to advocate on behalf of keeping clean. 
  • Absar is a former leukemia patient who has been proving the impossible possible ever since he was a very young child. On this trek, he wants to show how beating personal limitations & boundaries can be a satisfying feat, and can bring us closer to mother nature.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this expedition on Facebook, instagram or via email. Let all your friends & loved ones in Pakistan know. Raising awareness is the primary goal of this campaign, and spreading the word is free!
story_txt:
Needs


We will require an estimated $12,000 in funding by September 1st, 2016 to pay for supplies, install as many trash cans as possible along the entire route, as well as noticeboards. The entire project will be visually captured by professional film crew that will produce a short documentary of the entire journey. 
     
Impact
 
This endeavor is unique considering the challenging long-distance trek and the environment it will be done in. There are several goals that this project would like to achieve:


Engage with the local communities and promote the significance of environmental awareness, cleanliness and sustainability in Pakistan.
Facilitate the local communities to take ownership and management of these issues by providing them with as many rubbish collection bins as feasibly possible.
To install signposts along the route to advocate on behalf of keeping clean. 
Absar is a former leukemia patient who has been proving the impossible possible ever since he was a very young child. On this trek, he wants to show how beating personal limitations & boundaries can be a satisfying feat, and can bring us closer to mother nature.


    Other Ways You Can Help Spread the word about this expedition on Facebook, instagram or via email. Let all your friends & loved ones in Pakistan know. Raising awareness is the primary goal of this campaign, and spreading the word is free!

story:
Short Summary

We're passionate about providing bees with alternatives to being poisoned and starved by current agricultural practice. Urban beekeeping may be the way forward for these incredible insects, why not keep a beehive of your own in your backyard, on your rooftop or on your balcony? We have designed biomimetic, instrumented beehives. This includes remote monitoring using your tablet or smartphone. All the sensor information from each hive is fed to Deep Learning Cloud Servers - these servers diagnose hive health while you sleep. This makes it so easy for you to manage your own hive, when a potential problem is found, our mobile App will let you know. 

BuzzCloud was formed last year, now we are interested in measuring the appetite for our groundbreaking approach to urban beekeeping. We are not beekeepers, we have a background in electronics, environmental issues and marketing. Roger began looking into the problems facing bees early last year, Fraser joined late last year, Manuel and Darryl joined our team this summer and Terry joined us in August. 

Please visit our website at https://buzzcloud.global for more details. We will use all funds raised for fulfilling Perks and finalising the development and an initial production run of our iBuzzHive™ ready for our beta test sites. We have four beta test sites signed up. Follow us on Twitter @BuzzCloudGlobal, and check out our Facebook Group http://ow.ly/kCwb302ZgN4 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our initial goal is just $20,000 - our primary takeaway is knowing how much interest is out there. Nows the time to do something for the bees, join us! 
  • Our iBuzzHive™ comes in several variants optimised for installing on your balcony, rooftop, in your garden, allotment or in a tree. Reserve whichever flavour is best for your circumstances. (We prefer the Tree and Balcony flavours - but that's just a silly personal preference!) 

Actual Dimensions of iBuzzHive™

  • iBuzzHive™ Balcony Jar Roof (Width, Depth, Height) 46cm X 23cm X 102cm
  • iBuzzHive™ Tree Deep (W, D, H) 46cm X 46cm X 97cm
  • iBuzzHive™ Tree Regular (W, D, H) 46cm X 46cm X 96cm
  • iBuzzHive™ Rooftop Regular (W, D, H) 46cm X 46cm X 96cm
  • iBuzzHive™ Rooftop Deep (W, D, H) 46cm X 46cm X 129cm
  • Steel stand (W, D, H) 47cm X 47cm X 96cm
All our hives are manufactured to one of the common standard sizes so that you can move supers of capped honey between hives as part of your management. We will produce to the following standards: Langstroth, British Standard and Dadant. If you need an iBuzzHive for another standard please contact us and let us know. 

Make a Difference Today!

  • No bees: impacted pollination: less food diversity. Join in with us and buy one or more iBuzzHive™ so you can be among the first to recognise our individual role in saving the bees for our children and grandchildren. 
  • If you were a bee where would you choose to live? In the countryside where all your food is poisoned by pesticides and herbicides or in an urban setting where there is ample un-poisoned, delicious foraging opportunity? 
  • Join in the Natural Beekeeping crowd that's interested in gently supporting honeybee survival and wellbeing no matter where you are. 
  • Simply cannot keep your own iBuzzHive™, but want to be involved in helping the bees? Grab yourself one of our Sponsorship deals!

Risks & Challenges

  • We've got the embedded IoT electronics working already, information is flowing from hive sensors into our Cloud Servers right now. 
  • We've worked out the final recipe for 3D printing waste cardboard - or cellulose. This consumes a waste stream and it reduces our costs. Comparing like-for-like our iBuzzHive™ is stronger and weighs less than traditional wooden hives. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If its just not possible for you to keep your own hive, then join in anyway and Sponsor an iBuzzHive™. You'll get our HappyHiveApp™ and your named hive in our apiary. Please remember you are welcome to let your friends and colleagues know what we are doing too - this is a huge social community building project we are undertaking and its based on Win, Win, Win. You Win by getting in early, the bees Win by getting access to unadulterated urban nectar flow, and your children Win knowing we participated in saving the bees for them and their children. Bees foster ongoing food diversity. Please Share using the Indiegogo share tools! Join us at http://buzzcloud.global - thats where our community has its center of gravity. Feel free to follow us @BuzzCloudGlobal on Twitter too. 

Expenses

We will build ten iBuzzHives for our beta testers first in order to gain data from the real word in far flung spaces with different climates and conditions. Interested in joining our Beta Test Programme? Just contact us. Below we show a breakdown of our anticipated expenses for the Pre-Launch activities.

Team

We started off in the second quarter 2015 when Roger began the design of the iBuzzHive™, including electronics hardware and software for the hives, Cloud Servers and our mobile App. Fraser joined in third quarter 2015 and added his experience in global environmental issues. Fast forward to mid 2016 and we now have Terry Hastings, an experienced beekeeper, Manual Vieira, with his track record in Business Development, and Darryl Petch who is going to take care of our Global Service Delivery infrastructure (such as Cloud Servers and Deep Learning Servers.)

story:
THE PROBLEM

It has become VERY clear that the "powers that be" who are in charge of protecting Lake Atitlan in Guatemala are not going to get the job done. In a country rife with corruption, any governmental funds end up lining pockets and local mayors have no plan of action.

Lake Atitlan is a world treasure; regarded as one of the most beautiful places on Earth. Tourism is booming and the human population around the lake is expanding at an incredible rate. The lake itself is in a crater and has no outflow so everything that flows in, stays in. This includes raw sewage from at least 20 towns (on and above the lake) and vast amounts of chemical fertilizers and pesticides from unsustainable agriculture.

Without a bunch of grassroots efforts like this one, the scientific agency in charge of monitoring the lake, AMSCLAE, claims it will be dead within 7 years. Beyond destroying its natural beauty, the toxification of the lake threatens the livelihood of all who live here. At any given moment, roughly 20% of the population suffers from e-coli, amoebas, giardia and other intestinal pathogens. Something urgently needs to be done!


BIOREMEDIATION AS PART OF THE SOLUTION

Bioremediation is the process of introducing beneficial natural organisms into an environment to combat harmful ones. In this case, we are talking about introducing Effective Microorganisms (EM) aka good bacteria which will digest and competitively exclude the bad bacteria and pathogens. These Effective Microorganisms are the ones that would normally inhabit a healthy lake. Think of it as probiotics for the lake!

I have extensive experience in bioremediation in the U.S. I worked previously for Sustainable Community Development (the company that brought EM to the U.S. from Japan) during which time we worked with the Jefferson City Waste Water treatment plant (Capital of Missouri) as well as dozens of other bio remediation projects.  I also managed 7 private lakes along the Missouri/Kansas border.  Now, I would like to set up a first EM station in Santiago, Atitlan to combat the pathogens in the Lake.

here is a study done by the City of Los Angeles on a pond with serious e-coli problems (also one of the major problems for Lake Atitlan).
https://scdprobiotics.app.box.com/s/xgz8ewd1cfxtiq8nqn3gjhy8tnisnudp

Please take a few minutes to watch this video about EM. It says it all. 15 minutes well spent! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kJVbFmKvBvU

Here is a UNICEF case study that shows how effective EM is in sewage treatment. 

http://www.unicef.org/wash/schools/files/ICON_Case_Study_Uganda_-_Use_of_Effective_microorganism_(EMO)_for_stench_elimination_and_sludge_reduction_in_latrines.pdf 

Case study of the City of Cartagena Columbia wastewater application.  EM only had 2.5 hours of retention time and reduced TSS (Total Suspended Solids) by 68% and BOD (biological Oxygen Demand) by 66 % and total coliforms (e-coli, etc) by 91%!

https://scdprobiotics.app.box.com/s/s826kgp4kr125buf2urus7ilel6r7a3r

One major problem for local municipalities is the energy costs to run the waste water treatment plants around the lake (not a single one is operating at full capacity due to this problem). Here's a study done in India using EM with the main goal of reducing the energy costs of the waste water treatment plant by 50%. They hit the goal by achieving 54% energy costs savings as well as the always present reduction in all parameters of effluent.
https://scdprobiotics.app.box.com/s/k7mrrlue399px8pwlq0lq0httlniq6qy


THE FIRST PHASE: SANTIAGO

Lake Atitlan is nearly 25 cubic kilometers in volume and cleaning it is a huge, but necessary undertaking. The key is starting small and scaling up. This campaign will fund the construction of a first EM facility in Santiago, Atitlan. It will produce roughly 500 gallons a week of concentrated EM. This will be given to local hotels, businesses, and community waste water treatment plants to get good bacteria into the sewage systems and the lake. It will also be given to several local organic coffee farming cooperatives to help them increase their yields and encourage more conventional chemical farmers to change to organic practices (chemical fertilizer runoff is another problem facing the lake).
 

EDUCATION AS A KEY COMPONENT

This campaign will also fund the beginnings of a community outreach program that will educate the local population on the use of EM in their toilets as well as sustainable organic agriculture to combat the use of chemical fertilizers. Simple and clear educational materials will be created in English, Spanish, Kaqchikel and Tz'utujil and free workshops and educational events will be held.  

AN INTERCULTURAL COOPERATIVE EFFORT

We are working closely with locals and community leaders in many of the towns around the lake, including Tzununa, San Pablo, San Pedro, and Santiago and have many volunteers here that are contributing their time and efforts to help this project succeed.


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We need these funds to set up the project and begin Phase 1. With one facility operational, we can garner much more support from larger sources. We are asking all Lake residents to lend their support, as well as the international community since we understand the power in working together.


MORE RESOURCES ON EM
There are hundreds or articles available on EM.  If you would like to know more about it just send me a message.

If someone wants to support this on a larger scale please get in touch with me.  Obviously the studies in the links above had more support then this small crowd sourcing campaign.  I am more than capable of setting up full scale projects to address the Lakes issues.  Please, everyone, let's pitch in and do our part.  A bunch of little donations will go a long ways using this technology.  We can do this!

Please join the Facebook group
Lake Atitlan Environmental Interests

Together we can save Lake Atitlan!

Shawn Eisenhauer

Lake Atitlan Environmental Interests Group

story:
Quick Bio

Originally from the Midlands in the UK,  I am now halfway through my Zoology/Ecology degree at the University of Otago, New Zealand. I really want to take my knowledge into the field and assist with an ongoing re-forestation project as part of a Zoological study. And film a short documentary on the work that is going on; the project, the endangered species, the ecosystem and the effects of deforestation. 

I have taken several Spanish papers to compliment my degree, to enable me to work in Latin America, and I have been accepted to join a project in Costa Rica in November 2016 for 10 weeks.

We all know the damage caused by human beings to the planet everyday, it is what stems my passion for conservation, and projects like these are helping to try and recover areas to their natural state.

The Project

Cloudbridge is situated in a Costa-Rican cloud forest, on one of the highest mountains in Central America and adjoins the primary forest of Chirripo National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Reserve has three purposes:

  1. To preserve a precious part of the tropical world forever.
  2. To help reforest those areas which had been converted to cattle pasture.
  3. To Educate visitors to Protect the biodiversity for which the neotropical forests, and those in Costa Rica in particular, are so famous.

The bio-diversity in the area is outstanding and includes jaguars, peccaries (wild pigs), tapirs, spider monkeys, squirrels, tayras, frogs, reptiles and many species of invertebrates! As we speak the reserve is conducting a year long study on frogs in the area, as they are particularly sensitive to their environment. 

With such a range of biodiversity, and the time scale, I have not yet confirmed the exact research project. This will of course be finalised closer to the time and will likely focus on Reptiles or an endangered Lagomorph currently listed as data deficient, but likely endangered, by IUCN. 

Here are some examples of previous project scenarios:

A Survey of Anuran Distribution in a Costa Rican Cloud Forest

A Survey of Tropical Owl Population Density and the Vocal Behavior of the Mottled Owl (Strix Virgata) In a Partially Fragmented Cloud Forest Habitat

Effects of Reforestation on Benthic Macroinvertebrate Diversity and Assemblage in Costa Rican Headwater Streams

I have experience not only from university but also from having the opportunity to work within a Kiwi captive breeding program as part of ongoing conservation efforts here in NZ, and currently I volunteer at a local eco-sanctuary (Orokonui Eco-sanctuary). All of these skills I hope to transfer to the project in Costa Rica.

Whilst in England I studied photography and media, and with these skills I will film a short documentary on the work that is going on.

Funding

The total cost of the  trip will be about $5000, I will of course be working myself to pay for as much as possible, but I can only work part time. If I don't hit the target then you will of assisted me hugely regardless, as it leaves me less to try and work for whilst at university. 

*Any excess money will be donated to the project cause directly.

The Challenge

Of course this will be an amazing adventure, but this is not just another holiday. You are expected to work hard, and it will be long days, in constant 100% humidity, dropping to almost freezing point at night. Also, most of the locals speak no English, so it will certainly put my Spanish to the test!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially please just share with family, friends, and those who you think may want to support me to be a part of this awesome project!

Thankyou!!!
